original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug smos pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa lhag ma rnams sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyi grogs su gyur pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug smos pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa lhag ma rnams sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyi grogs su gyur pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The mention of the six perfections is because the remaining perfections are the companions of the perfections of generosity and so on.

original: 'di ltar sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin ba gsum gyis phan btags pa'i sems can rnams la bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhis bsdus pa'i thabs la mkhas pas dge ba la rab tu 'jog pa'i phyir thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni pha rol tuğŸ”½phyin pa gsum gyi grogs su gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin ba gsum gyis phan btags pa'i sems can rnams la bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhis bsdus pa'i thabs la mkhas pas dge ba la rab tu 'jog pa'i phyir thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa gsum gyi grogs su gyur pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the perfection of means is the friend of the three perfections, because the three perfections of giving and so on benefit sentient beings and the perfection of means skillfully establishes them in virtue by gathering them with the four means of gathering.

original: mthong pa'i chos la nyon mongs pa yang bas dge ba'i las la sbyor mi bzod pa nyid kyis na ma 'ongs pa na nyon mongs pa chung ba nyid du yid kyis smon par byed pa yin pa'i phyir smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni brtson 'grusğŸ”½kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i grogs su gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: mthong pa'i chos la nyon mongs pa yang bas dge ba'i las la sbyor mi bzod pa nyid kyis na ma 'ongs pa na nyon mongs pa chung ba nyid du yid kyis smon par byed pa yin pa'i phyir smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni brtson 'grusğŸ”½kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i grogs su gyur pa yin no //
translated: The perfection of vows is the friend of the perfection of effort, because one mentally aspires to have little defilement in the future, since one is unable to apply oneself to virtuous actions due to the weakness of defilements in this life.ğŸ”½The perfection of wisdom is the friend of the perfection of concentration, because one is not distracted from concentration by the wisdom that knows the faults of saá¹ƒsÄra and the benefits of nirvÄá¹‡a.

original: skyes bu dam pa la brtan pa dang / dam pa'i chos mnyan pa la brten nas lhag pa'i bsam pa stobs chung ba nyid bzlog nas gya nom pa'i khams su bsam pa'i stobs thob nas nang du sems 'jog pa'i mthu thob pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: skyes bu dam pa la brtan pa dang / dam pa'i chos mnyan pa la brten nas lhag pa'i bsam pa stobs chung ba nyid bzlog nas gya nom pa'i khams su bsam pa'i stobs thob nas nang du sems 'jog pa'i mthu thob pa'i phyir na /
translated: By relying on holy beings and listening to the holy Dharma, they turn away from having a weak higher intention and obtain the power of the attitude of the sublime state. They then obtain the power to settle their minds inwardly.

original: stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i grogs su gyur pa yin no //ğŸ”½byang chub sems @191a * //

translated: The perfection of strength is the support for the perfection of meditation, because one obtains the power of thought, having turned away from the weakness of the superior intention by relying on the holy being and listening to the holy Dharma, and having obtained the power of thought by means of the subtle element.

original: dpa' sde snod thos pa la dmigs pa sngon du 'gro bas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes rab sgrub par nus pa yin pa'i phyir ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin ba'i grogs su gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: dpa' sde snod thos pa la dmigs pa sngon du 'gro bas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes rab sgrub par nus pa yin pa'i phyir ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin ba'i grogs su gyur pa yin no //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is the support for the perfection of wisdom, because the bodhisattva is able to accomplish supramundane wisdom by means of the prior focus on listening to the scriptural collections.

original: snying po gsar ba thob pa na zhes bya ba ni snying po gsar pa dang 'dra zhing mngon par gsar pa'i bcud lta bu'i brjod par bya ba'i don chos smra ba de dang de dag gis thos par gyur pa na mdo sde 'di dag dar bar 'gyur ro
analyzed: snying po gsar ba thob pa na zhes bya ba ni snying po gsar pa dang 'dra zhing mngon par gsar pa'i bcud lta bu'i brjod par bya ba'i don chos smra ba de dang de dag gis thos par gyur pa na mdo sde 'di dag dar bar 'gyur ro
translated: When they obtain a new essence, that is, when those Dharma teachers hear the meaning of the subject matter that is like a new essence, like a newly manifest essence, then these sÅ«tras will spread.

original: zhes phyi ma dang 'brel to //
analyzed: zhes phyi ma dang 'brel to //

translated: Alternatively, it should be explained according to what was said earlier.

original: 'thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i rtsa ba thun mong ma yin pa yongs su bzung bas thob pa'o //
analyzed: 'thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i rtsa ba thun mong ma yin pa yongs su bzung bas thob pa'o //
translated: One will attain means that one attains through taking up the uncommon roots of virtue.

original: bcu gcig pa dam bcas pa'i don ci lta ba bzhin du bsgrubs pa'i yon tan bstan pa ni /
analyzed: bcu gcig pa dam bcas pa'i don ci lta ba bzhin du bsgrubs pa'i yon tan bstan pa ni /
translated: The eleventh is the teaching of the quality of accomplishing the meaning of the vow just as it is.

original: de dag gis ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag gis ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This is stated by by those and so forth.

original: sngon gyi 'phen pa'i shugs med par ji ltar sems can gyi don byed pa yin snyam pa'i dgos pa de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas /

translated: How does one benefit sentient beings without the force of previous impetus? The purpose of this is asked by why is that?

original: rigs kyi bu dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The answer is stated by son of noble family and so forth.

analyzed: yang dag par gzhag par bya'o zhes bya ba ni byang chub chen por sems bskyed pa la sogs pa la nges par sbyor bas so //
translated: One should establish means that one should definitely apply oneself to generating the mind of great awakening and so forth.

original: yang dag par bstan par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: yang dag par bstan par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sngar bshad zin to //
translated: The explanation of one should teach and so forth has already been explained above.

original: yang dag par rab tu dbye bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la @192b sogs pa bsgom pa la 'jug par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag par rab tu dbye bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la @192b sogs pa bsgom pa la 'jug par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One should thoroughly analyze means that one should engage in the meditation of the applications of mindfulness and so on.

original: rdzogs pa'i byang chub la gnas par bya'o zhes bya ba ni rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'i sa bdun la 'jog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i byang chub la gnas par bya'o zhes bya ba ni rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'i sa bdun la 'jog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One should abide in perfect enlightenment means that one should be established in the seven grounds such as the Joyous.

analyzed: smras so zhes bya ba ni smon lam gyi tshig tu brjod pa'o //
translated: One should speak means that one should express the words of the aspiration.

analyzed: slar mi ldog par bgyi'o zhes bya ba ni rnam par smin pa'i sa gsum la 'jog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One should not turn back means that one should be established in the three grounds of maturation.

original: smras so zhes bya ba ni smon lam gyi tshig tu brjod do //
analyzed: smras so zhes bya ba ni smon lam gyi tshig tu brjod do //
translated: One should speak means that one should express the words of the aspiration.ğŸ”½If the meaning is not fully accomplished even though the words are spoken, how is it that it performs the function?

translated: Because the Tathagata, knowing their pure thought,

analyzed: dam bca'i don ji lta ba bzhin du bsgrubs pa'i yon tan 'byung bas sems can ma lus pa'i don byed pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of the commitment is to be accomplished just as it is, and the quality that arises is the benefit of all sentient beings without exception. This is the meaning.

analyzed: bcu gnyis pa 'bras bu rgya chen po yongs su 'dzin ba'i yon tan ston pa ni /

analyzed: 'di ltar go rims bzhin du rnyed pa la sogs pa lhur len pa nyid kyis na /

original: sbyangs pa'i yon tan dang mi ldan pa dang 'dod chen chung ba la sogs pa nyid kyis na sbyangs pa'i yon tan dang ldan par ston to //
analyzed: sbyangs pa'i yon tan dang mi ldan pa dang 'dod chen chung ba la sogs pa nyid kyis na sbyangs pa'i yon tan dang ldan par ston to //
translated: show those who do not have the virtues of austerity, and those who have little desire, etc. show those who have the virtues of austerity.

original: dge ba dang dge ba ma yin pa'i chos nyid kyi don du rab 'byor gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: dge ba dang dge ba ma yin pa'i chos nyid kyi don du rab 'byor gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: For the sake of the nature of virtuous and nonvirtuous dharmas, the Lord says, â€œMoreover, Subhuti,â€ etc.

original: de la dge ba'i chos dang ldan pa nyid kyis na dad pa'o //
analyzed: de la dge ba'i chos dang ldan pa nyid kyis na dad pa'o //
translated: There, by having virtuous dharmas, there is faith.

original: de las bzlog pas ni ma dad pa'o //
analyzed: de las bzlog pas ni ma dad pa'o //
translated: By the opposite, there is lack of faith.

original: 'gres su bstan pa 'di nyid kyis ni stong pa dang ser sna byed pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'gres su bstan pa 'di nyid kyis ni stong pa dang ser sna byed pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: By this very teaching in verse, he teaches emptiness and stinginess.

original: 'di ltar nor yongs su gtong bar 'dod la zhes bya ba ni nyan pa po'i gtong ba dang smra bar mi 'dod na zhes bya bas ni 'chad pa bo'i ser sna bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar nor yongs su gtong bar 'dod la zhes bya ba ni nyan pa po'i gtong ba dang smra bar mi 'dod na zhes bya bas ni 'chad pa bo'i ser sna bshad pa yin no //
translated: Thus, one who wishes to give away all possessions explains the generosity of the listener. One who does not wish to speak explains the stinginess of the expounder.

original: 'di nyid kyis ni sbyin ba dang mi len pa bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di nyid kyis ni sbyin ba dang mi len pa bshad pa yin te /
translated: By this alone, giving and not receiving are explained.

original: 'di ltar snga ma bzhin du nyan pa po'i sbyin pa dang 'chad ba po'i 'dod pa chung ba nyid kyis mi len pa ston to //
analyzed: 'di ltar snga ma bzhin du nyan pa po'i sbyin pa dang 'chad ba po'i 'dod pa chung ba nyid kyis mi len pa ston to //
translated: Thus, as before, the giving of the listener and the not receiving due to the expounder's lack of desire are shown.

original: mgo smos pa dang rnam par spros pas go ba nyid kyi don du /
analyzed: mgo smos pa dang rnam par spros pas go ba nyid kyi don du /
translated: For the sake of understanding through mere mention and elaboration,

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang chos nyan ba ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang chos nyan ba ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Subhuti, furthermore, the Dharma listener... and so on is stated.

original: don khong du chud par 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni mgo smos pas go ba nyid yin pa'i phyir don rtogs bar 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: don khong du chud par 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni mgo smos pas go ba nyid yin pa'i phyir don rtogs bar 'dod pa'o //
translated: Desiring to understand the meaning means desiring to realize the meaning, because of understanding through mere mention.

original: chos kyi bar chad du gyur pas zhes bya ba ni dam pa'i chos spong bar byed @197b pa la 'jug pas so //
analyzed: chos kyi bar chad du gyur pas zhes bya ba ni dam pa'i chos spong bar byed @197b pa la 'jug pas so //

analyzed: mdo sde de dag glegs bam la sogs pa'i tshul gyis med pa'o //

analyzed: mi 'jug na zhes bya ba ni rnam par spros pas go ba nyid yin pas de khong du chud pa'i lam du mi 'gro ba'o //

analyzed: chos smra ba ma rnyed pa zhes bya ba ni chos 'chad ba dang ma phrad pa'o //

translated: If you do not wish to listen means that, due to not understanding those very dharmas such as the sutras, you are free from the desire to listen as a shravaka.

analyzed: zang zing cung zad tsam 'dod pa dang de sbyin par mi 'dod pa nyid kyi don ni chos smra ba de yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /

translated: Thus, whatever slight experience of a type of thing there is, all of that is pervaded by the omniscient mind that ascertains it merely by its existence.

original: gzhan dag dang 'brel bas yul non pa'i phyir khyab pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan dag dang 'brel bas yul non pa'i phyir khyab pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not pervasion by the mind being related to something else and comprehending the object.

original: gang gis de dag shes pa gcig gis @200b yongs su bcad pa'i dbang gis rang gi rang bzhin mtha' med pa nyid nyams par 'gyur ba shes pa gcig gis yongs su bcad ces te /
analyzed: gang gis de dag shes pa gcig gis @200b yongs su bcad pa'i dbang gis rang gi rang bzhin mtha' med pa nyid nyams par 'gyur ba shes pa gcig gis yongs su bcad ces te /
translated: But if one were to apprehend them by a single cognition, then the infinite nature of the thing would be lost.

original: de tsam gyis dngos po rnams kyi bdag gi rang bzhin spang ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de tsam gyis dngos po rnams kyi bdag gi rang bzhin spang ba yang ma yin no //
translated: But that does not mean that the nature of the thing is thereby excluded.

original: khra bo la sogs pa bkram pa na sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa'i dngos po mang po cig car shes pa gcig gis des par bya ba'i lus can rnams du ma nyid 'dor ba ma yin la phan tshun rjes su 'jug pa yang ma yin gyi
analyzed: khra bo la sogs pa bkram pa na sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa'i dngos po mang po cig car shes pa gcig gis des par bya ba'i lus can rnams du ma nyid 'dor ba ma yin la phan tshun rjes su 'jug pa yang ma yin gyi
translated: When a multicolored object is extended, a single cognition simultaneously apprehends many things, such as blue and yellow, and the object is not thereby deprived of its manifold nature.ğŸ”½But it is not that they are mutually inclusive.

original: 'on kyang de dag ji ltar yod pa de kho na ltar shes pas yongs su bcad da rang bzhin gzhan gyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang de dag ji ltar yod pa de kho na ltar shes pas yongs su bcad da rang bzhin gzhan gyis ni ma yin no //
translated: Rather, the object is apprehended by a cognition in just the way it exists, not by some other nature.

original: de bzhin du sems can dang snod kyi 'jig rten yang ji ltar yod pa nyid nyams su myong ba de kho na bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa'i thugs kyis 'dzin to //
analyzed: de bzhin du sems can dang snod kyi 'jig rten yang ji ltar yod pa nyid nyams su myong ba de kho na bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa'i thugs kyis 'dzin to //
translated: Likewise, the Buddha's omniscient mind apprehends the world of sentient beings and the physical world just as they are, in all their variety.

original: phyogs dang mtshams rnams su sems can la sogs pa'i 'jig rten du gnas pa yang mtha' med pa yin pas na /ğŸ”½mtha' med pa nyid du 'dzin gyi mtha' dang ldan par gnas par ni ma yin pas mtha' dang ldan par thal bar gal 'gyur /
analyzed: phyogs dang mtshams rnams su sems can la sogs pa'i 'jig rten du gnas pa yang mtha' med pa yin pas na / mtha' med pa nyid du 'dzin gyi mtha' dang ldan par gnas par ni ma yin pas mtha' dang ldan par thal bar gal 'gyur /
translated: The world of sentient beings and so on is infinite in terms of directions and space.ğŸ”½Since the Buddha apprehends it as infinite, how could it follow that he apprehends it as finite?

original: 'di snyam du ma lus par khas len pa mtha' yod par ji ltar mi 'gyur snyam na /
analyzed: 'di snyam du ma lus par khas len pa mtha' yod par ji ltar mi 'gyur snyam na /
translated: If you think, â€œHow could it not be the case that the Buddhaâ€™s acceptance of the world as infinite is finite?â€

original: de ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: That is not the case.

original: gang du ma lus pa 'dzin pa der nges par mtha' yod par 'dzin to zhes bya ba'i 'brel par gyur ba ci zhig yod //
analyzed: gang du ma lus pa 'dzin pa der nges par mtha' yod par 'dzin to zhes bya ba'i 'brel par gyur ba ci zhig yod //
translated: What connection is there between apprehending the world as infinite and apprehending it as finite?

original: 'di ltar dngos po ci snyed yod pa de rnams kyi nang nas thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyis ma rig pa'i yod pa nyid nyams su myong ba ni gcig kyang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar dngos po ci snyed yod pa de rnams kyi nang nas thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyis ma rig pa'i yod pa nyid nyams su myong ba ni gcig kyang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Thus, from among all things, not even one is experienced by the wisdom of omniscience as existent due to the experience of the existence of ignorance.

original: 'on kyang thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyis rig bzhin pa nyid nam skyes ba dang 'jig pa yin pas gcig kyang yongs su dor ba med do zhes bya ba 'di ni ma lus par 'dzin pa'i don yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyis rig bzhin pa nyid nam skyes ba dang 'jig pa yin pas gcig kyang yongs su dor ba med do zhes bya ba 'di ni ma lus par 'dzin pa'i don yin no //
translated: However, since the wisdom of omniscience arises and ceases while cognizing, not even one is completely abandoned. This is the meaning of â€œgrasping everything.â€

original: 'di ni de rnams kyi ye shes gcig gis khyab pa yin te gzhan du na de rnams kyi ma lus par sgrar brjod pa nyid kyang khas blang bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ni de rnams kyi ye shes gcig gis khyab pa yin te gzhan du na de rnams kyi ma lus par sgrar brjod pa nyid kyang khas blang bar mi bya ste /
translated: This is pervaded by the single wisdom of those buddhas. Otherwise, one should not accept that the expression â€œeverythingâ€ applies to them.

original: mtha' dang ldan par thal bar 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: mtha' dang ldan par thal bar 'gyur bas so //
translated: Because it would follow that they would have an end.

original: des na 'di ni cir yang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: des na 'di ni cir yang mi rung ngo //
translated: Therefore this is not suitable in any way.

original: shes pa gcig la zhugs pa'i dngos po las gzhan med do zhes de ltar yongs su bcad pa'i phyir mtha' dang ldan par ji ltar mi 'gyur zhes gang brjod pa de yang yang dag ba ma yin no //
analyzed: shes pa gcig la zhugs pa'i dngos po las gzhan med do zhes de ltar yongs su bcad pa'i phyir mtha' dang ldan par ji ltar mi 'gyur zhes gang brjod pa de yang yang dag ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not correct to say that it is finite because it is limited to the entities that are included in a single cognition.

original: shes pa rnam pa med par smra ba'i phyogs la shes pa'i bdag nyid dngos po rnams zhugs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: shes pa rnam pa med par smra ba'i phyogs la shes pa'i bdag nyid dngos po rnams zhugs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: In the position that cognition is without aspects, entities are not included in the nature of cognition.

original: 'on kyang yod pa tsam gyis @201a * //
analyzed: 'on kyang yod pa tsam gyis @201a * //
translated: However, they are known by the mere fact of their existence.

original: des rig pa yin no //
analyzed: des rig pa yin no //
translated: They are known by that.

original: dngos po rnams shes pas yongs su bcad pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis mtha' med pa nyid du khas len pa yang ma yin na /
analyzed: dngos po rnams shes pas yongs su bcad pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis mtha' med pa nyid du khas len pa yang ma yin na /
translated: It is not accepted that entities are without an end by the nature of being limited by cognition.

original: gang gis shes pa nyid kyis da rnams mtha' dad ldan par thal bar 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gis shes pa nyid kyis da rnams mtha' dad ldan par thal bar 'gyur /
translated: By what means would it follow that entities are both finite and infinite because of cognition?

original: 'on kyang yul gyi bkod pa mtha' yas pa nyid kyis /ğŸ”½snod kyi 'jig rten ni mtha' yas pa yin la /
analyzed: 'on kyang yul gyi bkod pa mtha' yas pa nyid kyis / snod kyi 'jig rten ni mtha' yas pa yin la /
translated: However, because the arrangement of objects is infinite,ğŸ”½the physical cosmos is infinite.ğŸ”½And because the number of sentient beings is infinite,

original: sems can gyi 'jig rten ni grangs mtha' yas pa nyid kyis kyang yin no //
analyzed: sems can gyi 'jig rten ni grangs mtha' yas pa nyid kyis kyang yin no //
translated: the sentient cosmos is infinite.

original: gang gis gzung ba ma yin par 'gyur ba /
analyzed: gang gis gzung ba ma yin par 'gyur ba /
translated: If it were not apprehended,

original: yul gnon pa la sogs pa mtha' med par 'gyur pa yin na /
analyzed: yul gnon pa la sogs pa mtha' med par 'gyur pa yin na /
translated: then the apprehension of objects would be endless.

original: gzung ba nyid du 'gal ba yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzung ba nyid du 'gal ba yod pa ma yin no //
translated: But it is not possible for something to be apprehended and not exist.

original: gal te mtha' yod pa nyid du mi 'dzin na /
analyzed: gal te mtha' yod pa nyid du mi 'dzin na /
translated: If the end is not apprehended,

original: thams cad mkhyen par ci ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen par ci ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: how can one be omniscient?

original: de nyid kyi phyir te gang gi phyir 'di mtha' dang ldan pa nyid du mi 'dzin pa de nyid kyi phyir thams cad mkhyen par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir te gang gi phyir 'di mtha' dang ldan pa nyid du mi 'dzin pa de nyid kyi phyir thams cad mkhyen par 'gyur te /
translated: It is precisely because one does not apprehend the end that one is omniscient.

original: gzhan du na dngos po mtha' med ba la mtha' yod ba nyid du 'dzin na 'khrul bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na dngos po mtha' med ba la mtha' yod ba nyid du 'dzin na 'khrul bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, if one were to apprehend the end of endless things, one would be mistaken.

original: 'di ltar gang yod pa de ni yod pa nyid du gang med pa de ni med pa nyid du 'dzin pa de ni thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar gang yod pa de ni yod pa nyid du gang med pa de ni med pa nyid du 'dzin pa de ni thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, one who apprehends existence as existence and nonexistence as nonexistence is called omniscient.

original: sems can dang snod kyi 'jig rten gyi mtha' yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sems can dang snod kyi 'jig rten gyi mtha' yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The end of the world of sentient beings and the world of the environment does not exist.

original: de bas na gang zhig mtha' yod par rtogs par byas pa'i med pa ni med pa nyid du mkhyen la /
analyzed: de bas na gang zhig mtha' yod par rtogs par byas pa'i med pa ni med pa nyid du mkhyen la /
translated: Therefore, the nonexistence of that which is understood to have an end is known to be nonexistence.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyis rtogs par byas pa'i mtha' med pa ni yod pa nyid du gzigs pa ni ji ltar thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa zhes bya /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyis rtogs par byas pa'i mtha' med pa ni yod pa nyid du gzigs pa ni ji ltar thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa zhes bya /
translated: The nonexistence of that which is understood by the wisdom of omniscience is seen to exist. How can it be said that it is not omniscience?

original: 'di snyam du shes pa rnam ba med pa'i phyogs la yul 'dzin par mi 'thad de /
analyzed: 'di snyam du shes pa rnam ba med pa'i phyogs la yul 'dzin par mi 'thad de /
translated: In this regard, it is not tenable that the object is apprehended in the position of non-aspected cognition.

original: de ni thams cad du bye brag med pa yin pa'i phyir de las so sor rnam par 'byed pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: de ni thams cad du bye brag med pa yin pa'i phyir de las so sor rnam par 'byed pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: Because that is always undifferentiated, it is untenable that it is differentiated from that.ğŸ”½Therefore, the position of non-aspected cognition is not to be posited because it is always faulty.

original: / de bas na rnam pa med pa'i phyogs ni dgod par bya ba ma yin pa nyid de de ni rnam ba thams cad du nyes pa dang bcas pa'i phyir ro snyam na 'di ni legs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: / de bas na rnam pa med pa'i phyogs ni dgod par bya ba ma yin pa nyid de de ni rnam ba thams cad du nyes pa dang bcas pa'i phyir ro snyam na 'di ni legs pa ma yin te /
translated: This is not good.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes ni las so sor rnam par 'byed pa mi 'dod de de'i yul dngos po thams cad yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes ni las so sor rnam par 'byed pa mi 'dod de de'i yul dngos po thams cad yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The omniscient consciousness does not distinguish objects individually, because its object is all things.

original: 'di ltar de ni sngon po nyed kyi rig ba'am ser bo nyid kyi rig pa yin no zhes mi 'dod do //
analyzed: 'di ltar de ni sngon po nyed kyi rig ba'am ser bo nyid kyi rig pa yin no zhes mi 'dod do //
translated: Thus, it is not asserted that it is a consciousness of blue or a consciousness of yellow.

original: rnam pa med pa'i phyogs la tshu rol mthong ba'i shes pa so sor nges pa'i yul 'jan pa de thams cad la khyad par med pa'i phyir las so sor rnam par 'byed pa med pa'i nyes pa yod par brjod de /ğŸ”½'di ltar 'di ni sngon po @201b nyams su myong ba yin gyi /
analyzed: rnam pa med pa'i phyogs la tshu rol mthong ba'i shes pa so sor nges pa'i yul 'jan pa de thams cad la khyad par med pa'i phyir las so sor rnam par 'byed pa med pa'i nyes pa yod par brjod de / 'di ltar 'di ni sngon po @201b nyams su myong ba yin gyi /
translated: In the system that has no aspects, it is said that there is the fault that there is no distinction of objects of individual consciousnesses that see different objects, because all of those are undifferentiated.

original: ser po'i ma yin no zhes nges pa med pas /
analyzed: ser po'i ma yin no zhes nges pa med pas /
translated: Thus, it is not ascertained that this is an experience of blue and not yellow.

original: so so'i skye bo thams cad kyang thams cad mkhyen par thal bar sgrub bar byed do //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo thams cad kyang thams cad mkhyen par thal bar sgrub bar byed do //
translated: Therefore, it is established that it follows that all ordinary beings are omniscient.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa la ni de 'dod pa nyid yin na /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa la ni de 'dod pa nyid yin na /
translated: If you assert that for omniscience,

original: de la mi 'dod pa ji zhig sgrubs /
analyzed: de la mi 'dod pa ji zhig sgrubs /
translated: what is not asserted for that?

original: de bas na thams cad mkhyen pa'i skabs su rnal 'byor gyi stobs kyis rnam pa med pa skye ba na 'gal ba med pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de bas na thams cad mkhyen pa'i skabs su rnal 'byor gyi stobs kyis rnam pa med pa skye ba na 'gal ba med pa nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, in the context of omniscience, when the aspectless arises through the power of yoga, there is no contradiction.

original: blang ba dang dor ba'i dngos po rnam par phye nas yongs su shes par mi 'gyur ro zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: blang ba dang dor ba'i dngos po rnam par phye nas yongs su shes par mi 'gyur ro zhe na ma yin te /
translated: If you say, â€œThe distinction between things to adopt and abandon will not be understood,â€ that is not so.

original: gal te dngos po mtha' yas pa cig car snang ba na blang ba dang dor ba'i dngos po rnams snang ba 'gal bar 'gyur ba'am mi 'gal na yang de gzhan dag dang lhan cig snang bar gyur pa na blang ba dang dor ba'i dngos po'i ngo bo las
analyzed: gal te dngos po mtha' yas pa cig car snang ba na blang ba dang dor ba'i dngos po rnams snang ba 'gal bar 'gyur ba'am mi 'gal na yang de gzhan dag dang lhan cig snang bar gyur pa na blang ba dang dor ba'i dngos po'i ngo bo las
translated: If infinite things appear simultaneously, then the appearance of things to adopt and abandon would be contradictory. But if they do not appear to be mutually exclusive, then when they appear together with other things, the nature of things to adopt and abandon

original: nyams par 'gyur ba'am ngo bo nyid las ma nyams na yang rnam par phye nas snang bar mi 'gyur ba'am rnam par phye bar snang yang gal te yongs su gcod par byed pa dag pa 'jig rten pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa rjes las thob par 'byung
analyzed: nyams par 'gyur ba'am ngo bo nyid las ma nyams na yang rnam par phye nas snang bar mi 'gyur ba'am rnam par phye bar snang yang gal te yongs su gcod par byed pa dag pa 'jig rten pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa rjes las thob par 'byung
translated: would either deteriorate or, if the nature does not deteriorate, they would not appear distinctly. Or, if they appear distinctly, then the subsequent conceptual consciousness that ascertains them would be a pure worldly consciousness.

original: bar ma gyur pa yin na 'di dag thams cad brjod du rung bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: bar ma gyur pa yin na 'di dag thams cad brjod du rung bar 'gyur na /
translated: If it were an intermediate state, it would be suitable to say all of these.

original: gang gi phyir 'gro ba sna tshogs pa snang ba blang ba dang dor ba'i dngos po de yang snang ba mi 'gal zhing /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'gro ba sna tshogs pa snang ba blang ba dang dor ba'i dngos po de yang snang ba mi 'gal zhing /
translated: Because the appearance of the various migrating beings and the things to be adopted and discarded appear without contradiction,

original: rang gi ngo bo nyid las ma nyams pa dang rnam par phye ba yang snang ba dang / phyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi stobs las skyes pa'i dag pa 'jig rten rnam par rtog pa'i shes pas rnam par gcod pa nyid yin pa des na de char phye bas /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo nyid las ma nyams pa dang rnam par phye ba yang snang ba dang / phyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi stobs las skyes pa'i dag pa 'jig rten rnam par rtog pa'i shes pas rnam par gcod pa nyid yin pa des na de char phye bas /
translated: and because the appearance of the undiminished intrinsic essence and the divisions appear, and because later the pure worldly consciousness that arises from the power of the wisdom of omniscience eliminates them, they are divided.

original: yongs su mi shes pa ci ltar yin /
analyzed: yongs su mi shes pa ci ltar yin /
translated: How could it be that it is not fully understood?

original: de ltar de ni re zhig rnam pa med pa'i shes pa'i phyogs la brtsad du mi rung bar bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar de ni re zhig rnam pa med pa'i shes pa'i phyogs la brtsad du mi rung bar bstan to //
translated: In that way, it has been shown that it is unsuitable to debate the position of consciousness without aspects.

original: 'on te shes pa rnam pa dang bcas par smra ba'i phyogs la rgol na de lta na yang 'gal ba med pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'on te shes pa rnam pa dang bcas par smra ba'i phyogs la rgol na de lta na yang 'gal ba med pa nyid yin te /
translated: But if you debate the position of consciousness with aspects, then in that case there is no contradiction.

original: 'di ltar ji ltar dngos po mtha' yas pa de rnam pa mtha' yas pa dang rjes su 'brel ba'i bdag nyid du yod par nyams su myong ba de bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa'i thugs de dngos po dpag tu med bar rtogs pa'i rnam pa nye bar 'dzinğŸ”½par skye ba na 'gal ba med pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar ji ltar dngos po mtha' yas pa de rnam pa mtha' yas pa dang rjes su 'brel ba'i bdag nyid du yod par nyams su myong ba de bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa'i thugs de dngos po dpag tu med bar rtogs pa'i rnam pa nye bar 'dzin par skye ba na 'gal ba med pa nyid yin te /
translated: Just as the infinite things are experienced as having an infinite number of aspects, in the same way, when the mind of omniscience arises, it holds the infinite things as its object without contradiction.

original: shes pa gcig dngos bo du ma nye bar 'dzin par skye ba mi 'gal ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa gcig dngos bo du ma nye bar 'dzin par skye ba mi 'gal ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not contradictory for a single cognition to arise holding many things as its object.

original: gcig la rnam ba du ma nyid 'gal ba kho na'o zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: gcig la rnam ba du ma nyid 'gal ba kho na'o zhe na ma yin te /
translated: If you say that it is contradictory for a single thing to have many aspects, that is not so.

original: rnam ba rnams ni bden pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam ba rnams ni bden pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the aspects are not real.

original: gal te gcig gi rnam ba don dam @202a * //ğŸ”½pa yin par gyur na ni /
analyzed: gal te gcig gi rnam ba don dam @202a * // pa yin par gyur na ni /
translated: If the aspect of a single thing were real,

original: de'i tshe gcig sna tshogs pa nyid du 'gyur bas 'gal ba yin na /
analyzed: de'i tshe gcig sna tshogs pa nyid du 'gyur bas 'gal ba yin na /
translated: then it would be contradictory for a single thing to be manifold.

original: gang gi phyir rnam pa rnams ni bden pa ma yin pa kho na'o zhes 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rnam pa rnams ni bden pa ma yin pa kho na'o zhes 'dod pa yin no //
translated: But we maintain that the aspects are not real at all.

original: gal te de lta yin na 'khrul pa'i shes pa dang ldan pas thams cad mkhyen pa 'khrul par 'gyur ro zhe na ma yin te yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su mkhyen pa'i phyir /ğŸ”½nyes pa med pa kho na'o //ğŸ”½gal te mi bden pa la bden pa nyid du 'dzin na de'i tshe 'khrul par 'gyur gyi gang gi tshe mi bden par gyur pa'i rnam pa la mi bden pa nyid du mkhyen ba de'i tshe 'khrul par ci ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te de lta yin na 'khrul pa'i shes pa dang ldan pas thams cad mkhyen pa 'khrul par 'gyur ro zhe na ma yin te yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su mkhyen pa'i phyir / nyes pa med pa kho na'o // gal te mi bden pa la bden pa nyid du 'dzin na de'i tshe 'khrul par 'gyur gyi gang gi tshe mi bden par gyur pa'i rnam pa la mi bden pa nyid du mkhyen ba de'i tshe 'khrul par ci ltar 'gyur /
translated: There is no fault, because he fully knows the way things really are.ğŸ”½If one apprehends what is not true as true, then one is mistaken. But when one knows that the aspect that is not true is not true, how can one be mistaken?ğŸ”½When consciousness, which is different from the object, apprehends the aspect that is based on the object, how can it be mistaken when it makes such conventions as seeing the object?

original: don las tha dad par shes pa la gnas pa'i rnam pa 'dzin pa na don la mthong ba la sogs pa'i tha snyad du byed ba ji ltar 'khrul ba ma yin zhen ma yin te yang dag pa'i thabs mkhyen pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don las tha dad par shes pa la gnas pa'i rnam pa 'dzin pa na don la mthong ba la sogs pa'i tha snyad du byed ba ji ltar 'khrul ba ma yin zhen ma yin te yang dag pa'i thabs mkhyen pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not mistaken, because he knows the correct method.

original: gal te 'dzin pa'i thabs su rigs pa dor nas gtso bo ma yin pa'i thabs gzhan gyis 'dzin pa de'i tshe 'khrul bar 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: gal te 'dzin pa'i thabs su rigs pa dor nas gtso bo ma yin pa'i thabs gzhan gyis 'dzin pa de'i tshe 'khrul bar 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: If, in order to apprehend the object, one were to abandon the method of reasoning and apprehend it by some other, non-essential method, then there would be error.

original: gang gi phyir shes pa rnam pa dang bcas par smra ba'i phyogs la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir shes pa rnam pa dang bcas par smra ba'i phyogs la /
translated: But in the position that asserts that consciousness is endowed with aspects,

original: rnam pa nyams su myong ba las ma gtogs par shes pa la don 'dzin pa'i byed pa gzhan med pa des na don gyi khyad par 'dzin pa'i byed pa rnam par rig pas don 'dzin pa 'khrul par ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: rnam pa nyams su myong ba las ma gtogs par shes pa la don 'dzin pa'i byed pa gzhan med pa des na don gyi khyad par 'dzin pa'i byed pa rnam par rig pas don 'dzin pa 'khrul par ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: apart from the experience of the aspects, there is no other function of consciousness in apprehending the object. Therefore, how could the function of apprehending the features of the object, the cognition, be erroneous in apprehending the object?

original: de bas na shes pa dngos po mtha' yas ba'i rnam pa 'dzin par skye ba'i phyir na shes bya bzhin du sems gcig po des kyang dngos po mtha' yas pa la khyab po zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de bas na shes pa dngos po mtha' yas ba'i rnam pa 'dzin par skye ba'i phyir na shes bya bzhin du sems gcig po des kyang dngos po mtha' yas pa la khyab po zhes brjod do //
translated: Therefore, because consciousness arises as the apprehension of the infinite aspects of things, just as there are infinite objects of cognition, the mind, as a single consciousness, pervades infinite things.

original: bdag nyid gang gis shes pa'i bdag nyid la dngos po 'jog pa de nyid du ni de'i rjes la 'byung ba nges par 'dzin pa'i sems kyis kyang yongs su rjod par byed do //
analyzed: bdag nyid gang gis shes pa'i bdag nyid la dngos po 'jog pa de nyid du ni de'i rjes la 'byung ba nges par 'dzin pa'i sems kyis kyang yongs su rjod par byed do //
translated: The very nature by which a thing is posited, that very nature is also expressed by the mind that ascertains its subsequent arising.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i sems la tshad yod pa dang rjes su 'brel ba'i dngos po gnas pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i sems la tshad yod pa dang rjes su 'brel ba'i dngos po gnas pa ni ma yin te /
translated: The existence of a thing that is related to the mind of omniscience is not limited.

original: 'o na ji zhe na yod pa nyams su myong ba gang ji snyed pa de mtha' dag gnas pa kho na ste /
analyzed: 'o na ji zhe na yod pa nyams su myong ba gang ji snyed pa de mtha' dag gnas pa kho na ste /
translated: Rather, all that is experienced as existent is only existent,

original: thams cad kyang thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes bskyed pa la dmigs pa'i dngos pos nus pa thogs pa med pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: thams cad kyang thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes bskyed pa la dmigs pa'i dngos pos nus pa thogs pa med pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because all of them are capable of generating the wisdom of omniscience, since the object that is the focus is unobstructed.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i yul yang thams cad yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i yul yang thams cad yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And because the object of mental consciousness is everything.

original: de bas na thams cad mkhyen pa'i thugs ni dngos po'i rnam pa nyung zad nye bar 'dzin pa yin par mi skye ba'i phyir dang / rjes las thob pa'i dag pa 'dzin ba nges par 'dzin pa'i shes pas kyang yul gyi mthar thug par gnas pa @202b nyid yongs su mi gcod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na thams cad mkhyen pa'i thugs ni dngos po'i rnam pa nyung zad nye bar 'dzin pa yin par mi skye ba'i phyir dang / rjes las thob pa'i dag pa 'dzin ba nges par 'dzin pa'i shes pas kyang yul gyi mthar thug par gnas pa @202b nyid yongs su mi gcod pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, the mind of omniscience does not arise to apprehend a small number of aspects of things, and the subsequent state of pure apprehension does not ascertain the final limit of objects.

original: gang gis mtha' can nyid du 'gyur ba 'di tsam zhig go zhes yongs su gcod par ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gis mtha' can nyid du 'gyur ba 'di tsam zhig go zhes yongs su gcod par ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: How could it ascertain the final limit of objects, thinking, â€œThis is the limitâ€?

original: gang snang bzhin pa nyid las gzhan dag med do zhes de ltar nges par 'dzin par skyes su chug pa de lta na yang mtha' yod pa nyid du thal ba ma yin te /
analyzed: gang snang bzhin pa nyid las gzhan dag med do zhes de ltar nges par 'dzin par skyes su chug pa de lta na yang mtha' yod pa nyid du thal ba ma yin te /
translated: Even if it were to ascertain that there is nothing other than what appears, it would not follow that there is a final limit.

original: 'di ltar gal te snang bzhin pa'i dngos bo ni mtha' dang ldan pa nyid thams cad mkhyen pa'i thugs rnam par rtog pa med pa la snang ba yin na ni de'i tshe rjes thob pa des par 'dzin pa'i sems kyis dngos po rnams la mtha' med pa nyid
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te snang bzhin pa'i dngos bo ni mtha' dang ldan pa nyid thams cad mkhyen pa'i thugs rnam par rtog pa med pa la snang ba yin na ni de'i tshe rjes thob pa des par 'dzin pa'i sems kyis dngos po rnams la mtha' med pa nyid
translated: In this way, if the things that appear to have an end appear to the omniscient mind that is free from conceptualization, then at that time, the mind that apprehends the things of the post equipoise state would eliminate the things that appear to have no end.

original: rnam par gcod pa dang / de rnam par gcad pas kyang mtha' med pa nyid nyams par 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: rnam par gcod pa dang / de rnam par gcad pas kyang mtha' med pa nyid nyams par 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: And by eliminating that, the absence of an end would be undermined.

original: gang gi phyir thams cad mkhyen pa'i sems la snang bzhin pa'i dngos po mtha' med pa kho nang snang ba yin ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir thams cad mkhyen pa'i sems la snang bzhin pa'i dngos po mtha' med pa kho nang snang ba yin ste /
translated: But because the things that appear to the omniscient mind are only things that appear to have no end,

original: thams cad nus pa thogs pa med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad nus pa thogs pa med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: it is because everything is unobstructed.

original: de las gzhan mi snang ba ni mtha' dang ldan pa kho na yin la de nyid kyang nges par 'dzin pa'i sems kyis rnam par gcod par byed pa'i phyir na shin tu gsal bar khyed kyi dngos po rnams mtha' med pa nyid du sgrub pa'i phyir 'di ni
analyzed: de las gzhan mi snang ba ni mtha' dang ldan pa kho na yin la de nyid kyang nges par 'dzin pa'i sems kyis rnam par gcod par byed pa'i phyir na shin tu gsal bar khyed kyi dngos po rnams mtha' med pa nyid du sgrub pa'i phyir 'di ni
translated: Therefore, it is quite clear that your proof that things are limitless is a non sequitur.

original: gyi na'o // gang dag rnal 'byor pa'i shes pa thams cad dmigs pa med pa nyid yin na yang rmi lam bden pa mthong ba dang 'dra bar dngos po la mi slu ba nyid kyi tshad ma yin no zhes khas len pa de dag la ni mtha' dang ldan par rgol
analyzed: gyi na'o // gang dag rnal 'byor pa'i shes pa thams cad dmigs pa med pa nyid yin na yang rmi lam bden pa mthong ba dang 'dra bar dngos po la mi slu ba nyid kyi tshad ma yin no zhes khas len pa de dag la ni mtha' dang ldan par rgol
translated: Those who accept that although the consciousness of a yogi does not have an object, it is a valid cognition that is nondeceptive with regard to things, like seeing a true object in a dream, are far removed from the opportunity to

analyzed: ba'i go skabs rgyang bsrings pa nyid yin no //
translated: argue that it is a limited perception.

original: 'di snyam du rnal 'byor pa'i shes pa gang zag pa med ba nyid yin na /
analyzed: 'di snyam du rnal 'byor pa'i shes pa gang zag pa med ba nyid yin na /
translated: If you think that the consciousness of a yogi is free of error,

original: bstan bcos las ni spyi'i yul can nyid du bshad kyi rang gi rang gi rang nyid yul can du ni ma yin na /
analyzed: bstan bcos las ni spyi'i yul can nyid du bshad kyi rang gi rang gi rang nyid yul can du ni ma yin na /
translated: then it is explained in the treatises that it is a cognition that has a general object, but it is not a cognition that has its own specific object.

original: de ltar spyi'i yul can gyi rnam par shes pas /
analyzed: de ltar spyi'i yul can gyi rnam par shes pas /
translated: Thus, if you think that the consciousness that has a universal as its objectğŸ”½realizes the intrinsic reality of things, then the cause of the cognition that has

original: dngos po rnams kyi rang gi ngo bo nyid rtogs par 'gyur snyam na rigs mi mthun pa las ldog pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid ni tha mi dad pa'i rnam pa can gyis shes pa'i rgyu yin pas /
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyi rang gi ngo bo nyid rtogs par 'gyur snyam na rigs mi mthun pa las ldog pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid ni tha mi dad pa'i rnam pa can gyis shes pa'i rgyu yin pas /
translated: the form of the exclusion of the dissimilar is the intrinsic identity. Therefore,

analyzed: bstan bcos las spyi'i mtshan nyid du bshad do //

analyzed: de bas na de 'dzin par byed pa'i rnal 'byor pa'i ye shes bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis gsal bar snang ba skye ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid kyi spyod yul can yin pas ji ltar na spyi'i yul can des rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i
translated: has a particular as its object. How could it be that it apprehends the universal?

original: 'gal ba med pa yin no //
analyzed: 'gal ba med pa yin no //
translated: There is no contradiction.

analyzed: ji ltar na phan tshun 'gal bshes pa gcig gis 'dzin pa yin zhe na de brjod @203a * //
translated: How can it be that a single cognition apprehends mutually exclusive

analyzed: par bya ste /
translated: objects? This will be explained.

original: gal te yang dngos po 'ga' zhig phan tshun 'gal par yod pa de lta na yang de dag shes pa la lhan cig par mi 'gal ba nyid yin te /
analyzed: gal te yang dngos po 'ga' zhig phan tshun 'gal par yod pa de lta na yang de dag shes pa la lhan cig par mi 'gal ba nyid yin te /
translated: If some things exist as mutually exclusive, still, they are not mutually exclusive in consciousness.

original: mi mthun pa'i don du ma shes pa gcig gis kyang cig car 'dzin pa dmigs ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i don du ma shes pa gcig gis kyang cig car 'dzin pa dmigs ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is observed that a single consciousness apprehends them simultaneously, even though they are not compatible.

original: 'di ltar gang phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid can de rnams gcig tu 'gyur pa 'gal ba dang gang yang lhan cig mi gnas pa na 'gal ba yin na /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid can de rnams gcig tu 'gyur pa 'gal ba dang gang yang lhan cig mi gnas pa na 'gal ba yin na /
translated: Thus, those that are mutually exclusive, having the characteristic of not remaining together, are mutually exclusive if they become one. Also, those that do not remain together are mutually exclusive.

original: 'di rnams shes pa gcig la snang bas gcig tu 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: 'di rnams shes pa gcig la snang bas gcig tu 'gyur ba'am /
translated: But since they appear in a single consciousness, they become one.

original: phyogs gcig pa nyid du thal bar ni mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: phyogs gcig pa nyid du thal bar ni mi 'gyur te /
translated: Or, it follows that they are one part.

original: de bas na 'di rnams shes ba gcig la snang ba ni 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: de bas na 'di rnams shes ba gcig la snang ba ni 'gal ba med do //
translated: But that is not so. Therefore, there is no contradiction in their appearance in a single consciousness.

original: 'gal ba yin yang shes pa gcig la snang ba mthong ba yang yin te /
analyzed: 'gal ba yin yang shes pa gcig la snang ba mthong ba yang yin te /
translated: Even though they are mutually exclusive, they are seen to appear in a single consciousness.

original: dper na phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid can gtsang ba dag dang lhan cig tu mi gnas pa sprul dang rma bya dag mig gi rnam par shes pas cig car 'dzin pa lta bu'o ;
analyzed: dper na phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid can gtsang ba dag dang lhan cig tu mi gnas pa sprul dang rma bya dag mig gi rnam par shes pas cig car 'dzin pa lta bu'o ;
translated: For example, the eye consciousness simultaneously apprehends both a snake and a peacock, which do not coexist because they are mutually exclusive like purity and impurity.

original: /'di snyam du gal te 'gal ba rnams kyang shes pa gcig la snang bar mi 'gal na de ltar gyur na bde ba dang sdug bsngal lam 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dag shes pa gcig gis nyams su myong bar srog chags rnams kyi rgyud la ci'i phyir miğŸ”½skye zhe na /
analyzed: /'di snyam du gal te 'gal ba rnams kyang shes pa gcig la snang bar mi 'gal na de ltar gyur na bde ba dang sdug bsngal lam 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dag shes pa gcig gis nyams su myong bar srog chags rnams kyi rgyud la ci'i phyir mi skye zhe na /
translated: If it is not contradictory for mutually exclusive things to appear to a single consciousness, then why do living beings not experience pleasure and pain, or attachment and hatred, simultaneously in their mental continua?

original: bde ba la sogs pa dus gcig tu ma myong ba gang yin pa de ni rgyu med pas ma skyes pas na bde ba la sogs pa nye bar mi gnas ba yin gyi 'gal ba'i phyir ni ma yin no zhes nges par bya'o //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa dus gcig tu ma myong ba gang yin pa de ni rgyu med pas ma skyes pas na bde ba la sogs pa nye bar mi gnas ba yin gyi 'gal ba'i phyir ni ma yin no zhes nges par bya'o //
translated: Since pleasure and so on are not experienced simultaneously, they are not produced without a cause. Therefore it should be ascertained that pleasure and so on do not coexist because they do not occur simultaneously, not because they are mutually exclusive.

original: yang ji ltar 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i dngos po 'dzin pa de ltar ni sngar bstan zin to //
analyzed: yang ji ltar 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i dngos po 'dzin pa de ltar ni sngar bstan zin to //
translated: How the past and future are apprehended has already been explained.

original: dngos dang brgyud pas des phan gdags par bya ba 'am /
analyzed: dngos dang brgyud pas des phan gdags par bya ba 'am /

analyzed: de la phan 'dogs par byed pa'i rang bzhin gying ltar ba nyid rtogs pa na 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dag shes pa yin te /
translated: or he is to benefit it, then, when one understands the nature of the Tathagata as it really is, one understands the past and future.

original: sa gzhi dben pa rtogs ba nyid bum pa med pa rtogs pa yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: sa gzhi dben pa rtogs ba nyid bum pa med pa rtogs pa yin pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, when one understands the ground to be empty, one understands that there is no pot there.

original: de ltar gyur na rjes su dpag par 'gyur ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar gyur na rjes su dpag par 'gyur ba yang ma yin te /
translated: And it is not the case that this is inference,

analyzed: shin tu spros bas chog go //
