original: 'byor gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pas sems bsdus pa rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'byor gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pas sems bsdus pa rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The knowledge of the collected mind is stated by â€œFurthermore, SubhÅ«ti, the tathÄgatas know the collected minds of sentient beings.â€ğŸ”½The knowledge of the distracted mind is stated by â€œFurthermore, SubhÅ«ti, the tathÄgatas know the distracted minds of sentient beings.â€

original: bsdus pa dang bcas pa zad pa nyid du dang zad pa yang ma zad pa nyid du zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bsdus pa dang bcas pa zad pa nyid du dang zad pa yang ma zad pa nyid du zhes bya ba ni /
translated: And the concise and the non-concise as exhausted and as not exhausted.

original: de la dmigs bas chos nyid la zhugs pa yin pa'i phyir bsdus pa'i sems de kun rdzob tu zad pa ste /
analyzed: de la dmigs bas chos nyid la zhugs pa yin pa'i phyir bsdus pa'i sems de kun rdzob tu zad pa ste /
translated: With respect to that, the concise mind is exhausted in the conventional, because it is engaged in reality by means of observing that.

original: rnam par 'jig pa nyid du mkhyen la /
analyzed: rnam par 'jig pa nyid du mkhyen la /
translated: It is known as thoroughly destroyed.

original: don dam par ni zad cing rnam par 'jig pa yang med pas na ma zad pa ste /
analyzed: don dam par ni zad cing rnam par 'jig pa yang med pas na ma zad pa ste /
translated: But in the ultimate, it is not exhausted, because it is not exhausted and not destroyed.

original: rnam par mi 'jig pa dag dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: rnam par mi 'jig pa dag dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: It is thoroughly known just as it is, as pure and not destroyed.

original: sems rnam par g-yengs pa mkhyen pa bstan pa'i phyir rab 'phyor gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pas sems rnams par g-yengs pa rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: sems rnam par g-yengs pa mkhyen pa bstan pa'i phyir rab 'phyor gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pas sems rnams par g-yengs pa rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to demonstrate the knowledge of distracted minds, the BhagavÄn said, â€œMoreover, the TathÄgata knows the distracted minds of sentient beings as they are in reality.â€

original: chos nyid las zhes bya ba ni chos kyi dbyings skye ba med pa nyid las te /
analyzed: chos nyid las zhes bya ba ni chos kyi dbyings skye ba med pa nyid las te /
translated: â€œFrom realityâ€ means from the unproduced dharmadhÄtu.

original: de yid la mi byed pas kun rdzob tu phyi rol du 'jug pa'i sems ni rnam par g-yengs pa yin la don dam par ni mtshan nyid med pa ste /
analyzed: de yid la mi byed pas kun rdzob tu phyi rol du 'jug pa'i sems ni rnam par g-yengs pa yin la don dam par ni mtshan nyid med pa ste /
translated: Since it is not mentally engaged, the mind that engages in external objects on the conventional level is distracted. But on the ultimate level, it is without characteristics,

original: ngo bo nyid dang bral ba dang skad cig ma'i mi rtag ba nyid kyis mi zad pa dang rgyun gyis mi rtag pa dang bral bas na /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid dang bral ba dang skad cig ma'i mi rtag ba nyid kyis mi zad pa dang rgyun gyis mi rtag pa dang bral bas na /
translated: free from an essence, and not exhausted by momentary impermanence, and free from impermanence by continuity.

original: rnam par mi zad pa dang / phyi rol du 'gro bar mi srid pas ma g-yengs pa zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: rnam par mi zad pa dang / phyi rol du 'gro bar mi srid pas ma g-yengs pa zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: Thus, it is not exhausted, and since it is impossible for it to go outside, it is undistracted.

original: sems mi zad pa'i rnam pa mkhyen pa bstan pa ni /
analyzed: sems mi zad pa'i rnam pa mkhyen pa bstan pa ni /
translated: The knowledge of the aspects of the inexhaustibility of mind is taught:

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang sems can gzhal du med grangs med pa dag gi sems gzhal du med pa mi zad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang sems can gzhal du med grangs med pa dag gi sems gzhal du med pa mi zad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: â€œFurthermore, SubhÅ«ti, the inexhaustibility of the immeasurable, countless minds of immeasurable, countless sentient beingsâ€¦â€ and so on.

original: sems gang gi nam mkha' bzhin du gzhal du med cing mi zad pa na /
analyzed: sems gang gi nam mkha' bzhin du gzhal du med cing mi zad pa na /
translated: The mind that is immeasurable and inexhaustible like space

original: sems can thams cad kyi sems gzhal du med cing mi zad par rang gi ting nge 'dzin gyi me long gi ngos la snang bas na yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin shes par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi sems gzhal du med cing mi zad par rang gi ting nge 'dzin gyi me long gi ngos la snang bas na yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin shes par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Since the immeasurable and inexhaustible minds of all sentient beings appear in the mirror of his concentration, he knows them as they are in reality.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas byin gyis brlabs pa zhes bya ba ni thugs rje chen pos sems de 'khor ba ji srid kyi bar du byin gyis brlabs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas byin gyis brlabs pa zhes bya ba ni thugs rje chen pos sems de 'khor ba ji srid kyi bar du byin gyis brlabs pa'o //
translated: The phrase blessed by the Tathagata means that he blesses that mind with great compassion for as long as cyclic existence lasts.

original: 'gag pa med pa /
analyzed: 'gag pa med pa /
translated: It is uninterrupted

original: skye ba med pa gnas pa med pa zhes bya ba ni ci rigs par byas kyi mtshan nyid rnam pa gsum med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba med pa gnas pa med pa zhes bya ba ni ci rigs par byas kyi mtshan nyid rnam pa gsum med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and unoriginated and nonabiding, because it lacks the three characteristics of action, as appropriate.

original: de bas na chos can gyi ngo bo nyid dang mi ldan pa'i phyir rten med pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na chos can gyi ngo bo nyid dang mi ldan pa'i phyir rten med pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is without support, because it does not possess the nature of a subject.

original: gzhal bar mi nus pa nyid kyis na gzhal du med pa'o //
analyzed: gzhal bar mi nus pa nyid kyis na gzhal du med pa'o //
translated: It is immeasurable, because it cannot be measured.

original: chos kyi dbyings dang 'dra bar rnam par 'jig @204b pa mi 'thad pas na mi zad pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings dang 'dra bar rnam par 'jig @204b pa mi 'thad pas na mi zad pa'o //
translated: It is inexhaustible, because it is not destroyed, like the dharma-dhÄtu.

original: sems 'dod chags dang bcas pa la sogs pa mkhyen pa bstan pa ni /
analyzed: sems 'dod chags dang bcas pa la sogs pa mkhyen pa bstan pa ni /
translated: The knowledge of the mind with passion, etc., is indicated.

original: kun nas nyon mongs par gyur pa'i sems rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /ğŸ”½kun nas nyon mongs pas kun nas nyon mongs par gyur pa ma yin zhing zhes bya ba ni 'khrul pa tsam du yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs par gyur pa'i sems rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te / kun nas nyon mongs pas kun nas nyon mongs par gyur pa ma yin zhing zhes bya ba ni 'khrul pa tsam du yod pa'i phyir /
translated: He says, â€œthe minds that are afflicted, etc.â€ğŸ”½â€œNot afflicted by afflictionâ€ means that they are not afflicted by the afflictions of action and birth, which are characterized by affliction, because they exist as mere error.

original: de kho na nyid du nyon mongs pa dang las dang skye ba'i mtshan nyid kun nas nyon mongs pa rnams kyis kun nas snyon rmongs par gyur pa ma yin zhing /ğŸ”½nyon mongs pa med pa yin la /
analyzed: de kho na nyid du nyon mongs pa dang las dang skye ba'i mtshan nyid kun nas nyon mongs pa rnams kyis kun nas snyon rmongs par gyur pa ma yin zhing / nyon mongs pa med pa yin la /
translated: â€œNot afflictedâ€ means that they are not overcome by the afflictions.

original: phyin ci log gi stobs kyis ni kun nas snyon rmongs shing nye bar bcom pa yin pa'o //
analyzed: phyin ci log gi stobs kyis ni kun nas snyon rmongs shing nye bar bcom pa yin pa'o //
translated: â€œNot without afflictionâ€ means that they are overcome by the afflictions through the power of error.

original: brdar btags pa med pa zhes bya ba ni so sor nges pa la 'jug pa'o //ğŸ”½sems 'dod chags dang bral ba la sogs pa mkhyen pa bstan pa ni /
analyzed: brdar btags pa med pa zhes bya ba ni so sor nges pa la 'jug pa'o // sems 'dod chags dang bral ba la sogs pa mkhyen pa bstan pa ni /
translated: â€œWithout conventional designationâ€ means that they are not engaged in the specific.

original: sems kun nas snyon rmongs par ma gyur pa rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: sems kun nas snyon rmongs par ma gyur pa rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: The knowledge of the mind free from attachment, etc. is taught by â€œthe minds that are not overcome by affliction, etc.â€

original: rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba ste /
translated: It is naturally luminous.ğŸ”½This is because, even the impure mind that has become such due to the arising of the cause of delusion during the phase of ordinary beings, when its nature is examined by valid cognition, is by nature

original: zhes bya ba ni so so'i skye bo'i gnas skabs su 'khrul pa'i rgyu las byung ba nyid kyis na de lta bur gyur pa'i rnam par ma dag pa'i sems kyang rang gi ngo bo tshad mas brtags na skye ba med pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo'i bdag nyid
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni so so'i skye bo'i gnas skabs su 'khrul pa'i rgyu las byung ba nyid kyis na de lta bur gyur pa'i rnam par ma dag pa'i sems kyang rang gi ngo bo tshad mas brtags na skye ba med pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo'i bdag nyid
translated: unborn and so forth.

original: du rtogs pa la gzhol ba dang bcas pa nyid kyis na /
analyzed: du rtogs pa la gzhol ba dang bcas pa nyid kyis na /
translated: Since it is inclined toward the realization of that,

original: gnyen po skyes pa las slar mi bzlog cing 'dod chags la sogs glo bur ba bsal bar nus pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gnyen po skyes pa las slar mi bzlog cing 'dod chags la sogs glo bur ba bsal bar nus pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: it is possible to remove the adventitious defilements of attachment and so forth by means of the arising of the antidote.

original: rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal zhing yongs su dag pa'i rang gi ngo bo tsam yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal zhing yongs su dag pa'i rang gi ngo bo tsam yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is simply the naturally luminous and completely pure nature.

original: de ltar sems 'dod chags dang bcas pa la sogs pa dang / sems 'dod chags dang bral ba la sogs pa spyir bstan nas de'i thabs go rims bzhin du bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar sems 'dod chags dang bcas pa la sogs pa dang / sems 'dod chags dang bral ba la sogs pa spyir bstan nas de'i thabs go rims bzhin du bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Having thus taught the mind with attachment and so forth and the mind free from attachment and so forth in general, in order to teach the method for that in order,

original: sems gnas pa la sogs pa'i 'gres gcig dang / sems rab tu gzung ba la sogs pa gnyis gsungs so //
analyzed: sems gnas pa la sogs pa'i 'gres gcig dang / sems rab tu gzung ba la sogs pa gnyis gsungs so //
translated: The stability of mind is taught as being of two kinds: the stability of mind in the absence of a basis, and the stability of mind in the absence of an object.

original: gzhi med pa la gnas pa zhes bya ba ni gnas par mi 'os pa gzhi med pa snyoms par 'jug pa'i ro myang ba la sogs pa la /ğŸ”½'dod chags la sogs pa'i rgyur gyur pa nyid kyis na gnas shing mngon par zhen pa'o //
analyzed: gzhi med pa la gnas pa zhes bya ba ni gnas par mi 'os pa gzhi med pa snyoms par 'jug pa'i ro myang ba la sogs pa la / 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rgyur gyur pa nyid kyis na gnas shing mngon par zhen pa'o //
translated: The stability of mind in the absence of a basis is the stability and adherence of mind in the absence of a basis, that is, in the absence of a proper basis, such as in the relishing of meditative concentration.ğŸ”½The stability of mind in the absence of an object is the stability of mind in the absence of an object, that is, in the absence of the object of adherence, such as the adherence to self and what belongs to self.

original: rab 'byor sems de dag ni gzung ba med cing rab tu mi gzung bar bya ba yin te zhes bya ba ni de la sems rgod pa'am rgod par dogs pa la skyo bar bya ba'i dngos po @205a * //ğŸ”½yid la byed pas /ğŸ”½zhi gnas kyi rgyu mtshan dang sems zhum pa'am /
analyzed: rab 'byor sems de dag ni gzung ba med cing rab tu mi gzung bar bya ba yin te zhes bya ba ni de la sems rgod pa'am rgod par dogs pa la skyo bar bya ba'i dngos po @205a * // yid la byed pas / zhi gnas kyi rgyu mtshan dang sems zhum pa'am /
translated: The stability of mind in the absence of an object is the stability of mind in the absence of an object, that is, in the absence of the object of adherence, such as the adherence to self and what belongs to self.ğŸ”½The stability of mind in the absence of a basis is the stability and adherence of mind in the absence of a basis, that is, in the absence of a proper basis, such as in the relishing of meditative concentration.ğŸ”½The stability of mind in the absence of an object is the stability of mind in the absence of an object, that is, in the absence of the object of adherence, such as the adherence to self and what belongs to self.

original: zhum du dogs pa la mngon par dga' bar 'gyur ba'i dngos po yid la byed pa rab tu 'dzin pa'i rgyu mtshan dang sems mnyam pa thob pa la lhun gyis grub pa'i yid la byed pa /
analyzed: zhum du dogs pa la mngon par dga' bar 'gyur ba'i dngos po yid la byed pa rab tu 'dzin pa'i rgyu mtshan dang sems mnyam pa thob pa la lhun gyis grub pa'i yid la byed pa /
translated: The stability of mind in the absence of an object is the stability of mind in the absence of an object, that is, in the absence of the object of adherence, such as the adherence to self and what belongs to self.ğŸ”½The stability of mind in the absence of a basis is the stability and adherence of mind in the absence of a basis, that is, in the absence of a proper basis, such as in the relishing of meditative concentration.ğŸ”½The stability of mind in the absence of an object is the stability of mind in the absence of an object, that is, in the absence of the object of adherence, such as the adherence to self and what belongs to self.ğŸ”½The stability of mind in the absence of a basis is the stability and adherence of mind in the absence of a basis, that is, in the absence of a proper basis, such as in the relishing of meditative concentration.ğŸ”½The stability of mind in the absence of an object is the stability of mind in the absence of an object, that is, in the absence of the object of adherence, such as the adherence to self and what belongs to self

original: btang snyoms kyi rgyu mtshan gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: btang snyoms kyi rgyu mtshan gzung bar bya'o //
translated: One should take up the reasons for equanimity.

original: de ltar na 'dod chags dang bral ba la sogs pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar na 'dod chags dang bral ba la sogs pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, because of being the very cause of freedom from attachment and so on,

original: sems rab tu gzung ba'o //
analyzed: sems rab tu gzung ba'o //
translated: the mind is well taken up.

original: yang na gzung bar 'os pa nyid kyis gzung ba ma yin zhing yang dang yang du rab tu gzung bar bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: yang na gzung bar 'os pa nyid kyis gzung ba ma yin zhing yang dang yang du rab tu gzung bar bya ba ma yin no //
translated: Or, because of being worthy of being taken up, it is not taken up, and it is not to be well taken up again and again.

original: sems dang shes pa de dag nyid spyir rnam grangs kyis bstan pa ni go rims bzhin du zag pa dang bcas pa'i sems rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa gcig dang zag pa med pa'i sems rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'gres gnyis gsungs pa yin no
analyzed: sems dang shes pa de dag nyid spyir rnam grangs kyis bstan pa ni go rims bzhin du zag pa dang bcas pa'i sems rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa gcig dang zag pa med pa'i sems rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'gres gnyis gsungs pa yin no
translated: Those very minds and cognitions are generally taught by way of synonyms, with one pair of synonyms being â€œthe minds with contaminantsâ€ and so on, and the other pair being â€œthe minds without contaminantsâ€ and so on.

original: // rab 'byor sems de dag ni ngo bo nyid med cing med pa dang 'dra ba yin te /
analyzed: // rab 'byor sems de dag ni ngo bo nyid med cing med pa dang 'dra ba yin te /
translated: SubhÅ«ti, those minds are without an intrinsic nature and are like a non-entity.

original: zhes bya ba ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i sems rnams ni gnyen po'i phyogs skyes pas bzlog bar bya ba nyid kyis rang gi ngo bo nyid med pa yin la /ğŸ”½de las kyang med pa dang mtshungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i sems rnams ni gnyen po'i phyogs skyes pas bzlog bar bya ba nyid kyis rang gi ngo bo nyid med pa yin la / de las kyang med pa dang mtshungs pa yin no //
translated: The thought of those beyond training is purified by intrinsic nature, because it is free from the influence of the counteragent.ğŸ”½The thought of those who are neither in training nor beyond training is not purified by intrinsic nature, because it is not free from the influence of the counteragent.ğŸ”½The thought of those who are in training is not purified by the path, because it is not free from the influence of the counteragent.ğŸ”½The thought of those beyond training is purified by the path, because it is free from the influence of the counteragent.ğŸ”½The thought of those who are neither in training nor beyond training is not purified by the path, because it is not free from the influence of the counteragent.ğŸ”½The thought of those who are in training is not purified by the object, because it is not free from the influence of the counteragent.ğŸ”½The thought of those beyond training is purified by the object, because it is free from the influence of the counteragent.ğŸ”½The thought of those who are neither in training nor beyond training is not purified by the object, because it is not free from the influence of the counteragent.ğŸ”½The thought of those who are in training is not purified by the aspect, because it is not free from the influence of the counteragent.ğŸ”½The thought of those beyond training is purified by the aspect, because it is free from the influence of the counteragent.

original: rab 'byor sems de dag ni dngos po med par gzhol bzhes bya ba ni zag pa mad pa'i sems rnams ni mthong ba dang bsgom pas spangs par bya ba'i nyon mongs pa med pa'i mthar thug pa yin no //ğŸ”½de bas na rang gi ngang gis rgyud yongs su dag par 'jug pas na lhun gyis grub pa'o //ğŸ”½yang de dag nyid kyi rab tu dbye ba drug ni 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i 'gres kyis gsungs so //
analyzed: rab 'byor sems de dag ni dngos po med par gzhol bzhes bya ba ni zag pa mad pa'i sems rnams ni mthong ba dang bsgom pas spangs par bya ba'i nyon mongs pa med pa'i mthar thug pa yin no // de bas na rang gi ngang gis rgyud yongs su dag par 'jug pas na lhun gyis grub pa'o // yang de dag nyid kyi rab tu dbye ba drug ni 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i 'gres kyis gsungs so //
translated: The thought of those who are neither in training nor beyond training is not purified by the aspect, because it is not free from the influence of the counteragent.

original: sems kyi 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: sems kyi 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The thought of those who are in training is not purified by the stage

original: sems kyi 'dod chags dang bcas pa 'di nyid gang yin pa so so'i skye bo'i yul la chags pa'i rang bzhin nyid de ni sems kyi yang dag pa ji lta ba nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: sems kyi 'dod chags dang bcas pa 'di nyid gang yin pa so so'i skye bo'i yul la chags pa'i rang bzhin nyid de ni sems kyi yang dag pa ji lta ba nyid ma yin no //
translated: The nature of the mind that is attached to the objects of ordinary people is not the suchness of the mind.

original: rang gsal ba'i rang bzhin ni rigs pas sgyu ma ngang 'dra bar 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: rang gsal ba'i rang bzhin ni rigs pas sgyu ma ngang 'dra bar 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: The nature of the mind that is luminous by nature is like an illusion, as is proven by reasoning.

original: bsal bar nus pa dang mi nus pa nyid kyis 'di dag go rims bzhin g-yo ba dang mi g-yo ba yin pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsal bar nus pa dang mi nus pa nyid kyis 'di dag go rims bzhin g-yo ba dang mi g-yo ba yin pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are, respectively, mobile and immobile by nature, since they can and cannot be removed.

original: de bzhin du 'phags pa rnams kyi gnyen po bsgoms pas sems kyi yang dag pa ji lta ba nyid zag pa med pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'phags pa rnams kyi gnyen po bsgoms pas sems kyi yang dag pa ji lta ba nyid zag pa med pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni /
translated: In the same way, the suchness of the mind, which is the uncontaminated nature of the mind, is not attached, because it is cultivated as the antidote by the Äryas.

original: 'dod chags dang bcas @205b pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bcas @205b pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not attached,

original: de ni gnyen po'i phyogs kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni gnyen po'i phyogs kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the nature of the side of the antidote.

original: de bas na ma dag pa'i gnas skabs su kun rdzob tu 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i sems ni /
analyzed: de bas na ma dag pa'i gnas skabs su kun rdzob tu 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i sems ni /
translated: Therefore, in the impure stage, the mind that is attached is conventional.

original: rab 'byor sems kyi bral ba gang yin pa de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: rab 'byor sems kyi bral ba gang yin pa de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
translated: â€œSubhÅ«ti, that separation of mindâ€ and so on.

original: sems kyi bral ba ste /
analyzed: sems kyi bral ba ste /
translated: The separation of mind

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i gnas skabs gang yin ba de ni so so'i skye bo'i 'dod chags dang bcas pa ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i gnas skabs gang yin ba de ni so so'i skye bo'i 'dod chags dang bcas pa ste /
translated: is the state of being free from attachment. That is not the state of being attached,

original: chags pa'i gnas skabs ma yin te de gnyis ngo bo nyid tha dad pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chags pa'i gnas skabs ma yin te de gnyis ngo bo nyid tha dad pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because those two have different natures.

original: de bzhin du 'dod chags dang bral ba'i rnam par rtse bcil ba la sogs pa'i spangs pas /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dod chags dang bral ba'i rnam par rtse bcil ba la sogs pa'i spangs pas /
translated: Similarly, the separation of mind from attachment is the state of being free from attachment, because it is the abandonment of the play of attachment and so on.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sems kyis yang dag pa ji lta ba nyid gang yin pa de ni dben pa'i bdag nyid du rtogs pa nyid kyis de sems kyi 'dod chags dang bcas pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sems kyis yang dag pa ji lta ba nyid gang yin pa de ni dben pa'i bdag nyid du rtogs pa nyid kyis de sems kyi 'dod chags dang bcas pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: The mind that is free from attachment is the suchness of things just as it is. Because it is realized to be the nature of separation, it is not a mind that is attached.

original: de bas na dben pa'i gnas skabs su sems 'dod chags dang bral ba yin no //
analyzed: de bas na dben pa'i gnas skabs su sems 'dod chags dang bral ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, the mind is free from attachment in the state of separation.

original: de bzhin du zhe sdang dang bcas pa la sogs pa'i 'gres kyis gzhung lhag ma rnams kyang 'di nyid kyi rjes su 'brangs nas bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du zhe sdang dang bcas pa la sogs pa'i 'gres kyis gzhung lhag ma rnams kyang 'di nyid kyi rjes su 'brangs nas bshad par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, the rest of the text should be explained by following this method, with the words â€œassociated with hatredâ€ and so on.

original: sems rgya chen po mkhyen pa nyid bstan pa ldog pa dang 'jug pa'i sgo nas 'gres gnyis su 'gyur ba ni /
analyzed: sems rgya chen po mkhyen pa nyid bstan pa ldog pa dang 'jug pa'i sgo nas 'gres gnyis su 'gyur ba ni /
translated: The knowledge of the vast mind is taught in two parts, in terms of the door of reversal and the door of engagement.

original: sems rgya chen po ma yin pa rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: sems rgya chen po ma yin pa rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: The door of reversal is taught in the passage beginning with â€œThose who have a mind that is not vast.â€

original: rab 'byor sems de dag ni kun nas slong ba dang mi ldan pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor sems de dag ni kun nas slong ba dang mi ldan pa /
translated: SubhÅ«ti, those minds are not associated with motivation.

original: kun nas slong pa med par rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: kun nas slong pa med par rtogs pa ste /
translated: They are understood to be without motivation.

original: zhes bya ba ni de kho na nyid du na skye ba med pas rgyu dang 'brel pa stong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir kun nas slong ba dang mi ldan pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de kho na nyid du na skye ba med pas rgyu dang 'brel pa stong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir kun nas slong ba dang mi ldan pa'o //
translated: In reality, they are not associated with motivation because they are empty of a connection with a cause, since they are non-arisen.

original: 'byung ba dang bral ba yin pas 'dod pa la sogs pa'i khams dang ma 'brel ba nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'byung ba dang bral ba yin pas 'dod pa la sogs pa'i khams dang ma 'brel ba nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: They are understood to be without motivation because they are not associated with the realms of desire and so on, since they are free from arising.

original: sems de dag ni kun nas slong ba med par rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: sems de dag ni kun nas slong ba med par rtogs pa'o //
translated: The door of engagement is taught in the passage beginning with â€œSubhÅ«ti, those minds are not internal.â€

original: de ltar ma dmigs pas rgya chen po ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar ma dmigs pas rgya chen po ma yin pa'o //
translated: As such, it is not vast because it is not perceived.

original: rab 'byor sems de dag ni mi 'bri mi 'phel zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: rab 'byor sems de dag ni mi 'bri mi 'phel zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: SubhÅ«ti, those minds do not decrease or increase, etc.

original: rnam par 'jig pa med pas mi 'bri zhing skye ba med pas mi 'phel lo //
analyzed: rnam par 'jig pa med pas mi 'bri zhing skye ba med pas mi 'phel lo //
translated: They do not decrease because they are not destroyed, and they do not increase because they are not produced.

original: de nyid kyis na 'ga' zhig tu 'gro bas bral ba med pa'i phyir rnam par bral ba med pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyis na 'ga' zhig tu 'gro bas bral ba med pa'i phyir rnam par bral ba med pa ste /
translated: Because of that, they are not separated, since they go nowhere.

original: de ltar chos kyi dbyings kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar chos kyi dbyings kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: As such, because they are the essence of the dharmadhÄtu,

original: sems rgya chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems rgya chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: they are called â€œvast minds.â€

original: sems chen por gyur ba mkhyen pa ldog pa dang 'jug pa'i sgo nas 'gres gnyis kyis bstan pa ni /ğŸ”½sems chen por gyur pa ma @206a * //
analyzed: sems chen por gyur ba mkhyen pa ldog pa dang 'jug pa'i sgo nas 'gres gnyis kyis bstan pa ni / sems chen por gyur pa ma @206a * //
translated: The two sets of two lines that teach the knowledge of the great mind through the door of reversal and engagement are

original: yin pa rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs ba yin te /
analyzed: yin pa rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs ba yin te /
translated: the minds that are not the great mind, etc.

original: rab 'byor sems de dag ni 'ong ba med pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor sems de dag ni 'ong ba med pa /
translated: SubhÅ«ti, those minds do not come,

original: 'gro ba med pa ma gtogs pa zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu yod pa bkag pas 'das pa'i dus de nas 'ongs pa dang bral ba yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'gro ba med pa ma gtogs pa zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu yod pa bkag pas 'das pa'i dus de nas 'ongs pa dang bral ba yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Except for non-going means that because the existence of the effect is refuted, it is free from coming from that past time.

original: sems de dag ni 'ong ba med pa'o //
analyzed: sems de dag ni 'ong ba med pa'o //
translated: Those minds do not come.

original: rnam pa thams cad du 'jig pa ma yin pas ma 'ongs pa'i dus su yang 'gro bar mi 'thad pas 'gro ba med pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du 'jig pa ma yin pas ma 'ongs pa'i dus su yang 'gro bar mi 'thad pas 'gro ba med pa'o //
translated: Because they are not destroyed in any way, it is not tenable that they go to a future time, so they do not go.

original: da ltar gyi dus su yang gcig dang du ma'i ngo bo nyid dang bral bsam gtogs pa ste /
analyzed: da ltar gyi dus su yang gcig dang du ma'i ngo bo nyid dang bral bsam gtogs pa ste /
translated: And in the present time, they are free from the nature of being one or many.

original: de ltar na chen por gyur ba ma yin pa yin no //ğŸ”½rab 'byor sems de dag ni mnyam pa nyid kyis mnyam pa ste ngo bo nyid mnyam ba'o zhes bya ba ni de kho na nyid du na ma skyes pa'i ngo bo nyid yin ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar na chen por gyur ba ma yin pa yin no // rab 'byor sems de dag ni mnyam pa nyid kyis mnyam pa ste ngo bo nyid mnyam ba'o zhes bya ba ni de kho na nyid du na ma skyes pa'i ngo bo nyid yin ba'i phyir /
translated: Thus, they are not great.ğŸ”½SubhÅ«ti, those minds are equal by way of sameness, equal by way of the same nature.ğŸ”½Because they are unborn in reality, they are equal by way of sameness with things that do not exist, such as a self.

original: bdag la sogs pa dngos po med pa dang mnyam pa nyid kyis nas sems de dag ni mnyam pa nyid kyis mnyam pa yin la /
analyzed: bdag la sogs pa dngos po med pa dang mnyam pa nyid kyis nas sems de dag ni mnyam pa nyid kyis mnyam pa yin la /
translated: Those minds are equal by way of sameness.

original: yang dag pa'i kun rdzob tu ni yon tan thams cad thob pa'i tshul gyis rab tu snang bas sgyu ma'i ngo bo nyid kyis mnyam ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i kun rdzob tu ni yon tan thams cad thob pa'i tshul gyis rab tu snang bas sgyu ma'i ngo bo nyid kyis mnyam ste /
translated: In the correct relative, they are equal by way of the nature of illusion, since all qualities are obtained.

original: de ltar na chen por gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na chen por gyur pa yin no //
translated: Thus, they are the Great.

original: sems tshad ma med pa mkhyen pa bstan pa ni /
analyzed: sems tshad ma med pa mkhyen pa bstan pa ni /
translated: The knowledge of immeasurable minds is taught:

original: sems tshad ma med pa rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: sems tshad ma med pa rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: â€œThe immeasurable mindsâ€ and so forth.

original: rten med bas zhes bya ba ni de rnams la so sor nges pa'i rten yod pa ma yin pas tshad med pa'o //
analyzed: rten med bas zhes bya ba ni de rnams la so sor nges pa'i rten yod pa ma yin pas tshad med pa'o //
translated: They are immeasurable because they do not have a basis, since they do not have a specific basis.

original: sems bstan du yod ba mkhyen pas ston pas /
analyzed: sems bstan du yod ba mkhyen pas ston pas /
translated: The Teacher, knowing the demonstrable mind,

translated: taught the two verses in the same way as before:

original: sems bstan du yod pa rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sems bstan du yod pa rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: â€œThe demonstrable mindsâ€ and so forth.

original: rab 'byor sems de dag dang sems kyi ngo bo nyid ni mnyam bar bstan pa yin te zhes bya ba ni sgyu ma lta bu'i bdag nyid du yang dag par rig pas na mnyam par bstan pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor sems de dag dang sems kyi ngo bo nyid ni mnyam bar bstan pa yin te zhes bya ba ni sgyu ma lta bu'i bdag nyid du yang dag par rig pas na mnyam par bstan pa ste /

analyzed: shes pa thams cad kyis mtshungs par dmigs pa'i ngo bo nyid yin te /
translated: It is the nature that is equally observed by all consciousnesses.

analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i bag chags rnams kyis bsags pa yin pa'i phyir na /

original: rab 'byor sems de dag ni gnyis su med ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa la skye ba dang me skye ba dang bral ba nyid kyis na gnyis su med par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor sems de dag ni gnyis su med ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa la skye ba dang me skye ba dang bral ba nyid kyis na gnyis su med par gyur pa'o //
translated: Subhuti, those minds are called nondual, etc. They are nondual because they are free from production and nonproduction.

original: de kho na nyid du ma byung ba nyid kun rdzob tu byung ba yin pas ma byung ba kun tu byung ba'o //
analyzed: de kho na nyid du ma byung ba nyid kun rdzob tu byung ba yin pas ma byung ba kun tu byung ba'o //
translated: Since they do not arise in reality, they arise superficially, and so the unarisen arises.

original: de ltar tshad mas 'thad pa nyid yin pa'i phyir thogs ba med pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar tshad mas 'thad pa nyid yin pa'i phyir thogs ba med pa'o //
translated: Thus, because they are established by valid cognition, they are unobstructed.

original: rab 'byor sems bla na yod pa yang dag ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa la bdag la sogs par mngon par zhen pas bla na yod cing dman pa'i gnas skabs thob pa'i sems /
analyzed: rab 'byor sems bla na yod pa yang dag ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa la bdag la sogs par mngon par zhen pas bla na yod cing dman pa'i gnas skabs thob pa'i sems /
translated: Subhuti, the mind that is surpassed is the correct one, etc. The mind that is surpassed and attains an inferior state is due to the adherence to self, etc.

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba nyid de bdag med pa legs par rtogs pa nyid gang yin pa de la rlom sems med de 'jig tshogs la sogs pa'i lta ba la nye bar dmigs pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba nyid de bdag med pa legs par rtogs pa nyid gang yin pa de la rlom sems med de 'jig tshogs la sogs pa'i lta ba la nye bar dmigs pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: That which is the correct suchness, the full understanding of selflessness, is the absence of conceit, the nonapprehension of the views of the transitory aggregates, etc.

original: de bas 'di ltar de ni kun rdzob tu bla na yod ba dang bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas 'di ltar de ni kun rdzob tu bla na yod ba dang bcas pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, in this way, it is relatively inferior.

original: rab 'byor sems de dag ni rdul phra rab tsam yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas /
analyzed: rab 'byor sems de dag ni rdul phra rab tsam yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas /
translated: SubhÅ«ti, those thoughts are not even as much as an atom.

original: gang gi phyir sems kyi rang bzhin dag ni don dam par dngos po rdul phra rab tsam yang mi dmigs pa yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sems kyi rang bzhin dag ni don dam par dngos po rdul phra rab tsam yang mi dmigs pa yin la /
translated: Because, in reality, the nature of thoughts is not even as much as an atom.

original: de bas na so so'i skye bo'i gnas skabs su 'chang rgya ba nyid kyi gnas skabs dang 'dra bar rang bzhin gyis rnam bar byang ba'i ngo bo nyid yin pas /
analyzed: de bas na so so'i skye bo'i gnas skabs su 'chang rgya ba nyid kyi gnas skabs dang 'dra bar rang bzhin gyis rnam bar byang ba'i ngo bo nyid yin pas /
translated: Therefore, like the state of being a common being, the nature of the mind is naturally pure.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i mtshan ma thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir spros pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i mtshan ma thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir spros pa med pa yin te /
translated: It is free from all elaborations, such as the signs of form, and so on.

original: de ltar de kho na nyid du sems bla na med pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar de kho na nyid du sems bla na med pa yin no //
translated: In this way, the mind is unsurpassed in reality.

original: rab 'byor sems de dag ni @207a * //
analyzed: rab 'byor sems de dag ni @207a * //
translated: SubhÅ«ti, those thoughts are equal to the unequaled.

original: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la skye ba la sogs pa'i nyes pa dag ni mi mnyam pa yin pas /
analyzed: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la skye ba la sogs pa'i nyes pa dag ni mi mnyam pa yin pas /
translated: The faults of arising and so on are unequal.

original: mi mnyam pa'i gzung ba dang mnyam pa /
analyzed: mi mnyam pa'i gzung ba dang mnyam pa /
translated: The unequal is the apprehended object,ğŸ”½and the equal is the apprehending subject.

original: de 'dzin par byed pa nyid kyis phyi rol du 'jug pa'i sems ni rnam par g-yeng ba yin pas sems mnyam par gzhag par ma byas pa nyid kyis na /
analyzed: de 'dzin par byed pa nyid kyis phyi rol du 'jug pa'i sems ni rnam par g-yeng ba yin pas sems mnyam par gzhag par ma byas pa nyid kyis na /
translated: The mind that engages externally by means of apprehending that is distraction.

original: rtse gcig tu ma byas pa yin te /
analyzed: rtse gcig tu ma byas pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is not one-pointed,

original: de ltar sems mnyam par ma bzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar sems mnyam par ma bzhag pa yin no //
translated: and thus the mind is not in equipoise.

original: rab 'byor sems de dag ni mnyam pa dang mnyam zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /ğŸ”½nyes pa'i mi mnyam pa thams cad 'thad pa ma yin pas mnyam pa ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor sems de dag ni mnyam pa dang mnyam zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pa la / nyes pa'i mi mnyam pa thams cad 'thad pa ma yin pas mnyam pa ni /
translated: SubhÅ«ti, those minds are equal to the equal, etc.

original: chos kyi dbyings yin la /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings yin la /
translated: Since all inequality of faults is not tenable, the equal is the dharmadhÄtu.

original: de dang lhan cig skye ba med la sogs pa las mtshungs pa'i phyir mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: de dang lhan cig skye ba med la sogs pa las mtshungs pa'i phyir mnyam pa'o //
translated: Since it is the same as that, it is equal.

original: rnam par g-yeng ba las phyir bcos pas na mnyam par bzhag pa ste /ğŸ”½de ltar mnyam par bzhag pa'i sems ni de kho na nyid du na yod pa ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas /
analyzed: rnam par g-yeng ba las phyir bcos pas na mnyam par bzhag pa ste / de ltar mnyam par bzhag pa'i sems ni de kho na nyid du na yod pa ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas /
translated: Since it is the antidote to distraction, it is equipoise.

original: nam mkha' dang mtshungs so //
analyzed: nam mkha' dang mtshungs so //
translated: Thus, the mind in equipoise is, in reality, the same as space, since it has the nature of nonexistence.

original: rab 'byor sems de dag ni rang bzhin gyis rnam par grol ba ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor sems de dag ni rang bzhin gyis rnam par grol ba ste /
translated: SubhÅ«ti, those minds are naturally liberated.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rigs pa'i rjes su 'gro ba'i skye ba dang bral ba nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rigs pa'i rjes su 'gro ba'i skye ba dang bral ba nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Here, because they are free from arising that conforms with reasoning,

original: sems de dag ni rang bzhin gyis rnam par grol ba'o //
analyzed: sems de dag ni rang bzhin gyis rnam par grol ba'o //
translated: those minds are naturally liberated.

original: med par grub pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: med par grub pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because they are established as nonexistent by nature,

original: ngo bo nyid med pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: they are essentially natureless.

original: de bas na 'ching ba sngon du 'gro pa'i 'grol ba med pas na /
analyzed: de bas na 'ching ba sngon du 'gro pa'i 'grol ba med pas na /
translated: Therefore, because there is no liberation that precedes bondage,

original: sems ma grol ba yin no //
analyzed: sems ma grol ba yin no //
translated: those minds are not liberated.ğŸ”½Because the mind is free from the nature of being one or many,

original: sems ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gi phyir sems ni gcig dang du ma'i ngo bo nyid dang bral bas dus gsum pa'i sems med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sems ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gi phyir sems ni gcig dang du ma'i ngo bo nyid dang bral bas dus gsum pa'i sems med pa'i phyir /

original: de bzhin gshegs pas ma dmigs pa de pas na rang bzhin gyis sgrib pa gnyis dang phral ba'i phyir rnam par grol ba yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas ma dmigs pa de pas na rang bzhin gyis sgrib pa gnyis dang phral ba'i phyir rnam par grol ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, because the TathÄgata does not apprehend it, it is naturally free from the two obstructions and is liberated.

original: rab tu dbye ba bstan nas da ni sems bltar med ba bstan pa'i phyir sems bltar med pa rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: rab tu dbye ba bstan nas da ni sems bltar med ba bstan pa'i phyir sems bltar med pa rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Having taught the divisions, now, in order to teach the mind that is not seen, he says, â€œThe minds that are not seen,â€ and so on.

original: rab 'byor med pa'i phyir sems de bltar med pa dang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor med pa'i phyir sems de bltar med pa dang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: â€œSubhÅ«ti, because it does not exist, that mind is not seen,â€ and so on.

original: kun brtags pa'i sems ni mtshan nyid stong pa nyid kyis na med pa'i bltar med pa'o //ğŸ”½ma byung ba ni rnam par ma rig pa'o zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi dbang ni rgyu med pas ma byung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i sems ni mtshan nyid stong pa nyid kyis na med pa'i bltar med pa'o // ma byung ba ni rnam par ma rig pa'o zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi dbang ni rgyu med pas ma byung ba'i phyir /
translated: The imagined mind is not seen because of the emptiness of its characteristics.ğŸ”½â€œIt does not arise; it is not cognized,â€ and so on.

original: rnam par rig bar byar med pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par rig bar byar med pa'o //
translated: The dependent is not cognized because it does not arise due to a lack of causes.

original: yongs su ma grub bas na gzung du med ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yongs su ma grub bas na gzung du med ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: â€œIt is not apprehended because it is not fully accomplished,â€ and so on.

original: yongs su grub @207b ba'i sems ni ngo bo yod pa ma yin pa nyid kyis yongs su grub pa yin ba'i phyir gzung du med pa ste /
analyzed: yongs su grub @207b ba'i sems ni ngo bo yod pa ma yin pa nyid kyis yongs su grub pa yin ba'i phyir gzung du med pa ste /
translated: The fully present mind is not apprehended because it is fully present due to the nonexistence of an entity.

original: re re zhing shes rab kyi mig la sogs pa gsum gyis zhes bya bar sbyar ba 'am sangs rgyas dang chos kyi spyan la sogs pa lnga po thams cad la mi snang ba'i phyir /

original: bltar med pa la sogs pa yin par khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: bltar med pa la sogs pa yin par khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: The words not seen and so forth are to be applied to each of these.

original: rab 'byor de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa ni nye bar bsdu ba'i tshig yin te /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa ni nye bar bsdu ba'i tshig yin te /
translated: The words Thus, Subhuti, the perfection of wisdom... and so forth are words of summary.

analyzed: sems bsdus pa mkhyen pa la sogs pa'i 'gres kyi zhabs su yang re re zhing yang kun la sbyar bar bya'o //

analyzed: sems g-yo ba la sogs pa mkhyen pa bstan pa ni /

analyzed: phye ba dang btsums pa rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /

analyzed: de la sgrub pa'i sgo nas rang gi yul la sems 'phro ba gang yin pa de ni 'dir phye ba yin no //

analyzed: dgag pa'i sgo nas yul gzhan la sems mi 'phro ba ni btsums pa yin te /

analyzed: de ltar gyur ba ni phye ba dang btsums pa'o //

analyzed: sems can gzhan dang gang zag gzhan zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dbye ba gnyis gsungs pa yin no //

original: gzugs la gnas shing zhes bya ba la sogs pa sgrub dang dgag pa'i sgo nas sems can thams cad ni gzugs la sogs pa phung po lnga po la brten nas skye'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzugs la gnas shing zhes bya ba la sogs pa sgrub dang dgag pa'i sgo nas sems can thams cad ni gzugs la sogs pa phung po lnga po la brten nas skye'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //

analyzed: de nyid ston par mdzad pa ni / de bzhin song ba shi phan chad ces bya ba la sogs par gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The Teacher demonstrates just thatğŸ”½in the statement, â€œThe TathÄgata exists after death,â€ etc.ğŸ”½The phrase â€œafter death, he existsâ€ means

analyzed: shi ba'i dus kyi 'og tu de bzhin 'byung ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: that he exists after the time of death.

original: 'jig rten rgyang pan pa rnams kyi phyir yod dam ci zhes zur gyis 'dri bas grangs can la sogs pa gzugs la sogs par gtogs pa'i phye ba la rtog pa'o //ğŸ”½de bzhin du bdag thams cad du rjes su 'gro bas med par 'jig pas mi 'byung ngo zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: 'jig rten rgyang pan pa rnams kyi btsums pa la rtog pa'o //
translated: The phrase because the self is not all-pervading is a rhetorical question for the Lokayatas.ğŸ”½The phrase because the self is not unitary and eternal, and because the states are not different is a rhetorical question for the Ajivikas.ğŸ”½The phrase because the self is not unitary and eternal, and because the states are not different is a rhetorical question for the Nirgranthas and others.ğŸ”½The phrase because the self is not unitary and eternal, and because the states are not different is a rhetorical question for the Nirgranthas and others.

analyzed: bya ba ni gang zag tu smra ba rnams kyi gnyi ga gdags pa la brten pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o // rnam par rtog pa 'di dag ni de kho na nyid du nam skyes pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Action is the conceptualization of both based on the imputation of persons by those who propound persons.

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun rdzob tu yod pa'i bdag gi rang bzhin gyi de bzhin gshegs pa la rnam pa 'ga' zhig ltar gnas thob pa ma yin no //

analyzed: de bzhin du stong pa nyid bstan pa na /
translated: Similarly, when emptiness is taught,

analyzed: rab tu dbye ba ston par mdzad pa yin no //

analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyi rnam pa mkhyen pa bstan pa ni / rab 'byor gzhan yang 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The teaching of the knowledge of the mode of suchness is as follows.ğŸ”½Subhuti, it is like this. The Tathagata, etc.

analyzed: de bzhin du rab 'byor de bzhin gshegs pas de bzhin nyid ji lta ba bzhin du gzugs mkhyen to zhes bya ba ni /

original: rten cing 'brel 'byung gang yin pa //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel 'byung gang yin pa //

original: de nyid khyod ni stong par bzhed //
analyzed: de nyid khyod ni stong par bzhed //
translated: You have taught to be emptiness.

original: ces bshad pas gzugs la sogs pa de bzhin nyid kyi rnam par yongs su mkhyen pas phye ba la sogs pa yang de bzhin nyid du yongs su mkhyen to zhes bya ba'i don to /

translated: Thus, by knowing the suchness of form, etc., he knows the suchness of the classifications of form, etc.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi thugs su chud pa'i de bzhin nyid de gzhan la ston cing 'dogs pa mkhyen pa ston pa ni /
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi thugs su chud pa'i de bzhin nyid de gzhan la ston cing 'dogs pa mkhyen pa ston pa ni /
translated: The teaching of the knowledge of the suchness that is realized by the perfect Buddha and is taught and imputed to others is as follows.

original: rab 'byor de ltar na de bzhin gshegs pas de bzhin nyid la de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar na de bzhin gshegs pas de bzhin nyid la de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Thus, SubhÅ«ti, the TathÄgata is a TathÄgata in terms of suchness, etc.

original: de bzhin nyid du 'dogs par mdzad do zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad kyi rjes su 'gro ba'i de bzhin nyid tshul gcig tu rnam par 'jog par mdzad pa yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid du 'dogs par mdzad do zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad kyi rjes su 'gro ba'i de bzhin nyid tshul gcig tu rnam par 'jog par mdzad pa yin te /
translated: He makes the designation in terms of suchness means that he establishes the suchness that is the common characteristic of all phenomena as being of one mode.

original: 'dis ni de bzhin du 'dogs pa'i ye shes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni de bzhin du 'dogs pa'i ye shes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This is the statement of the wisdom that designates in that way.

original: de bzhin nyid gsungs pa ni rab 'byor phung po'i de bzhin nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid gsungs pa ni rab 'byor phung po'i de bzhin nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: The statement of suchness is the suchness of the aggregates, etc.

original: chos thams cad tha dad pa nyid ma yin nam /ğŸ”½ji ltar de bzhin na nyid tha mi dad snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas /
analyzed: chos thams cad tha dad pa nyid ma yin nam / ji ltar de bzhin na nyid tha mi dad snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas /
translated: Arenâ€™t all phenomena distinct?ğŸ”½How can suchness be undifferentiated?ğŸ”½In response to this doubt, he says, â€œWhy is it so, SubhÅ«ti?â€

original: rab 'byor de bzhin gshegs @208b pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rab 'byor de bzhin gshegs @208b pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The TathÄgata, etc.

original: gang gi phyir phung bo lnga ni 'jig rten no zhes ming du mdzod cing grangs so zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis phung po lngas chos thams cad ston pa'i skabs su gsungs pa de bas na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir phung bo lnga ni 'jig rten no zhes ming du mdzod cing grangs so zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis phung po lngas chos thams cad ston pa'i skabs su gsungs pa de bas na /
translated: Because the five aggregates are called the world in name and number, the Lord said in the context of teaching all dharmas with the five aggregates:

original: 'jig rten rtag pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis tha dang pa gzhan ni yod pa ma yin gyi gdul bya nye bar gnas pa'i shes pa la ltos nas chos tha dad ba nyid du gsungs par zad do //
analyzed: 'jig rten rtag pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis tha dang pa gzhan ni yod pa ma yin gyi gdul bya nye bar gnas pa'i shes pa la ltos nas chos tha dad ba nyid du gsungs par zad do //
translated: Therefore, there is no other world that is different in character as permanent, etc., but it is just said to be a different dharma in dependence on the cognition of the disciple present.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa ni rab 'byor de lta bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa ni rab 'byor de lta bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: In order to demonstrate just that, he said, â€œTherefore, Subhuti, etc.â€

original: de bzhin nyid 'di ni gcig pa dngos po dang dngos po med pa du ma dang bral ba ste zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid 'di ni gcig pa dngos po dang dngos po med pa du ma dang bral ba ste zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This thusness is one, free from the multiplicity of things and nonthings.

original: de kho na nyid dun ma skyes pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas dngos po'i chos las yang dag par 'das pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de kho na nyid dun ma skyes pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas dngos po'i chos las yang dag par 'das pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Since it is the nature of non-production in reality, it is completely beyond the dharmas of things.

original: gcig pa ma yin zhing tha dad pa yang ma yin pa'i phyir stong pa nyid kyi tshul gyis de bzhin nyid 'di ni chos thams cad la gcig pa yin te /
analyzed: gcig pa ma yin zhing tha dad pa yang ma yin pa'i phyir stong pa nyid kyi tshul gyis de bzhin nyid 'di ni chos thams cad la gcig pa yin te /
translated: This thusness is the same in all things, by way of emptiness, because it is neither the same nor different.

original: bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa'i dngos po dang snga na med pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis med pa du ma dang bral ba ni sbyor ba'i lam du'o //
analyzed: bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa'i dngos po dang snga na med pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis med pa du ma dang bral ba ni sbyor ba'i lam du'o //
translated: It is free from the manifold, by way of the non-existence of things such as pots and cloth, and by way of the non-existence of characteristics such as non-existence prior to existence, on the path of application.

original: de bzhin du mthong ba dang sgom pa dang khyad par dang mthar thug pa'i lam la go rims bzhin du mi zad pa'i phyir dang 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir dang / gnyis su med pa'i phyir dang / gnyis su byar med pa'i phyir de bzhin nyid 'di ni gcig pa'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du mthong ba dang sgom pa dang khyad par dang mthar thug pa'i lam la go rims bzhin du mi zad pa'i phyir dang 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir dang / gnyis su med pa'i phyir dang / gnyis su byar med pa'i phyir de bzhin nyid 'di ni gcig pa'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Similarly, this thusness is the same, on the path of seeing, the path of cultivation, the path of distinction, and the path of conclusion, respectively, because it is inexhaustible, because it is unchanging, because it is non-dual, and because it is not to be made dual, as one should understand.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la brten nas /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la brten nas /
translated: This is the perfection of wisdom.

original: de bzhin nyid 'di mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so zhes bya ba 'dis ni de bzhin nyid thugs su chung ba'i shes pa ston pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid 'di mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so zhes bya ba 'dis ni de bzhin nyid thugs su chung ba'i shes pa ston pa yin no //
translated: This suchness is fully awakened to means that he has the knowledge of suchness.

original: 'jig rten 'di la 'jig rten yang dag par ston pa yin te zhes bya ba ni dngos po la mngon par zhen pa'i 'jig rten la /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'di la 'jig rten yang dag par ston pa yin te zhes bya ba ni dngos po la mngon par zhen pa'i 'jig rten la /
translated: He is the one who shows the world the world as it is means that he shows to the world which is attached to things

original: 'jig rten sgyu ma dang 'dra bar ston pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten sgyu ma dang 'dra bar ston pa'o //
translated: that the world is like an illusion.

original: de bzhin nyid mkhyen to //ğŸ”½ma log pa'i de bzhin nyid mkhyen to //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid mkhyen to // ma log pa'i de bzhin nyid mkhyen to //
translated: He knows suchness.

original: gzhan ma yin pa'i de bzhin nyid mkhyen to //
analyzed: gzhan ma yin pa'i de bzhin nyid mkhyen to //
translated: He knows suchness as it is not otherwise.ğŸ”½He knows suchness as it is not otherwise means that he knows suchness as it is not otherwise.

original: zhes bya ba'i tshig gsum ni go rims bzhin du kun tu brtags pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang dang yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo sgyu ma lta bur gzigs pa yin par brjod do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshig gsum ni go rims bzhin du kun tu brtags pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang dang yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo sgyu ma lta bur gzigs pa yin par brjod do //
translated: These three phrases respectively express the vision of the illusory nature of the imagined, the relative, and the perfect.

original: de bzhin nyid mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pas na de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba 'dis ni de bzhin nyid mchog tu mkhyen ba'i ye shes mkhyen @209a * //

translated: And because he fully and completely awakened to suchness, he is called the Tathagata.ğŸ”½

analyzed: de bas na bdag nyid mi mnyam pa dang mnyam zhing mtshungs pa yin pas /

analyzed: rigs pa mtshungs pa nyid yin no zhes dgongs nas / rab 'byor de de bzhin no //

analyzed: de de bzhin te /

analyzed: rab 'byor gzugs kyang gzhal du med pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gzhal du med pa nyid bshad pa yin no //

analyzed: tshad ma yod pa la ji ltar gzhal du med pa yin snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes rtog pa la /

analyzed: gzugs kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni grangs med pa nyid bshad pa yin no // bgrang ba las 'das pa'i @213a * //

translated: The phrase â€œthe state of consciousnessâ€ refers to the appearance of an illusion-like object. The meaning of the phrase â€œinconceivableâ€ and so on is that the object is relative.

analyzed: nye bar bsdu pa'i don ni rab 'byor de bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //

original: zag pa med pa'i chos bstan pa rgyu phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pa la 'bras bu med pa ma yin pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /

translated: The phrase â€œthe Blessed One saidâ€ refers to the teaching of the uncontaminated dharmas, which is endowed with the perfection of causes and is not devoid of results.

translated: The phrase â€œthe mind is liberated from the contaminations without graspingâ€ means that the mind is liberated from the contaminations because the seeds of the latent afflictions have not been generated.

translated: The phrase â€œwith regard to phenomena, the eye of Dharma became utterly pure, free of dust and free of contaminantsâ€ means that with regard to the object of knowledge, the eye of Dharma, which is free of the fault of being an expounder, is free of dust with regard to the acceptance of the knowledge of the Dharma that is the truth of suffering, and so on.ğŸ”½It is free of contaminants with regard to the knowledge of the Dharma.

original: chos shes pa rnams kyi dri ma dang bral ba skyes pas rnam par dag pa'o //ğŸ”½mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob par gyur to zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad skye ba med pa'o zhes chos la nges par rtog pa'i bzod pa 'am /
analyzed: chos shes pa rnams kyi dri ma dang bral ba skyes pas rnam par dag pa'o // mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob par gyur to zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad skye ba med pa'o zhes chos la nges par rtog pa'i bzod pa 'am /

original: de dag kyang zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' nyi khri tsam mo //
analyzed: de dag kyang zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' nyi khri tsam mo //
translated: The phrase â€œthose bodhisattvasâ€ refers to the twenty thousand bodhisattvas.

original: kha cig na re gang 'di sangs rgyas kyi rigs ni thog ma med pa yin pa 'am sangs rgyas re re 'byung ba na sems can grangs med pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das mod kyi /

translated: Some say: The lineage of the buddhas is beginningless. Or, although countless sentient beings attain nirvana when each buddha appears,

analyzed: de lta na yang 'khor ba la zad pa med pas mtha' yas pa'i phyir nam mkha' dang 'dra ste /

analyzed: dper na gser gyi dri ma la sogs pa lta bu'o //

original: 'phags pa'i gang zag thams cad sdud pa'i khyad par kun 'byung ba'i skad cig ma dang pos bsdus pa bstan pa ni bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni zab ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i gang zag thams cad sdud pa'i khyad par kun 'byung ba'i skad cig ma dang pos bsdus pa bstan pa ni bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni zab ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The special inclusion of all noble persons, included by the first moment of the origin of the teaching, is taught in the passage beginning, â€œThe Bhagavat, the perfection of wisdom is deep.â€ğŸ”½Since there is no connection with the Mother, Buddhahood, etc., how is it that it abides with great activity?

original: yum dang sangs rgyas nyid la sogs pa la 'brel pa med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ji ltar na bya ba chen pos nye bar gnas pa yin pa'i dogs pa de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas /

original: rab 'byor 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: and is resolved by the passage beginning, â€œSubhuti, this is the perfection of wisdom of the Bodhisattvas, the great beings.â€

translated: And is endowed with omniscience is the connection of the perfection of wisdom with the knowledge of all aspects.

original: yum 'bras bu thams cad dang 'brel par dpes bstan pa ni rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: yum 'bras bu thams cad dang 'brel par dpes bstan pa ni rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The mother is connected with all results is taught by the example: Subhuti, it is thus:

original: spyi bo nas dbang bskur ba zhes bya ba ni rigs che ba bco brgyad kyis dbang bskur ba 'am /ğŸ”½glang po'i rgyal po'i sna'i chus @214a * //

original: dbang bskur ba'o //
analyzed: dbang bskur ba'o //

original: yul gyi mi la mthu dang brtson 'grus thob pa'i zhes bya ba ni rang gi rgyal srid las nyams pa'i 'jigs pa med yul gyi mi la mthu thob pa yin la /

analyzed: de rnams tshar gcod pa dang phan 'dogs par nus pa dang ldan pas brtson 'grus thob pa yin no//

analyzed: bya ba zhes bya ba ni las su bya ba'o //
translated: Action is what is to be done.

original: 'brel ba zhes bya ba ni blon po chen po dang yang dag par ldan pa'o //
analyzed: 'brel ba zhes bya ba ni blon po chen po dang yang dag par ldan pa'o //
translated: Connection is the possession of a great minister.

original: de la lus dang ngag gi bya ba rnams med pas go rims bzhin du brtson 'grus chung zhing khur bor bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de la lus dang ngag gi bya ba rnams med pas go rims bzhin du brtson 'grus chung zhing khur bor bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Since there is no action of body and speech, one has little effort and puts down the burden, respectively.

original: yongs su 'dzin pa dang mngon par chags pa med par rtogs pa mi 'thad de zhes dogs pa ni bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol pa yin no //

original: lan bstan pa'i phyir slar 'dri bar mdzad pa ni rab 'byor de ji snyam du sems zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: lan bstan pa'i phyir slar 'dri bar mdzad pa ni rab 'byor de ji snyam du sems zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /

original: yongs su 'dzin pa 'am mngon par chags par 'gyur bzhes bya ba ni go rims bzhin du gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa dag tu 'dzin pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags te zhes bya ba la 'dir bsdus pa'i don ni 'di yin te /

translated: Because the noble person who abides on the path of seeing and so on through nonconceptual wisdomğŸ”½does not engage in conceptualization in the manner of â€œThis is the object, the effect,

analyzed: bdag ni 'dzin pa po yin no zhes bya ba la de lta bu'i tshul gyi rnam par rtog pa la kun du spyod pa ma yin te /

original: de lta bu'i ye shes ni /
analyzed: de lta bu'i ye shes ni /

original: gzhan du na brjod pa dang bcas pa'i shes pas ji ltar gnas pa'i dngos po nyams su myong par mi 'thad pas /

translated: Otherwise, it would not be tenable that cognition with expression experiences things as they are,ğŸ”½because it is not the case that the object of expression is the object of cognition.

original: shes pa bden pa dang bral ba nyid kyis lam mi 'byung ba'i phyir thos pa dang bsam pa'i gnas skabs dang 'dra bar nyon mongs pa spangs pa med pa na dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu mi 'byung bar 'gyur ro //ğŸ”½de bas na rnal 'byor pa lam las 'das ba nyid na nags la sogs pa la gcig pa nyid du mngon par zhen pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba dang 'dra bar gzung ba dang 'dzin par sgro btags pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang
analyzed: shes pa bden pa dang bral ba nyid kyis lam mi 'byung ba'i phyir thos pa dang bsam pa'i gnas skabs dang 'dra bar nyon mongs pa spangs pa med pa na dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu mi 'byung bar 'gyur ro // de bas na rnal 'byor pa lam las 'das ba nyid na nags la sogs pa la gcig pa nyid du mngon par zhen pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba dang 'dra bar gzung ba dang 'dzin par sgro btags pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang
translated: Because the path does not arise due to the absence of the truth of consciousness, the fruit of arhatship does not arise, just like the occasion of hearing and reflection, because the afflictions are not abandoned.

original: bral ba'i blo skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bral ba'i blo skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, when the yogi transcends the path, the mind arises free from the conceptualization of superimposition of apprehendeds and apprehenders, just like being free from conceptualization such as the superimposition of oneness in a forest, etc.

original: des kyang dngos po'i de kho na nyid ma 'dzin pas chos de @214b lta bu ni bdag gis ma mthong ngo zhes bya ba yin no //

analyzed: 'di nyid kho na rjes su gnas pa ni rab 'byor de di bzhin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //

original: skye bo dmigs pa can la rjes su brtse ba ni bcom ldan 'das theg pa la gsar du zhugs pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol pa yin te /

translated: Having gone to a place not too far, he disappeared means that he went on foot as far as the range of vision of ordinary people, and from there he went by his own magical power.

analyzed: de nyid phyi bzhin 'gro bar 'gyur zhes gsungs pa yin te chos smra ba 'dor bar mi byed pa nyid kyis so //

analyzed: yon tan 'di dag dang ldan pa'i zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mos shing zhum par mi 'gyur ba la sogs pa'o //

analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba'i sgo nas lan btab pa ni rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //

analyzed: ldog pa'i sgo nas kyang bstan pa ni rab 'byor yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //

analyzed: 'bras bu rgyu gang yin pa'i rjes su 'brang ba 'di ni chos nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
