original: gang gis snga ma bzhin du dus thams cad du yongs su dri ba byas pa ma yin no zhes bya bar dgongs pa yin te /
analyzed: gang gis snga ma bzhin du dus thams cad du yongs su dri ba byas pa ma yin no zhes bya bar dgongs pa yin te /
translated: It is not that he does not ask questions at all times as before.ğŸ”½This is the intention.

original: 'di ltar nyi ma gcig gam zhes bya ba la sogs pa de ma thag tu gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar nyi ma gcig gam zhes bya ba la sogs pa de ma thag tu gsungs pa yin no //
translated: It is just as he said immediately before, â€œFor a day, etc.â€ğŸ”½Some follow by inclination.

original: 'gres 'ga' ni 'dun pas rjes su 'brang bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni nyin zhag nyung zad gcig bslabs pa'i stobs kyis mngan par 'dod pa de tsam zhig tu 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'gres 'ga' ni 'dun pas rjes su 'brang bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni nyin zhag nyung zad gcig bslabs pa'i stobs kyis mngan par 'dod pa de tsam zhig tu 'gyur te /
translated: Through the power of training for a little while, they become inclined to just that much.

original: 'bras bu ni rgyu'i rjes su mthun pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu ni rgyu'i rjes su mthun pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes 'dod pa yin no //
translated: Because the effect is in accordance with the cause.

original: de phyir zhing g-yengs pa dang zhes bya ba ni dad pa las nyams pa'o //
analyzed: de phyir zhing g-yengs pa dang zhes bya ba ni dad pa las nyams pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is said that â€œhe is distractedâ€ because he has lost his faith.

original: zhum par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni dad pa dang ldan pa yin du zin na yang ngo //ğŸ”½blo rgod par 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni so sor nges pa'i @216a * //
analyzed: zhum par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni dad pa dang ldan pa yin du zin na yang ngo // blo rgod par 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni so sor nges pa'i @216a * //
translated: â€œHe is depressedâ€ means that even though he has faith,

original: chos dmigs pa ma rnyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos dmigs pa ma rnyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: â€œhis mind is agitatedâ€ means that he does not find the object of his meditation.ğŸ”½It is said that â€œhe is like cotton wool.â€

original: de nyid ni ras bal gyi 'da' ba bzhin du 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: de nyid ni ras bal gyi 'da' ba bzhin du 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin te /
translated: Cotton wool is light and unstable, and so it is like cotton wool.ğŸ”½He is not fit to be taught, because he is not a fit vessel for the teaching.

original: ras bal bkal ba'i phyir smal ba ni ras bal gyi 'da' ba ste /
analyzed: ras bal bkal ba'i phyir smal ba ni ras bal gyi 'da' ba ste /
translated: He is not fit to be guided, because he is not a fit vessel for the instructions.

original: de dang bstan par mi gnas par chos mthun zhing 'dra ba'i phyir de bzhin du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de dang bstan par mi gnas par chos mthun zhing 'dra ba'i phyir de bzhin du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: He is not fit to be instructed, because he is not a fit vessel for the Dharma.ğŸ”½He is not fit to be admonished, because he is not a fit vessel for the counsel.ğŸ”½He is not fit to be assisted, because he is not a fit vessel for the assistance.

original: gnyan pa la sogs pa'i gnas skabs su 'am spyor ba la sogs pa'i gnas skabs su go rims bzhin du rjes su 'dzin par mi 'gyur rjes su 'jug par mi 'gyur rjes su bstan par mi 'gyur ro zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: gnyan pa la sogs pa'i gnas skabs su 'am spyor ba la sogs pa'i gnas skabs su go rims bzhin du rjes su 'dzin par mi 'gyur rjes su 'jug par mi 'gyur rjes su bstan par mi 'gyur ro zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: He is not fit to be disciplined, because he is not a fit vessel for the discipline.

original: dmigs pa'i khyad par skad cig ma bzhi pas bsdus pa bstan pa ni rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i khyad par skad cig ma bzhi pas bsdus pa bstan pa ni rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The special object is taught by the fourth moment: Subhuti, it is thus: for example, etc.

original: phyi dang nang gi gnod pa med pas bde bar pha rol gyi 'gram du zhes bya ba'i tshig gnyis smos pa yin no //
analyzed: phyi dang nang gi gnod pa med pas bde bar pha rol gyi 'gram du zhes bya ba'i tshig gnyis smos pa yin no //
translated: The two phrases, â€œhe goes to the other shoreâ€ and â€œwithout injury or harm,â€ refer to the absence of injury or harm from internal and external sources.

original: de nyid ni ma rmas ma smad par zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid ni ma rmas ma smad par zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: That is what is meant by â€œwithout injury or harm.â€

original: bar ma dor zhes bya ba ni bar nyid du rnam par 'jig cing nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bar ma dor zhes bya ba ni bar nyid du rnam par 'jig cing nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: â€œIn the middleâ€ means that he would perish and be destroyed in the middle.

original: dad pa yod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la de la dad pa yod pa ni yod pa nyid du mngon par yid ches pa'o //
analyzed: dad pa yod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la de la dad pa yod pa ni yod pa nyid du mngon par yid ches pa'o //
translated: â€œHaving faith, etc.,â€ means that he has faith in the existence of the other shore.

original: bzod pa yod pa ni mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa'o //
analyzed: bzod pa yod pa ni mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa'o //
translated: â€œHaving patienceâ€ means that he has the patience to accept that dharmas are not produced.

original: sred pa ni 'dzin pa nyid du'o //
analyzed: sred pa ni 'dzin pa nyid du'o //
translated: â€œCravingâ€ means that he is attached to the other shore.

original: 'dun pa ni byed 'dod pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'dun pa ni byed 'dod pa nyid do //
translated: â€œAspirationâ€ means that he wants to go there.

original: brtson 'grus ni dge bal spro ba'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus ni dge bal spro ba'o //
translated: â€œExertionâ€ means that he is eager to do what is wholesome.

original: bag byed pa ni dge ba dang mi dge ba dag go rims bzhin du bsten pa dang mi bsten pa la'o //
analyzed: bag byed pa ni dge ba dang mi dge ba dag go rims bzhin du bsten pa dang mi bsten pa la'o //
translated: 1) Respect is the reliance on virtue and nonvirtue, respectively.

original: mos pa ni nges pa kho nar 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: mos pa ni nges pa kho nar 'dzin pa'o //
translated: 2) Interest is the holding of certainty.

original: lhag pa'i bsam pa ni gzhan gyi don byed pa la sogs pa la sems gzhol ba'o //
analyzed: lhag pa'i bsam pa ni gzhan gyi don byed pa la sogs pa la sems gzhol ba'o //
translated: 3) Superior intention is the inclination of the mind toward the benefit of others and so on.

original: gtong ba ni dngos po thams cad 'bras bu dang bcas par sbyin par byed pa'o //
analyzed: gtong ba ni dngos po thams cad 'bras bu dang bcas par sbyin par byed pa'o //
translated: 4) Generosity is the giving of all things together with the fruit.

original: gus pa ni thams cad la 'dud pa nyid du'o //
analyzed: gus pa ni thams cad la 'dud pa nyid du'o //
translated: 5) Reverence is the bowing to all.

original: dga' ba ni yid bde ba'o //
analyzed: dga' ba ni yid bde ba'o //
translated: 6) Joy is mental satisfaction.

original: mgu ba ni dga' ba'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: mgu ba ni dga' ba'i khyad par ro //
translated: 7) Contentment is a special joy.

original: dang ba ni yon tan dang ldan par mthong bas mos pa'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: dang ba ni yon tan dang ldan par mthong bas mos pa'i khyad par ro //
translated: 8) Faith is a special interest through seeing the possession of virtues.

original: rab tu dga' ba ni bsgrub par nus pa la mngon par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba ni bsgrub par nus pa la mngon par 'dod pa'o //
translated: 9) Delight is the desire for the accomplishment that is possible.

original: brtson pa mi 'dor ba ni dam bcas pa'i khur mi 'dor ba'o //
analyzed: brtson pa mi 'dor ba ni dam bcas pa'i khur mi 'dor ba'o //
translated: 10) Nonabandonment of effort is the nonabandonment of the burden of the vow.

original: 'ju ba dang mi 'ju ba'i dpes ni bar chad dang bcas pa dang bar chad med par byed pa dag rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang / gnyen po'i dngos por gsal bar bstan par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'ju ba dang mi 'ju ba'i dpes ni bar chad dang bcas pa dang bar chad med par byed pa dag rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang / gnyen po'i dngos por gsal bar bstan par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The example of the digestible and indigestible illustrates the factors that are adverse to and the remedies for the knowledge of all modes.

original: rten gyi khyad par gyi lam gyi skad cig ma dang pos bsdus pa bstan pa ni rab 'byor 'di lta ste @216b dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: rten gyi khyad par gyi lam gyi skad cig ma dang pos bsdus pa bstan pa ni rab 'byor 'di lta ste @216b dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The path that is included in the first moment of the special support is taught by â€œSubhuti, it is thus, for example,â€ etc.

original: 'di ni rigs pa ma yin no snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas /
analyzed: 'di ni rigs pa ma yin no snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas /
translated: The doubt that this is not reasonable is introduced by â€œWhy is that?â€

original: dngos po'i chos nyid kyis lan btab pa ni 'di ltar bum pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: dngos po'i chos nyid kyis lan btab pa ni 'di ltar bum pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The answer by way of the intrinsic nature of things is given by â€œThus, for example, a pot,â€ etc.

original: chu de khyer na zhes bya ba ni chu 'degs na'o //
analyzed: chu de khyer na zhes bya ba ni chu 'degs na'o //
translated: â€œIf one carries that waterâ€ means if one lifts up the water.

original: de bzhin du de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes rtog pa la snga ma bzhin du 'di ltar bum pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes rtog pa la snga ma bzhin du 'di ltar bum pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: Similarly, why is that? in the thought, he says, In that case, a pot, etc.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang thabs la mkhas pas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang thabs la mkhas pas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Wisdom and skill in means

original: stong pa nyid dang snying rje chen po dag gis zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang snying rje chen po dag gis zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: means emptiness and great compassion.

original: bum pa so btang ba dang ma btang ba dag ni sgrub pa'i chos kyi rten dang rten ma yin pa'i ngo bo bstan pa'i don du yin no //
analyzed: bum pa so btang ba dang ma btang ba dag ni sgrub pa'i chos kyi rten dang rten ma yin pa'i ngo bo bstan pa'i don du yin no //
translated: The pot with and without a hole are taught for the purpose of showing the nature of the basis and non-basis of the established dharma.

original: rgyu tshogs pa'i khyad par skad cig ma gnyis pas bsdus pa bstan pa ni rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na skye sa bu shes rab 'chal ba'i rang bzhin can zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: rgyu tshogs pa'i khyad par skad cig ma gnyis pas bsdus pa bstan pa ni rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na skye sa bu shes rab 'chal ba'i rang bzhin can zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The teaching on the special collection of causes included in the second moment is stated by Subhuti, it is thus. For example, a foolish son of a farmer, etc.

original: mig tshags ma byas shing zhes bya ba ni chu 'dzag pa'i gnas su shing shun la sogs pas ma btsangs pas so //
analyzed: mig tshags ma byas shing zhes bya ba ni chu 'dzag pa'i gnas su shing shun la sogs pas ma btsangs pas so //
translated: Not having put on eye ointment means not having applied tree bark, etc. to the place where water leaks.

original: ma bcos pa zhes bya ba ni shing rul pa ma bsal ba'o //ğŸ”½khal gyis non pa'i zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ma bcos pa zhes bya ba ni shing rul pa ma bsal ba'o // khal gyis non pa'i zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The unrefined is the unremoved rotten wood.

original: khal lci bas non pa'i nang du zhugs par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: khal lci bas non pa'i nang du zhugs par 'dod pa'o //
translated: The overburdened is the one who wishes to enter the river that is overburdened with a heavy load.

original: pha rol du ma rgal bar de'i rdzas kyang gzhan du 'gyur la zhes bya ba ni skam sar ma phyin par rdzas rnams chud za bar 'gyur pa'o //
analyzed: pha rol du ma rgal bar de'i rdzas kyang gzhan du 'gyur la zhes bya ba ni skam sar ma phyin par rdzas rnams chud za bar 'gyur pa'o //
translated: The unfordable is the one who has not crossed to the other side, and whose goods are lost.

original: yongs su nyams par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni ma thob par yongs su nyams pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su nyams par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni ma thob par yongs su nyams pa'o //
translated: The lost is the one who has not attained and has lost.

original: bar ma dor chud za bar zhes bya ba ni bar du nyams par 'gyur zhing sangs rgyas kyi sa las nyams par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: bar ma dor chud za bar zhes bya ba ni bar du nyams par 'gyur zhing sangs rgyas kyi sa las nyams par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The lost in the middle is the one who has lost in the middle and has lost the stage of Buddhahood.

original: nges pa med par ma 'ongs par gnas par byed pa ji ltar snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas /
analyzed: nges pa med par ma 'ongs par gnas par byed pa ji ltar snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas /
translated: The uncertain is the one who is uncertain about the future. The doubt is raised, Why is that?

original: rgyu ma tshang ba med pa tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa rung ba nyid rjes su dpag pa ni rab 'byor de ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: rgyu ma tshang ba med pa tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa rung ba nyid rjes su dpag pa ni rab 'byor de ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: The connection between the mere completeness of the cause and the suitability of the result is inferred by the statement â€œSubhÅ«ti, it is like this.â€

original: gru mig tshags byas pa ngang ma byas pa smos pa ni sgrub pa tshang ba dang ma tshang ba shes bar bya ba'i don yin no //
analyzed: gru mig tshags byas pa ngang ma byas pa smos pa ni sgrub pa tshang ba dang ma tshang ba shes bar bya ba'i don yin no //
translated: The mention of the boat with its planks fastened together and its rudder in place is for the purpose of understanding the completeness and incompleteness of the means.

original: yongs su gzung ba'i khyad par skad cig ma gsum pas bsdus pa bstan pa ni rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na skyes bu 'ga' zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: yongs su gzung ba'i khyad par skad cig ma gsum pas bsdus pa bstan pa ni rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na skyes bu 'ga' zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The special retention that is included in the third moment is taught by the statement beginning â€œSubhÅ«ti, it is like this.â€

original: de la lus rnyings pa nyid yin pas na rgan pa'o //
analyzed: de la lus rnyings pa nyid yin pas na rgan pa'o //
translated: There, because the body is old, he is old.

original: na tshod du phyin pa nyid kyis ni rgas shing ngo //ğŸ”½legs @217a * //
analyzed: na tshod du phyin pa nyid kyis ni rgas shing ngo // legs @217a * //
translated: Because he has reached the age, he is aged.

original: par smras pa dang nyes par smras pa nyid dang bral bas na 'khogs pa'o //
analyzed: par smras pa dang nyes par smras pa nyid dang bral bas na 'khogs pa'o //
translated: He is decrepit because he is free from good speech and bad speech.

original: nad des bcom pas zhes bya ba ni nye bar bcom pa'o //
analyzed: nad des bcom pas zhes bya ba ni nye bar bcom pa'o //
translated: He is overcome by that disease means he is overcome by that.

original: de bzhin du de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes rtog pa la //
analyzed: de bzhin du de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes rtog pa la //
translated: Similarly, why is that? is a question.

original: de ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /ğŸ”½skyes bu rgan po yongs su bzung ba dang ma bzung ba'i dpe bstan pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang thabs la mkhas pas yongs su bzung ba dang yongs su ma zin pa dag gis ci rigs par 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / skyes bu rgan po yongs su bzung ba dang ma bzung ba'i dpe bstan pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang thabs la mkhas pas yongs su bzung ba dang yongs su ma zin pa dag gis ci rigs par 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das
translated: The answer is it is like this and so forth.

original: pa dag gi mthar ltung ba dang mi ltung ba gsal bar bstan pa'i don yin no //
analyzed: pa dag gi mthar ltung ba dang mi ltung ba gsal bar bstan pa'i don yin no //
translated: The example of an old man, whether taken or not taken, is taught to clarify, respectively, the falling off and not falling off of the extremes of cyclic life and of nirvana by those who are taken and not taken by the perfection of wisdom and skill in means.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bshad pa mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan gyi snang ba las dpe'i le'u zhes bya ste bcu bzhi pa'o /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bshad pa mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan gyi snang ba las dpe'i le'u zhes bya ste bcu bzhi pa'o /
translated: This concludes the fourteenth chapter of the Ornament of Clear Realization, the chapter on the examples.

original: // / ro myang ba med pa'i khyad par bstan pa ni lam gyi skad cig ma bzhi pas bsdus pa bstan pa ni bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol ba yin no //
analyzed: // / ro myang ba med pa'i khyad par bstan pa ni lam gyi skad cig ma bzhi pas bsdus pa bstan pa ni bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol ba yin no //
translated: The teaching on the distinction of non-tasting, included in the fourth moment of the path, is presented by the request beginning with Blessed One, bodhisattvas.

original: de la lus dang ngag dang 'khor la sogs pa phul bas mnyes par bya ba yin pa'i phyir go rims bzhin du bsnyen par bya bsten par bya bsnyen bkur bya'o zhes bya bar spyar ro //
analyzed: de la lus dang ngag dang 'khor la sogs pa phul bas mnyes par bya ba yin pa'i phyir go rims bzhin du bsnyen par bya bsten par bya bsnyen bkur bya'o zhes bya bar spyar ro //
translated: Since they are pleased by the offering of body, speech, retinue, and so on, they should be served, attended upon, and honored, respectively.

original: rnal 'byor du gyis shig ces bya ba ni sbyin par bya ba dang sbyin pa dang len pa po la sogs pa mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis bsgrub pa la 'bad par gyis shig ces pa'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor du gyis shig ces bya ba ni sbyin par bya ba dang sbyin pa dang len pa po la sogs pa mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis bsgrub pa la 'bad par gyis shig ces pa'o //
translated: â€œ Practice yogaâ€ means strive to accomplish the object to be given, the giver, and the recipient, and so on, by way of non-apprehension.

original: gzugs su ma bsnyems shig ces bya ba ni gzugs la mngon par zhen pa'i tshul gyis ma 'dzin cig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzugs su ma bsnyems shig ces bya ba ni gzugs la mngon par zhen pa'i tshul gyis ma 'dzin cig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: â€œ Do not be conceited about formâ€ means do not apprehend it by way of attachment to form.

original: de bzhin du de ci'i phyir zhen zhes rtog pa la /
analyzed: de bzhin du de ci'i phyir zhen zhes rtog pa la /
translated: Similarly, â€œWhy is that?â€

original: rigs kyi bu thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te ;
analyzed: rigs kyi bu thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te ;
translated: â€œ Son of noble family, omniscienceâ€ and so on is stated in response to the question.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni de kho na nyid du skye ba med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir rnam pa gang gis kyang so sor brtag par mi bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni de kho na nyid du skye ba med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir rnam pa gang gis kyang so sor brtag par mi bya'o //
translated: Omniscience itself is not to be examined in any way, because it is the nature of non-production in reality.

original: de bzhin du sbyar te zhes bya ba ni de thams cad bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su sngos shig ces bya ba nas /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te zhes bya ba ni de thams cad bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su sngos shig ces bya ba nas /
translated: Thus, etc. means dedicate all of that to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment, etc.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni mi bsnyems pa ste zhes bya ba'i bar gyi gzhung tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa bzhi la bsgre bar bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni mi bsnyems pa ste zhes bya ba'i bar gyi gzhung tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa bzhi la bsgre bar bya'o //
translated: The text up to omniscience is not arrogant should be applied to the four perfections beginning with morality.

original: mthar gyis zhes bya ba ni dang por bdag la sogs par nges pa gsal bas phyi'i don la bzhag pa de'i 'og tu kun brtags pa dang gzhan dbang dang yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid du @217b bshad pas khams gsum sems tsam du rtogs pa sbyar ro
analyzed: mthar gyis zhes bya ba ni dang por bdag la sogs par nges pa gsal bas phyi'i don la bzhag pa de'i 'og tu kun brtags pa dang gzhan dbang dang yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid du @217b bshad pas khams gsum sems tsam du rtogs pa sbyar ro
translated: Gradually means that after first clarifying the certainty of self, etc., one should apply the realization that the three realms are mind-only by explaining the imagined, dependent, and fully present natures.

original: // de'i 'og tu yang dag pa'i don gyi bya ba la nus pa dang mi nus pa yang dag pa dang log pa'i dbye bas kun rdzob kyi bden pa gnyis su rnam par dpyad do //
analyzed: // de'i 'og tu yang dag pa'i don gyi bya ba la nus pa dang mi nus pa yang dag pa dang log pa'i dbye bas kun rdzob kyi bden pa gnyis su rnam par dpyad do //
translated: Then, the two truths of the conventional are analyzed in terms of the distinction between the correct and the incorrect, in terms of the capacity and incapacity for the performance of a function in reality.

original: ma brtags na nyams dga' ba tsam du snga ma snga ma'i rgyu la ltos par bstan nas yang dag pa'i kun rdzob la gnas te /

original: don dam par skye ba med par bsgom par bya ste /
analyzed: don dam par skye ba med par bsgom par bya ste /
translated: One should meditate on the ultimate, which is nonarising.

original: gang gis nyan thos la sogs pa'i lam las byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa'i lam shes pa nyid la sogs pa nyid khyad par gyi lam yin par khyad par zhugs pa yin no //

original: de'i phyir de dag ji skad du bshad pa'i khyad par dang bral ba ni mngon par zhe na pa la sogs pa skye ba'i mtshan nyid kyis go sla ba'i phyir ma bshad do //

original: de skad du yang /

original: 'phags pa kun bsdus mkhas pa yis //

original: rig bya thun mong min shes nyid //
analyzed: rig bya thun mong min shes nyid //

analyzed: shes myur bri dang gang med dang // bsgrub dang yang dag 'grub pa dang // dmigs pa rten dang bcas pa dang // mtha' dag pa dang yongs 'dzin dang // ro myang med dang khyad par ni //

original: bcu drug bdag nyid ces bya ste //

original: gang gis lam ni gzhan dag las //
analyzed: gang gis lam ni gzhan dag las //

original: khyad par 'phags pas khyad par lam //
analyzed: khyad par 'phags pas khyad par lam //

original: zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa yin no //

analyzed: byed pa'i mtshan nyid brjod par bya'o //

translated: The teaching of the function of benefit and happiness is the statement beginning with â€œBhagavÄn, those bodhisattva mahÄsattvas . . .â€

analyzed: de lta bu'i zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas nyid skyed par byed pa'i rgyu ma tshang ba med pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: â€œSuchâ€ means the cause that produces buddhahood is not incomplete.

original: de la ma 'ongs pa dang tshe 'di'i bde ba nye bar bsgrub pa la dgongs nas /
analyzed: de la ma 'ongs pa dang tshe 'di'i bde ba nye bar bsgrub pa la dgongs nas /
translated: With regard to that, intending to establish future and present happiness,

analyzed: phan pa'i phyir dang bde ba'i phyir zhes tshig gnyis gsungs pa yin no //
translated: the two phrases â€œfor the sake of benefitâ€ and â€œfor the sake of happinessâ€ are stated.

The self is not the aggregates, nor is it different from them.ğŸ”½

analyzed: rten la snying brtse ba'i phyir zhugs pa zhes gsungs pa yin no //

analyzed: skyob pa la sogs pa'i byed pa bshad pa'i phyir mdor bstan pa ni /
translated: The phrase in order to demonstrate the activities of protection, etc., is stated in order to demonstrate the activities of protection, etc.

analyzed: 'jig rten gyi skyob par 'gyur bar bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //

translated: The phrase I will become an eye for the blind is stated in order to demonstrate the activity of refuge.ğŸ”½The phrase I will become an island for those without an island is stated in order to demonstrate the activity of reliance.ğŸ”½The phrase I will become a light for those who are in darkness is stated in order to demonstrate the activity of support.

original: skyob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: skyob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase I will become a refuge for those who are without a refuge is stated in order to demonstrate the activity of the basis.ğŸ”½The phrase I will become an abode for those who are without an abode is stated in order to demonstrate the activity of the basis.

original: rnam par smin pa med pa'i chos nyid la 'jog pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa med pa'i chos nyid la 'jog pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase I will become a support for those who are without a support is stated in order to demonstrate the activity of the basis.ğŸ”½The phrase I will become an island for those who are without an island is stated in order to demonstrate the activity of the basis.

analyzed: skyabs kyi byed pa bstan pa ni rab 'byor ji ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The phrase I will become a light for those who are in darkness is stated in order to demonstrate the activity of the basis.

original: de la skye ba ni ma byung ba nyid byung ba'o //
analyzed: de la skye ba ni ma byung ba nyid byung ba'o //
translated: Birth is the coming into existence of what did not exist before.

original: rga ba ni rnyings par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: rga ba ni rnyings par gyur pa'o //
translated: Aging is the change in the continuity of the aggregates.

original: na ba ni bde bar mi gnas pa'o //
analyzed: na ba ni bde bar mi gnas pa'o //

original: 'chi ba ni sngon gyi las kyis 'phangs pa'i ris mthun pa yongs su spangs pa'o //
analyzed: 'chi ba ni sngon gyi las kyis 'phangs pa'i ris mthun pa yongs su spangs pa'o //

original: mya ngan ni yid kyi sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: mya ngan ni yid kyi sdug bsngal lo //
translated: Sorrow is mental suffering.

original: smre sngags 'don pa ni sdug pa'i yon tan rjes su dran pa dang bcas par smre ba'o //
analyzed: smre sngags 'don pa ni sdug pa'i yon tan rjes su dran pa dang bcas par smre ba'o //

original: sdug bsngal ba ni lus kyis mi bde ba myong ba'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba ni lus kyis mi bde ba myong ba'o //
translated: Suffering is the experience of physical pain.

original: yid mi bde ba ni snga ma bzhin du sems kyis so //
analyzed: yid mi bde ba ni snga ma bzhin du sems kyis so //
translated: Mental dissatisfaction is the experience of mental pain.

original: 'khrug pa ni khur khur ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'khrug pa ni khur khur ba la sogs pa'o //

original: skyabs zhes bya ba ni gtan du phan pa nye bar sgrub pa'i don gyis so //
analyzed: skyabs zhes bya ba ni gtan du phan pa nye bar sgrub pa'i don gyis so //
translated: Refuge is the attainment of ultimate benefit.

original: gnas kyi byed pa bstan pa ni rab 'byor ji ltar na 'jig rten gyi gnas su zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: gnas kyi byed pa bstan pa ni rab 'byor ji ltar na 'jig rten gyi gnas su zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The function of a refuge is taught in the passage beginning â€œSubhÅ«ti, how is the world a refuge?â€

original: sbyor ba med par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sbyor ba med par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase â€œin order to be without attachmentâ€ means

original: gzugs la sogs pa skye ba med par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa skye ba med par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: unproduced.

original: gnas su 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal las bzlog pa'i don gyis so //
analyzed: gnas su 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal las bzlog pa'i don gyis so //
translated: â€œIt becomes a refugeâ€ means that it has the meaning of turning away from suffering.

original: sbyor ba med pa'i don nyid gsal bar bya ba ni /
analyzed: sbyor ba med pa'i don nyid gsal bar bya ba ni /
translated: The meaning of non-application is clarified

original: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na sbyor ba ma mchis lags zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol pa yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na sbyor ba ma mchis lags zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol pa yin no //
translated: by the question, â€œBlessed One, how is it that there is no application?â€ and so on.

original: shes pas mthong bas zhes bya ba ni skabs 'dir ji skad bstan pa'i don mngon sum du byed pas ni shes pas mthong ba'o //
analyzed: shes pas mthong bas zhes bya ba ni skabs 'dir ji skad bstan pa'i don mngon sum du byed pas ni shes pas mthong ba'o //
translated: â€œSeeing through knowledgeâ€ means that in this context, seeing through knowledge is seeing by directly realizing the meaning as it is taught.ğŸ”½The function of a protector is taught

original: dpung gnyen gyi byed pa bstan pa ni rab 'byor ji ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: dpung gnyen gyi byed pa bstan pa ni rab 'byor ji ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: by â€œSubhÅ«ti, how is it that there is no application?â€ and so on.ğŸ”½â€œSubhÅ«ti, the other side of form is not formâ€ means

original: rab 'byor gzugs kyi pha rol gang yin pa de gzugs ma yin zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzugs kyi pha rol gang yin pa de gzugs ma yin zhes bya ba ni /
translated: that the other side of form is the emptiness of form.

original: rab kyi mthar thug par 'gro ba'i don gyis na gzugs kyi pha rol skye ba med cing dngos po med pa gang yin pa de ni kun rdzob tu gzugs su gyur pa ma yin @218b no ;
analyzed: rab kyi mthar thug par 'gro ba'i don gyis na gzugs kyi pha rol skye ba med cing dngos po med pa gang yin pa de ni kun rdzob tu gzugs su gyur pa ma yin @218b no ;
translated: The form that is the other shore, which is unborn and not a thing, is not form in the conventional sense.

original: / don dam par ni pha rol te stong pa nyid ji lta bar gzugs kyang de bzhin te gang gi phyir /
analyzed: / don dam par ni pha rol te stong pa nyid ji lta bar gzugs kyang de bzhin te gang gi phyir /
translated: In the ultimate sense, the other shore is emptiness, and form is just like that.

original: chos kyi dbyings las ma gtogs pa'i 'di ltar chos yod pa ma yin pas zhes bya bas /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings las ma gtogs pa'i 'di ltar chos yod pa ma yin pas zhes bya bas /
translated: Because apart from the dharma-realm, there are no dharmas like this.ğŸ”½Thus, SubhÅ«ti, the other shore is just like form.

original: rab 'byor pha rol ji ltar gzugs kyang de bzhin te zhes bya ba gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor pha rol ji ltar gzugs kyang de bzhin te zhes bya ba gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This is what is said.ğŸ”½Is it not that you have fully awakened to the unsurpassed perfect enlightenment?

original: mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa ma lags sam zhes bya ba ni da ltar yang stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid yin pas sangs rgyas pa nyid kyi gnas skabs dang 'dra bar chos thams cad rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa ma lags sam zhes bya ba ni da ltar yang stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid yin pas sangs rgyas pa nyid kyi gnas skabs dang 'dra bar chos thams cad rtogs pa yin no //
translated: Because even now, all dharmas are realized to be just like the state of enlightenment, since they have the nature of emptiness.

original: de bas na mdo 'di la mngon par brtson pa ni don med do snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na mdo 'di la mngon par brtson pa ni don med do snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is thought that striving in this sÅ«tra is meaningless.

original: 'khrul pa'i bdag nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa yod bzhin du ji ltar mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa yin snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas //
analyzed: 'khrul pa'i bdag nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa yod bzhin du ji ltar mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa yin snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas //
translated: How can there be perfect enlightenment while there are still conceptual thoughts with the nature of error?

original: bcom ldan 'das 'di la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'di la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol te /
translated: The Lord has said, â€œHere, SubhÅ«ti, the perfection of wisdom of the bodhisattva, the great being, is the mother, and skill in means is the father.â€

original: rnam par rtog pa yang skye ba med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa'i pha rol na rnam par rtog pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa yang skye ba med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa'i pha rol na rnam par rtog pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Because conceptual thoughts also have the nature of non-arising, it is not the case that conceptual thoughts exist apart from form, etc. This is the meaning.

original: chos thams cad mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa yin te zhes bya ba ni de kho na nyid du zhes bya ba ni tshig lhag ma'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa yin te zhes bya ba ni de kho na nyid du zhes bya ba ni tshig lhag ma'o //
translated: All phenomena are perfectly enlightened. The word â€œtrulyâ€ is an ellipsis.

original: yang kun rdzob tu ni thog ma med pa'i dus can gyi sgro btags pa sel ba yin pa'i phyir mdo sde 'di la mngon par brtson pa 'bras bu dang bcas pa yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: yang kun rdzob tu ni thog ma med pa'i dus can gyi sgro btags pa sel ba yin pa'i phyir mdo sde 'di la mngon par brtson pa 'bras bu dang bcas pa yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: Moreover, conventionally, since the superimposition of beginningless time is eliminated, it is intended that striving in this sÅ«tra is fruitful.

original: kun rdzob tu rtogs pa yod pa nyid du bstan par bya ba'i phyir gang de ltar chos thams cad la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu rtogs pa yod pa nyid du bstan par bya ba'i phyir gang de ltar chos thams cad la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: In order to teach that the realization of the conventional does exist, he says, â€œOne who thus knows all phenomena,â€ and so on.

original: thabs mang pos lan mang du bsgom pa la nges par sems shing mngon du yang mi byed pa 'di ni mchog tu dka' ba byed pa yin te mod la bya bar nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: thabs mang pos lan mang du bsgom pa la nges par sems shing mngon du yang mi byed pa 'di ni mchog tu dka' ba byed pa yin te mod la bya bar nus pa ma yin no //
translated: This is the supreme difficult practice, which is not to be accomplished quickly, since it is the definite thought of meditation on many occasions with many methods.

original: zhum par mi 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pa la yang le los mi sgrub par mi byed do //
analyzed: zhum par mi 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pa la yang le los mi sgrub par mi byed do //
translated: One does not become discouraged means that one does not fail to practice out of laziness even in the completion of the perfections such as generosity.

original: chos 'di dag ces bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba nyid la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid rnams so //
analyzed: chos 'di dag ces bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba nyid la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid rnams so //
translated: These phenomena means the characteristics of natural complete nirvana and so on.

original: dpung gnyen du 'gyur zhes bya ba ni chos bstan pas 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa mnyam pa nyid du nye bar sgrub pa'i don gyis skyob pa por 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: dpung gnyen du 'gyur zhes bya ba ni chos bstan pas 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa mnyam pa nyid du nye bar sgrub pa'i don gyis skyob pa por 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The phrase becomes a refuge means that by teaching the Dharma, one becomes a protector through the process of establishing the equality of cyclic existence and nirvana.

original: gling du 'gyur ba'i byed pa bstan pa ni rab 'byor ji ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /ğŸ”½chus yongs su bskor ba zhes bya ba ni chu'i dbus na gnas @219a * //
analyzed: gling du 'gyur ba'i byed pa bstan pa ni rab 'byor ji ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te / chus yongs su bskor ba zhes bya ba ni chu'i dbus na gnas @219a * //
translated: The explanation of the function of being an island is stated from the beginning of the passage that goes, Subhuti, how do great bodhisattvas become an island unto beings?

original: pa'i skam sa'i cha'o //ğŸ”½sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha' yongs su chad pa'o zhes bya ba la sngon gyi mtha' ni rgyu'o //
analyzed: pa'i skam sa'i cha'o // sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha' yongs su chad pa'o zhes bya ba la sngon gyi mtha' ni rgyu'o //
translated: The phrase completely surrounded by water refers to the dry land that is situated in the middle of the water.

original: phyi ma'i mtha' ni 'bras bu ste de gnyis kyis yongs su bcad par dbus na gnas pa sgyu ma lta bu'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: phyi ma'i mtha' ni 'bras bu ste de gnyis kyis yongs su bcad par dbus na gnas pa sgyu ma lta bu'i ngo bo'o //
translated: The phrase cut off from the past and the future means that the past is the cause and the future is the effect, and that the middle, which is cut off from these two, is illusion-like in nature.

original: rab 'byor yongs su chad pa 'dis zhes bya ba ni de kho na nyid du skye ba med pas so //
analyzed: rab 'byor yongs su chad pa 'dis zhes bya ba ni de kho na nyid du skye ba med pas so //
translated: The phrase Subhuti, through this cutting off means that there is no arising in reality.

original: 'di ni zhi ba'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshig lngas ni sbyor ba dang / mthong ba dang / bsgom pa dang / mi slob pa dang / khyad par gyi lam rnams la go rims bzhin du lam gyi bden pa yin par bshad do //ğŸ”½'jig rten gyi gling du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni chus yongs su bcad pa'i skam sa dang chos mthun par sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha' yongs su chad par chos thams cad rtogs pas sred pa zad pa 'dod chags dang bral ba dang /
analyzed: 'di ni zhi ba'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshig lngas ni sbyor ba dang / mthong ba dang / bsgom pa dang / mi slob pa dang / khyad par gyi lam rnams la go rims bzhin du lam gyi bden pa yin par bshad do // 'jig rten gyi gling du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni chus yongs su bcad pa'i skam sa dang chos mthun par sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha' yongs su chad par chos thams cad rtogs pas sred pa zad pa 'dod chags dang bral ba dang /
translated: The five phrases beginning with â€œthis is peaceâ€ explain the truth of the path, respectively, as the path of application, the path of seeing, the path of cultivation, the path of no learning, and the special path.

original: 'gog pa mya ngan las 'das pa ston par byed pa nyid kyis na /
analyzed: 'gog pa mya ngan las 'das pa ston par byed pa nyid kyis na /
translated: â€œIt becomes an island in the worldâ€ means that, through the realization of all things as limited by the prior limit and the later limit, like dry land limited by water, one demonstrates the extinction of craving, freedom from attachment, and cessation, nirvana.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa la sogs pa rnam par snang ba yin la des yongs su khebs pa ste phyi rol kun nas mi shes pa dang ldan pa sems can mun pas zil gyis non cing /

analyzed: yongs su 'dren pa'i byed pa ston pa ni rab 'byor ji ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /

analyzed: de la thams cad shes pa nyid kyi skabs kyi chos ston par mdzad pa nyid kyis lhun gyis grub par 'jug pas sems can gyi don byed pa'i phyir na rten du gyur pa yin pa'i phyir lhun gyis grub pa'i byed pa re zhig bstan par bya ba'i phyir
translated: Therefore, in order to teach the activity of spontaneity,

analyzed: / rab 'byor 'di la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te / nam mkha'i rten can no zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: de la rjes su med ba tsam ni nam mkha' ste / 'das pa'i dus nas ma 'ongs pas na 'ong ba med pa'o //

analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i dus su 'gro ba dang bral bas na 'gro ba med pa'o //

analyzed: byed pa'i rgyu med pas na ma byas pa'o //

analyzed: 'jig pa'i rgyu dang bral bas na rnam par mi 'gyur ba'o //

analyzed: yang dag par mi gnas pa rnam par mi 'gyur pa zhes bya ba yin no //

analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas // rab @220a * //
translated: The doubts are anticipated by â€œWhy is that?â€

analyzed: 'byor chos thams cad ni stong pa nyid kyi rten can te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: and the response is given in â€œSubhÅ«ti, all phenomena are based on emptiness, etc.â€

original: chos thams cad skye ba med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas na stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: chos thams cad skye ba med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas na stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: Since all phenomena are by nature unarisen, they are the nature of emptiness, etc.

analyzed: de la sgyu ma lta bu yin pa'i phyir stong pa nyid do //

analyzed: don du gnyer ba'i yul las 'das pa'i phyir smon pa med pa'o //

analyzed: rten de las mi 'da' ba'o zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin de mi 'dor ba'o //
translated: The meaning of â€œnot transcending that supportâ€ is not abandoning that nature.

original: de lta bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas 'jig rten gyi rten can du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'chad bzhin pa'i 'gres kyi tha mar 'brel bar

translated: Therefore, a bodhisattva mahÄsattva, having fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete enlightenment, becomes a support for the world.

analyzed: bya'o // thams cad shes pa nyid kyi skabs kyi phan pa la sogs pa nas lhun gyis grub par 'jug pa'i mthar thug pa'i byed pa thams cad ni mya ngan las 'da' pa yongs su ston pa'i don shes par bya'o //
translated: All the activities from the benefit in the context of the knowledge of all aspects up to spontaneous engagement should be understood as the meaning of demonstrating nirvana.

original: lam shes pa nyid kyi rnam pa'i chos ston par mdzad pa nyid kyis na theg pa ji lta ba bzhin du nges par 'byung ba de mngon du mi byed pas nye bar bsgrub pa'i phyir rten du 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: lam shes pa nyid kyi rnam pa'i chos ston par mdzad pa nyid kyis na theg pa ji lta ba bzhin du nges par 'byung ba de mngon du mi byed pas nye bar bsgrub pa'i phyir rten du 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: By teaching the aspects of the knowledge of the path, it becomes the basis for the definite emergence according to the vehicles, because it does not actualize that definite emergence.

analyzed: theg pa gsum gyi nges par 'byung ba de'i 'bras bu mngon sum du mi byed pa bstan pa ni /
translated: The teaching on not actualizing the result of that definite emergence of the three vehicles is:

analyzed: rab 'byor chos thams cad ni 'byung ba med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: Subhuti, all phenomena are non-arising, and so forth.

analyzed: de la kun brtags pa'i sdug bsngal dang bral bas 'byung ba med pa'i rten can no //

analyzed: rnam par brtags pa'i sdug bsngal dang bral bas skye ba med pa'i rten can no //

analyzed: chos nyid kyi sdug bsngal dang bral bas dngos po med pa'i rten can no //

translated: It is based on a dream, because it exists as a mere appearance, like a dream, due to the non-existence of the imagined origin.

translated: It is based on self, because it is like selflessness, due to the non-existence of the discriminated origin.

analyzed: chos nyid kyi 'byung ba ni sgyu ma lta bu nyid kyis na yongs su chad pa ma yin pa'i phyir mu med pa'i rten can no //
translated: It is based on infinity, because the origin of reality is not limited by its illusory nature.

original: kun tu brtags pa la sogs pa dngos po rnam pa gsum 'gog pas /
analyzed: kun tu brtags pa la sogs pa dngos po rnam pa gsum 'gog pas /
translated: By stopping the three kinds of things, imagined, etc.,

analyzed: de ltar na ji skad du bshad pa'i byed pa'i mtshan nyid ni rnam pa bcu gcig gi bdag nyid can yin par khong du chud par bya'o //

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: As it has been said:ğŸ”½Beneficial, blissful, a protector, a refuge for humans,

analyzed: phan dang bde dang skyob pa dang // mi rnams kyi ni skyabs dag dang // gnas dang dpung gnyen gling dang ni // yongs 'dren pa zhes bya ba dang // lhun gyis grub dang theg gsum gyi //

translated: Therein, the non-cultivation of all dharmas is through the inclusion of all realizations in the knowledge of all modes by way of their non-production.

analyzed: thams cad shes pa nyid kyi dngos po ma lus par bsdus pas mtha' yas pa nyid bsgom pa'o //

original: rab 'byor de de bzhin no //

original: de de bzhin te zhes bya ba rjes su sngon du 'gro bas /

analyzed: gzhan gyis smras pa dang gzhan gyis bgros pa dag la mngon par chags par mi byed pa zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: gsang ste smras pa ni gzhan gyis bgros pa ste /

translated: Similarly, why is that? In the inquiry, SubhÅ«ti, it is like this, etc.

original: rgyu med pas gang las kyang ma yin /
analyzed: rgyu med pas gang las kyang ma yin /
translated: Since it is not a cause, it is not from anything.

original: 'brel pa med pas gang gi yang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'brel pa med pas gang gi yang ma yin no //
translated: Since it is not related, it is not anyoneâ€™s.

original: 'brel pa yod pa la sogs pa ni dngos po nyid du 'gyur bas de bzhin nyid du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'brel pa yod pa la sogs pa ni dngos po nyid du 'gyur bas de bzhin nyid du mi 'gyur te /

original: de bas na gang gi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de bas na gang gi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it says â€œfor that reasonâ€ and so on.

original: de ltar na gnas brtan rab 'byor ni zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de ltar na gnas brtan rab 'byor ni zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Thus, the elder SubhÅ«ti is said to be

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid kyis bsdus pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /

analyzed: de bas na ma byas pa'i de bzhin nyid kyi rjes su mthun par skyes so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //

analyzed: chos thams cad de lta bu'i tshul du rjes su skyes pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /

original: rab 'byor la khyad par du 'phags pa ci zhig yod ce na //
analyzed: rab 'byor la khyad par du 'phags pa ci zhig yod ce na //
translated: what is the special excellence of SubhÅ«ti?

original: de ni bden mod kyi 'on kyang kho na rtsod pa'i gzhir gyur pa de kho na bstan par bya ba yin gyi /
analyzed: de ni bden mod kyi 'on kyang kho na rtsod pa'i gzhir gyur pa de kho na bstan par bya ba yin gyi /

original: gzhan du na nyan pa po 'byang ba med pa smra ba na ji ltar smyon par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: gzhan du na nyan pa po 'byang ba med pa smra ba na ji ltar smyon par mi 'gyur /

original: 'di nyid kho na gsal bar byed pa ni ma byas pa'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di nyid kho na gsal bar byed pa ni ma byas pa'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: This very point is clarified by the statement beginning with â€œThe suchness that is not made. . . .â€

original: de ni nam yang de bzhin nyid ma yin par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rnam pa thams cad du de bzhin nyid kho na yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig @226b go ;
analyzed: de ni nam yang de bzhin nyid ma yin par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rnam pa thams cad du de bzhin nyid kho na yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig @226b go ;
translated: It is never not suchness means that it is suchness in every way.

original: / nye bar bsdu ba ni ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid thams cad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: / nye bar bsdu ba ni ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid thams cad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The summary is stated in the passage beginning with â€œjust as the thusness of the TathÄgata is everywhereâ€ and so on.

original: thams cad du zhes bya ba ni dus thams cad du'o //
analyzed: thams cad du zhes bya ba ni dus thams cad du'o //
translated: â€œEverywhereâ€ means at all times.

original: mngon par sprul pa ste zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mngon par sprul pa ste zhes bya ba ni /
translated: â€œEmanationâ€ means

original: rab tu phye ba ste skyed pa'o //ğŸ”½brjod ma thag pa gnyis po 'di ni rab tu bskal pa ma yin zhing zhes bya ba la bskal pa ni ma rtogs pa ste ma mthong ba'o //
analyzed: rab tu phye ba ste skyed pa'o // brjod ma thag pa gnyis po 'di ni rab tu bskal pa ma yin zhing zhes bya ba la bskal pa ni ma rtogs pa ste ma mthong ba'o //
translated: â€œmanifestation,â€ that is, production.ğŸ”½The two just mentioned are â€œnot at all separateâ€ and â€œnot at all different.â€ğŸ”½â€œNot at all separateâ€ means not at all unperceived, not at all unseen.

original: bskal pa ma yin pa'i rtogs pa ste mthong ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bskal pa ma yin pa'i rtogs pa ste mthong ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: â€œNot at all differentâ€ means not at all perceived, not at all seen.

original: tha dad par byed pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: tha dad par byed pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: â€œBecause there is no perception of a differenceâ€ means

original: rang bzhin gcig tu tshad mas 'thad pas na de bzhin nyid la tha dad par byed pa'i tshad mi dmigs pas tha mi dad pa dang / rab tu bskal pa ma yin pa yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin gcig tu tshad mas 'thad pas na de bzhin nyid la tha dad par byed pa'i tshad mi dmigs pas tha mi dad pa dang / rab tu bskal pa ma yin pa yin no //
translated: that because of the validity of the one nature by means of a valid cognition, there is no perception of a valid cognition that makes a difference in thusness. Therefore, there is no difference and no separation.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid ni chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid kyi bdag nyid can yin la /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid ni chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid kyi bdag nyid can yin la /
translated: The thusness of the tathÄgatas is the nature of the thusness of all phenomena.

original: rab 'byor gyi de bzhin nyid ni de lta bu yang ma yin na /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyi de bzhin nyid ni de lta bu yang ma yin na /
translated: The thusness of SubhÅ«ti is not like that.ğŸ”½How are those two thusnesses not different?

original: de bzhin nyid gnyis po de ji ltar tha mi dad pa yin zhe na ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid gnyis po de ji ltar tha mi dad pa yin zhe na ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: It is said, â€œJust as the thusness of the tathÄgatasâ€¦â€ and so on.

original: gzhan ma yin la zhes bya ba ni tshig gi phrad de /
analyzed: gzhan ma yin la zhes bya ba ni tshig gi phrad de /
translated: â€œNot differentâ€ is a verbal prefix.

original: byed pa'i tshig dang po la 'jug go //
analyzed: byed pa'i tshig dang po la 'jug go //
translated: It is applied to the first verbal action.

original: de ni 'di skad du ji ltar chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid las de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid gzhan ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du ji ltar chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid las de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid gzhan ma yin te /
translated: This is saying, â€œJust as the thusness of the tathÄgatas is not different from the thusness of all phenomena,

original: 'o na ci yin zhe na de'i bdag nyid can yin pa de bzhin du rab 'byor gyi de bzhin nyid kyang de'i bdag nyid can yin no zhes brjod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o na ci yin zhe na de'i bdag nyid can yin pa de bzhin du rab 'byor gyi de bzhin nyid kyang de'i bdag nyid can yin no zhes brjod par 'gyur ro //
translated: then what is it? It is their nature. In the same way, the thusness of SubhÅ«ti is also their nature.â€

original: 'di ni gang gi yang de bzhin nyid ma yin par ma gyur te zhes bya ba ni don thams cad de bzhin nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni gang gi yang de bzhin nyid ma yin par ma gyur te zhes bya ba ni don thams cad de bzhin nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: This means that all objects are suchness.

original: rab 'byor gyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de nyid chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid yin no zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: rab 'byor gyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de nyid chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid yin no zhes sbyar ro //
translated: The suchness of SubhÅ«ti is the suchness of all phenomena.

original: gzhan ma yin pa'i de bzhin nyid kyi rjes su song zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzhan ma yin pa'i de bzhin nyid kyi rjes su song zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is said to be â€œconsistent with non-different suchnessâ€

original: bdag nyid kyi rang bzhin gyi de bzhin nyid dang rjes su mthun pas de bzhin nyid de chos thams cad la rjes su sbyor bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi rang bzhin gyi de bzhin nyid dang rjes su mthun pas de bzhin nyid de chos thams cad la rjes su sbyor bar gyur pa'o //
translated: because it is in accordance with the suchness that is the nature of itself, and suchness is applied to all phenomena.

original: de bzhin nyid kyi rang bzhin nyid yin na /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyi rang bzhin nyid yin na /
translated: If it is the nature of suchness,

original: ji ltar rjes su song ba zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar rjes su song ba zhes bya zhe na /
translated: how is it said to be consistent?

original: 'dir 'ga' zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'dir 'ga' zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Here it is said, â€œIf someoneâ€¦â€ and so on.

original: kun rdzob tu de ltar tha snyad du byas pa yin gyi /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu de ltar tha snyad du byas pa yin gyi /
translated: This is a conventional expression in terms of the conventional.

original: don dam par ni sgyu ma lta bu nyid yin pas 'di las dngos po gang yang gang du yang rjes @227a * //
analyzed: don dam par ni sgyu ma lta bu nyid yin pas 'di las dngos po gang yang gang du yang rjes @227a * //
translated: But ultimately, since they are like illusions, no thing is in any way produced from any other thing.

original: su 'gro bas mtshungs par gyur pa med pa'o //
analyzed: su 'gro bas mtshungs par gyur pa med pa'o //
translated: But in the ultimate sense, they are like illusions, and therefore, there is no identity of anything whatsoever in anything whatsoever, because of the absence of any identity in the relative.

original: chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid dus gsum pa yin la /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid dus gsum pa yin la /
translated: The reality of all things is the same in the three times.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba nyid kyis skye ba dang bral ba yin pas de lta bu ma yin na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba nyid kyis skye ba dang bral ba yin pas de lta bu ma yin na /
translated: But the reality of the Tathagata is not like that, because it is free from origination, being naturally radiant by nature.

original: de ji ltar na 'di dag gcig pa nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: de ji ltar na 'di dag gcig pa nyid yin zhe na /
translated: How then can they be the same?

original: ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid 'das pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /ğŸ”½de la skye ba sngon du 'gro ba can gyi 'jig pa med pas na 'das pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid 'das pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te / de la skye ba sngon du 'gro ba can gyi 'jig pa med pas na 'das pa ma yin no //
translated: It is said that the reality of the Tathagata is not past, etc.ğŸ”½It is not past because it is not subject to destruction, which is preceded by origination.

original: phyis 'byung ba'i skye ba dang bral bas ma 'ongs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: phyis 'byung ba'i skye ba dang bral bas ma 'ongs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not future because it is free from the origination that occurs later.

original: yod pa nyid thob par mi 'thad pas da ltar byung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: yod pa nyid thob par mi 'thad pas da ltar byung ba ma yin no //
translated: It is not present because it is not tenable that it has come into existence.

original: de bzhin du chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid kyang zhes bya ba ni sgyu ma lta bu nyid rab tu sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma ni thams cad du mtshungs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid kyang zhes bya ba ni sgyu ma lta bu nyid rab tu sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma ni thams cad du mtshungs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
translated: Likewise, the reality of all phenomena is also like that, because the valid cognition that establishes illusion-like-ness is the same in all cases.

original: yang na kun rdzob tu dngos po'i khyad par gyi dbye bas de la dus gsum par brtags pa yin du chug pa /
analyzed: yang na kun rdzob tu dngos po'i khyad par gyi dbye bas de la dus gsum par brtags pa yin du chug pa /
translated: Or else, let us suppose that the distinction of entities in the conventional is imagined to be tritemporal.

original: de lta na yang de bzhin gshegs pa dang / chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid dag tha dad pa ma yin pa nyid ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid kyis kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta na yang de bzhin gshegs pa dang / chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid dag tha dad pa ma yin pa nyid ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid kyis kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Even so, the non-difference of the reality of the TathÄgata and the reality of all phenomena is stated in the passage beginning with â€œThe reality of the TathÄgata is also the reality of all things. â€

original: bdag nyid kyi de bzhin nyid 'ba' zhig tu ma zad de /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi de bzhin nyid 'ba' zhig tu ma zad de /
translated: It is not only the reality of the TathÄgata himself.

original: 'o na ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: But what is it?

original: rab 'byor de ni de bzhin gshegs pa de bzhin nyid kyis kyang gang gi phyir de bzhin nyid kyi rjes su song bar gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ni de bzhin gshegs pa de bzhin nyid kyis kyang gang gi phyir de bzhin nyid kyi rjes su song bar gyur pa yin te /
translated: SubhÅ«ti, it is the reality of the TathÄgata, because it is the reality of all things.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid kyis 'das pa la sogs pa'i de bzhin nyid kyi rjes su song zhing 'das pa la sogs pa'i de bzhin nyid kyis kyang /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid kyis 'das pa la sogs pa'i de bzhin nyid kyi rjes su song zhing 'das pa la sogs pa'i de bzhin nyid kyis kyang /
translated: The suchness of the tathÄgatas accords with the suchness of the past and so on, and the suchness of the past and so on also accords with the suchness of the tathÄgatas.ğŸ”½

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid kyi rjes su song ba yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid kyi rjes su song ba yin te /
translated: The suchness of the tathÄgatas has gone to the suchness of the past, etc., and the suchness of the past, etc., has gone to the suchness of the tathÄgatas.

original: rnam par grol ba la ni tha dad par gyur pa med do zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba la ni tha dad par gyur pa med do zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The intention is that there is no difference in liberation.

original: 'das pa la sogs pa re re dang spyir bsdus pa'i dbye bas 'gres bzhir 'gyur ba yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'das pa la sogs pa re re dang spyir bsdus pa'i dbye bas 'gres bzhir 'gyur ba yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that the four are formed by the categories of each of the past, etc., and their general inclusion.

original: nye bar bsdu ba ni de ltar na gnas brtan rab 'byor gyi de bzhin nyid dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: nye bar bsdu ba ni de ltar na gnas brtan rab 'byor gyi de bzhin nyid dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The summary is stated as â€œThus, the suchness of the elder SubhÅ«ti,â€ and so on.

original: byang chub sems dpa' dang de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas skabs dag ni 'di ltar re zhig tha dad pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas de bzhin nyid dang chos thams cad tha mi dad pa'i ngo bo nyid yin par ga la rung zhes @227b 'ga' zhig rtog pa la
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dang de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas skabs dag ni 'di ltar re zhig tha dad pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas de bzhin nyid dang chos thams cad tha mi dad pa'i ngo bo nyid yin par ga la rung zhes @227b 'ga' zhig rtog pa la
translated: Some think that since the states of the bodhisattva and the tathÄgata are different in nature, how could suchness and all phenomena be of the same nature?

original: / bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpar gyur pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: / bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpar gyur pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: To respond to that, the BhagavÄn said, â€œWhen the bodhisattva was a bodhisattvaâ€¦â€

original: de bzhin nyid 'di yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid 'di yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is suchness is not reasonable,

original: rtag tu ngo bo nyid gcig nyid yin pa'i phyir de bzhin nyid 'di yin par rigs pa yin te gang gis glo bur ba'i dri ma dang bral bas mngon par byang chub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag tu ngo bo nyid gcig nyid yin pa'i phyir de bzhin nyid 'di yin par rigs pa yin te gang gis glo bur ba'i dri ma dang bral bas mngon par byang chub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is always of one nature. This is suchness is reasonable because it is fully enlightened by being free from adventitious contaminants.

original: gang dag gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin ma yin pa de dag ni don dam pa'i rang bzhin du yod pa ma yin te sgyu ma la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid lta bu'o //
analyzed: gang dag gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin ma yin pa de dag ni don dam pa'i rang bzhin du yod pa ma yin te sgyu ma la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid lta bu'o //
translated: Those that are not of the nature of one or many do not exist in ultimate reality, like the nature of an illusion and so on.

original: bdag dang gzhan gyis smras pa'i dngos po rnams kyang gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin ma yin pas zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i sgyu ma dang mtshungs so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyis smras pa'i dngos po rnams kyang gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin ma yin pas zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i sgyu ma dang mtshungs so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: And because things spoken of by ourselves and others are not of the nature of one or many, the pervasion is stated.

original: gtan tshigs 'di ma grub pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs 'di ma grub pa yang ma yin te /
translated: This reason is not unestablished,

original: gang gi phyir rtog pa dang ldan pa rnams kyi 'jug pa ni dgos pa dang ldan pas khyab pa yin pa'i phyir don dam par nus pa'i dngos po'i yul rnam par dpyad par bya'i /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rtog pa dang ldan pa rnams kyi 'jug pa ni dgos pa dang ldan pas khyab pa yin pa'i phyir don dam par nus pa'i dngos po'i yul rnam par dpyad par bya'i /
translated: because the activity of the intelligent is pervaded by the presence of a purpose. Therefore, the object of a thing that is capable in the ultimate sense should be analyzed.

original: gzhan du na skyes bu don gyi byed pa don du gnyer ba dag don med pa'i dngos po la rnam par dpyad pa la dgos ba ci yang med pas don gyi bya ba byed pa'i dngos po khas blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan du na skyes bu don gyi byed pa don du gnyer ba dag don med pa'i dngos po la rnam par dpyad pa la dgos ba ci yang med pas don gyi bya ba byed pa'i dngos po khas blang bar bya'o //
translated: Otherwise, there would be no purpose at all in the analysis of a thing that is meaningless for a person who is engaged in the activity of a purpose. Therefore, a thing that is capable of the activity of a purpose should be accepted.

original: de yang phan tshun du rnam par gcod pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas shes bya'i ngo bo nyid dam shes pa'i ngo bo nyid du 'gyur grang zhes brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang phan tshun du rnam par gcod pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas shes bya'i ngo bo nyid dam shes pa'i ngo bo nyid du 'gyur grang zhes brtag par bya'o //
translated: Moreover, since they are essentially mutually exclusive, it should be analyzed whether they are the nature of objects of knowledge or the nature of consciousness.

original: de la gal te phyogs dang po ltar na de'i tshe rdul phra rab rnams phan tshun 'byar ba'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ba 'am /
analyzed: de la gal te phyogs dang po ltar na de'i tshe rdul phra rab rnams phan tshun 'byar ba'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ba 'am /
translated: If it is the first case, then in that case, the subtle particles would have the nature of mutual contact.

original: rigs mthun pa mang po rnams kyi nus pas rnam par 'dzin cing ma 'byar ba'i tshul gyis bskor te bar mtshams yod pa'am /
analyzed: rigs mthun pa mang po rnams kyi nus pas rnam par 'dzin cing ma 'byar ba'i tshul gyis bskor te bar mtshams yod pa'am /
translated: Or, by the power of many of the same type, they would be surrounded in a way that does not contact each other, with an interval between them,ğŸ”½or they would be surrounded without an interval between them.

original: yang na bar mtshams med par bskor ba zhes bya ba ste phyogs gsum mo //
analyzed: yang na bar mtshams med par bskor ba zhes bya ba ste phyogs gsum mo //
translated: There are three possibilities.

original: de la phyogs dang po ltar na gal te gcig dang gzhan lhan cig phyogs gcig gis 'byar ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: de la phyogs dang po ltar na gal te gcig dang gzhan lhan cig phyogs gcig gis 'byar ba de'i tshe /
translated: If it is the first possibility, if one and another are mutually contacted by one part, then

original: cha shas dang bcas pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur bas gcig pa nyid las nyams par 'gyur te /
analyzed: cha shas dang bcas pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur bas gcig pa nyid las nyams par 'gyur te /
translated: since it follows they would have parts, they would lose their oneness.

original: rdul phra rab kyi rang bzhin gzhan dang gzhan gyis gzhan dag dang 'byar ba yin pa'i phyir ro //ğŸ”½bdag nyid thams cad kyis 'byar ba'i phyogs ltar na yang gang gi tshe shar phyogs kyi rdul phra rab rdul phra rab gzhan dang lhan cig bdag nyid thams cad kyis 'dres pa de'i tshe gzhan yang shar @228a * //
analyzed: rdul phra rab kyi rang bzhin gzhan dang gzhan gyis gzhan dag dang 'byar ba yin pa'i phyir ro // bdag nyid thams cad kyis 'byar ba'i phyogs ltar na yang gang gi tshe shar phyogs kyi rdul phra rab rdul phra rab gzhan dang lhan cig bdag nyid thams cad kyis 'dres pa de'i tshe gzhan yang shar @228a * //
translated: because they are joined to each other by other particles.

original: dang 'dres pa zhes bya ba der 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dang 'dres pa zhes bya ba der 'gyur ro //
translated: Even if they were joined by their entire extent, when the eastern particle is joined to another particle by its entire extent, then the other particle would be joined to it in the east.ğŸ”½And so on.

original: de bas na 'dres pa ni dngos po gnyi ga la rag las pa nyid kyis na /
analyzed: de bas na 'dres pa ni dngos po gnyi ga la rag las pa nyid kyis na /
translated: Thus, since joining depends on both things,

original: gcig la gcig gi ngo bor rjes su zhugs pa yin pas rdul phra rab gang yang rang bzhin gcig pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: gcig la gcig gi ngo bor rjes su zhugs pa yin pas rdul phra rab gang yang rang bzhin gcig pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: since they are mutually included in each otherâ€™s nature, no particle has a single nature.

original: 'di ltar shar gyi rdul phra rab nub kyi dang bdag nyid thams cad kyis 'dres pa'i phyir rang bzhin yongs su spangs te rnam pa thams cad du nub kyi ngo bo thob pas na 'dres bzhin pa de med pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar shar gyi rdul phra rab nub kyi dang bdag nyid thams cad kyis 'dres pa'i phyir rang bzhin yongs su spangs te rnam pa thams cad du nub kyi ngo bo thob pas na 'dres bzhin pa de med pa yin no //
translated: Thus, because the eastern particle mixes with the western particle in every way, it loses its nature and becomes the entity of the western particle in every way. Therefore, the mixing of the two does not exist.

original: de bzhin du nub kyi yang shar dang 'dres pas rang gi ngo bo spangs te rnam pa thams cad du shar gyi dngos por gyur pas de'i 'dres pa'i rten du gyur pa med pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du nub kyi yang shar dang 'dres pas rang gi ngo bo spangs te rnam pa thams cad du shar gyi dngos por gyur pas de'i 'dres pa'i rten du gyur pa med pa'o //
translated: Similarly, because the western particle mixes with the eastern particle, it loses its own nature and becomes the entity of the eastern particle in every way. Therefore, the basis of the mixing of the two does not exist.

original: de bas na gcig la dus gcig tu phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid kyi bsgrub pa dang dgag pa mi rung bas ji ltar ngo bo nyid gcig pa yin /
analyzed: de bas na gcig la dus gcig tu phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid kyi bsgrub pa dang dgag pa mi rung bas ji ltar ngo bo nyid gcig pa yin /
translated: Therefore, because it is impossible for one thing to be both affirmed and negated in every way, mutually exclusive, at the same time, how could they have the same nature?

original: gnyis pa yongs su bskor ba'i phyogs ltar na yang gal te rigs mthun pa rnams dang reg bar mi 'dod du chug kyang bu ga ni snang ba dang mun pa'i ngo bo yin pas rigs mi mthun pa'i snang ba dang mun pa'i rdul phra rab rnams dang niğŸ”½reg par 'dod pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: gnyis pa yongs su bskor ba'i phyogs ltar na yang gal te rigs mthun pa rnams dang reg bar mi 'dod du chug kyang bu ga ni snang ba dang mun pa'i ngo bo yin pas rigs mi mthun pa'i snang ba dang mun pa'i rdul phra rab rnams dang ni reg par 'dod pa nyid yin te /
translated: But if you assert that they contact particles of dissimilar type,

original: snang bas gnon pa'i mun pa dang bral ba nyid dam /ğŸ”½mun pas gnas su ma byas pa'i snang ba dang bral ba nyid ni rigs dang ldan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: snang bas gnon pa'i mun pa dang bral ba nyid dam / mun pas gnas su ma byas pa'i snang ba dang bral ba nyid ni rigs dang ldan pa ma yin te /
translated: then darkness would not be free from light that suppresses it,

original: de gnyis 'byung ba ni yul la sogs pa phan tshun bral ba tsam la rag las pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de gnyis 'byung ba ni yul la sogs pa phan tshun bral ba tsam la rag las pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: or light would not be free from darkness that occupies its place, because the occurrence of those two depends on the mere separation of objects and so on.

original: de lta na yang 'das ma thag pa'i bshad pa'i nyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na yang 'das ma thag pa'i bshad pa'i nyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: But in that case the previously explained faults would ensue.

original: 'on te rigs mi mthun pa rnams kyang rig par khas mi len na de'i tshe dbus na gnas pa'i rdul phra rab gang yin pa de rang bzhin gang gis rdul phra rab gcig la bltas te gnas pa de nyid kyis rdul phra rab gzhan la bltas sam /
analyzed: 'on te rigs mi mthun pa rnams kyang rig par khas mi len na de'i tshe dbus na gnas pa'i rdul phra rab gang yin pa de rang bzhin gang gis rdul phra rab gcig la bltas te gnas pa de nyid kyis rdul phra rab gzhan la bltas sam /
translated: But if you do not accept that heterogeneous particles are cognized, then in that case, whatever is the central particle, by virtue of its own nature, looking at one particle, does it look at another particle by virtue of that same nature?

original: 'on te gzhan gyis yin zhes rnam pa gnyis su brtag go //
analyzed: 'on te gzhan gyis yin zhes rnam pa gnyis su brtag go //
translated: Or does it look by virtue of another nature?

original: de la gal te phyogs dang po ltar na de'i tshe gang zhig rdul phra rab gcig gi ngo bo la bltas pa de ni phyogs gcig pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: de la gal te phyogs dang po ltar na de'i tshe gang zhig rdul phra rab gcig gi ngo bo la bltas pa de ni phyogs gcig pa nyid yin te /
translated: In that regard, if it is the first case, then whatever looks at the nature of one particle, it is just one part.

original: 'di ltar rdul phra rab de nyid kyi shar phyogs na gnas pa'i rdul phra rab lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar rdul phra rab de nyid kyi shar phyogs na gnas pa'i rdul phra rab lta bu'o //
translated: It is like that very particle, for example, that is situated in the eastern direction of that particle.

original: yongs su bskor ba'i rdul phra rab thams cad kyang rdul phra rab gcig la bltas pa'i rang bzhin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: yongs su bskor ba'i rdul phra rab thams cad kyang rdul phra rab gcig la bltas pa'i rang bzhin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: And all the surrounding particles have the nature of looking at one particle. This is a natural inference.

original: rang bzhin de nyid kyis bltas par khas @228b blangs pas grub pa nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin de nyid kyis bltas par khas @228b blangs pas grub pa nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not established by the mere fact that you accept that it is seen by that very nature.

original: mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa'i phyir 'gal ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa'i phyir 'gal ba yang ma yin no //
translated: Nor is it contradictory, because it exists in the similar instance.

original: yul tha dad pa na gnas pa yin na ni /
analyzed: yul tha dad pa na gnas pa yin na ni /
translated: If it exists in different places,

original: mngon par 'dod pa'i rdul phra rab gcig pu la bltas pa'i rang bzhin du mi 'gyur te rdul phra rab la rang bzhin gzhan dag med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: mngon par 'dod pa'i rdul phra rab gcig pu la bltas pa'i rang bzhin du mi 'gyur te rdul phra rab la rang bzhin gzhan dag med pa'i phyir te /
translated: then it would not have the nature of seeing a single, desired atom, because other natures do not exist in atoms.

original: rang bzhin med na bltas pa yang mi rung ba'i phyir gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin med na bltas pa yang mi rung ba'i phyir gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: If it has no nature, then it is not suitable to see it. Therefore the reason is not indeterminate.

original: de'i phyir skor bar byed pa'i rdul phra rab rnams phyogs gcig pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir bskor nas gnas pa med pas de kho nar bsags pa med pas na des bsgrub par bya ba'i don gyi bya ba nyid dang bral ba nyid kyis na rdul
analyzed: de'i phyir skor bar byed pa'i rdul phra rab rnams phyogs gcig pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir bskor nas gnas pa med pas de kho nar bsags pa med pas na des bsgrub par bya ba'i don gyi bya ba nyid dang bral ba nyid kyis na rdul
translated: Therefore, since it follows that the surrounding atoms would be in one place, they do not exist in a surrounding manner. Thus, since they do not accumulate, the object to be established is devoid of activity. Therefore the reason is not unestablished.

original: phra rab de dang rang bzhin gcig yin pa par khas len pa yang rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: phra rab de dang rang bzhin gcig yin pa par khas len pa yang rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is also illogical to accept that the partless particle is of the same nature as the object.

original: phyogs gnyis pa ltar na yang rdul phra rab bzhin gzhan dang gzhan gyis gzhan dang gzhan la bltas pas cha shas dang bcas par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir rdul phra rab gcig pa nyid dang bral ba ni shin tu gsal ba kho na yin te /
analyzed: phyogs gnyis pa ltar na yang rdul phra rab bzhin gzhan dang gzhan gyis gzhan dang gzhan la bltas pas cha shas dang bcas par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir rdul phra rab gcig pa nyid dang bral ba ni shin tu gsal ba kho na yin te /
translated: If the second position is accepted, then, like the particles, the object would have to be seen by other and other parts, and it would follow that it would have parts. Thus, the absence of a single, partless particle is quite clear.

original: dngos po tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid ni rang bzhin tha dad pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid ni rang bzhin tha dad pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the defining characteristic of a different thing is a different nature.

original: gsum pa bar mtshams med pa'i phyogs kyang 'byar ba'i phyogs kho na'i khongs su 'dus te de'i rnam grangs nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsum pa bar mtshams med pa'i phyogs kyang 'byar ba'i phyogs kho na'i khongs su 'dus te de'i rnam grangs nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The third position, that of no interstice, is included in the position of contact, because it is a synonym of that.

original: bar mtshams nyid kyi yul dang bral ba rnams la ni phan tshun 'byar ba ma gtogs par rnam pa gzhan yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bar mtshams nyid kyi yul dang bral ba rnams la ni phan tshun 'byar ba ma gtogs par rnam pa gzhan yod pa ma yin no //
translated: For those that are devoid of the interstice, there is no other possibility than that of mutual contact.

original: don de nyid sgra gzhan gyis brjod kyang gzhan du 'gyur pa ma yin te shin tu thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don de nyid sgra gzhan gyis brjod kyang gzhan du 'gyur pa ma yin te shin tu thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Even if that meaning is expressed by other words, it does not become different because that would lead to a great absurdity.

original: 'on te rdul phra rab ma 'byar ba nyid phyogs kyi sgrar brjod pa shin tu nye ba na gnas pa'i rdul phra rab mang po rnams kyis bskor bar 'dod ce na /
analyzed: 'on te rdul phra rab ma 'byar ba nyid phyogs kyi sgrar brjod pa shin tu nye ba na gnas pa'i rdul phra rab mang po rnams kyis bskor bar 'dod ce na /
