translated: If you assert that the term â€œdirectionâ€ refers to unattached subtle particles, many subtle particles that are extremely close to each other,

original: de mi rigs te tshu rol dang pha rol gyi cha dag med par tshig 'di don dang ldan par gnas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de mi rigs te tshu rol dang pha rol gyi cha dag med par tshig 'di don dang ldan par gnas pa ma yin no //
translated: that is illogical because without parts that are near and far, this term does not exist as a meaningful expression.

original: de las gzhan la ltos nas gzhan gyi rang bzhin gang zhig nges par bzung bde ni kho nar de la bden pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: de las gzhan la ltos nas gzhan gyi rang bzhin gang zhig nges par bzung bde ni kho nar de la bden pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: That which is ascertained as the nature of another in dependence on something else is not truly that,ğŸ”½just like the division of near and far.

original: tshu rol dang pha rol la sogs pa'i dbye ba bzhin no zhes bya ba'i rigs pas yang dag pa'i don du cha shas dang bcas pa nyid ma yin no zhen ma yin te tshu rol dang pha rol dag kyang phyi rol gyi don yod par smra pas ltos
analyzed: tshu rol dang pha rol la sogs pa'i dbye ba bzhin no zhes bya ba'i rigs pas yang dag pa'i don du cha shas dang bcas pa nyid ma yin no zhen ma yin te tshu rol dang pha rol dag kyang phyi rol gyi don yod par smra pas ltos
translated: Through this reasoning, it is not truly that in reality, it is not truly that which has parts.

original: pa'i dbye bas pha dang bu la sogs pa dang 'dra bar ma 'chol ba'i phyir yang dag pa kho na'i rang bzhin du khas blang bar bya ste /ğŸ”½gang la ltos @229a * //
analyzed: pa'i dbye bas pha dang bu la sogs pa dang 'dra bar ma 'chol ba'i phyir yang dag pa kho na'i rang bzhin du khas blang bar bya ste / gang la ltos @229a * //
translated: Because of the division of the near and far, the father, son, etc., are not confused.

original: te pha rol yin pa de ni de la ltos nas nam yang tshu rol ma yin te /
analyzed: te pha rol yin pa de ni de la ltos nas nam yang tshu rol ma yin te /
translated: With respect to what is the far side, it is never the near side with respect to that.

original: de lta ma yin na tshu rol dang pha rol dag don dam pa nyid ma yin na tshu rol dang pha rol du mngon par brjod pa'i 'gram na gnas pa dag ji ltar ma 'chol ba nyid du gnas par 'gyur /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na tshu rol dang pha rol dag don dam pa nyid ma yin na tshu rol dang pha rol du mngon par brjod pa'i 'gram na gnas pa dag ji ltar ma 'chol ba nyid du gnas par 'gyur /
translated: If it were otherwise, if the near and far sides were not ultimate, how could the near and far sides be posited without confusion?

original: 'di ltar pha rol du mngon par 'dod pa las gzhan nyid ni tshu rol du brjod par 'dod pa'i tshu rol nyid yin par brjod do //
analyzed: 'di ltar pha rol du mngon par 'dod pa las gzhan nyid ni tshu rol du brjod par 'dod pa'i tshu rol nyid yin par brjod do //
translated: For, the other side, which is asserted to be the far side, is said to be the near side, which is asserted to be the near side.

original: de yang brtags pa nyid yin na ni de dag gcig tu thal la de lta na yang de la brten pa rnams ma 'chol bar gnas par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de yang brtags pa nyid yin na ni de dag gcig tu thal la de lta na yang de la brten pa rnams ma 'chol bar gnas par mi 'gyur te /
translated: And if that is merely imagined, it follows that they are one. And in that case, those that depend on them would not be posited without confusion.

original: rtog pas nye bar bkod pa'i tha dad pa ni don byed pa'i yan lag nyid yin no //
analyzed: rtog pas nye bar bkod pa'i tha dad pa ni don byed pa'i yan lag nyid yin no //
translated: The difference that is posited by thought is the very part that performs a function.ğŸ”½If it is asked, â€œWhy is it not possible to posit a difference from that?â€ it is because the object abides by the power of experience, because the object that is not experienced is extremely hidden, and because the result of ascertainment arises by the power of the immediately preceding condition.

original: ji ste myong ba'i stobs kyis yul gnas ba'i phyir dang nyams su ma myong ba nyid kyi don ni shin tu lkog tu gyur pa yin pa'i phyir dang / mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyi stobs las so sor nges pa'i 'bras bu skye ba'i phyir na de las tha dad par brtag par mi nus pa nyid yin pa'i phyir rang gis rab tu grub pa'i rang bzhin nyid ni gnyis su med pa'i shes pa gcig
analyzed: ji ste myong ba'i stobs kyis yul gnas ba'i phyir dang nyams su ma myong ba nyid kyi don ni shin tu lkog tu gyur pa yin pa'i phyir dang / mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyi stobs las so sor nges pa'i 'bras bu skye ba'i phyir na de las tha dad par brtag par mi nus pa nyid yin pa'i phyir rang gis rab tu grub pa'i rang bzhin nyid ni gnyis su med pa'i shes pa gcig
translated: Since it is not possible to posit a difference from that, the nature that is self-established is a single, nondual consciousness.

original: gi ngo bo don dam par gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang bral ba dang rgyu med pa nyid yin na rtag pa la sogs par thal ba'i phyir dang / rtag pa nyid na yang don byed pa la sogs pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir na rang gi rgyu dang 'brel par skye ba dang skyes ma thag tu 'jig pa yin te /
analyzed: gi ngo bo don dam par gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang bral ba dang rgyu med pa nyid yin na rtag pa la sogs par thal ba'i phyir dang / rtag pa nyid na yang don byed pa la sogs pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir na rang gi rgyu dang 'brel par skye ba dang skyes ma thag tu 'jig pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, it arises in connection with its cause and it ceases immediately after arising.ğŸ”½However, the aspects that arise in the form of the unapprehendable existence of the unimpeded mind arise from the ripening of the latent propensities of the mind that is attached to things.

original: 'on kyang thogs pa med pa'i srid par 'byung ba can dngos po la mngon par zhen pa'i bag chags yongs su smin pa las byung ba'i rnam pa rnams de la snang ba yin no zhes shes pa'i bdag nyid kyi dngos po rnams rnal 'byor spyod pa rnams kyisğŸ”½khas len na /
analyzed: 'on kyang thogs pa med pa'i srid par 'byung ba can dngos po la mngon par zhen pa'i bag chags yongs su smin pa las byung ba'i rnam pa rnams de la snang ba yin no zhes shes pa'i bdag nyid kyi dngos po rnams rnal 'byor spyod pa rnams kyis khas len na /
translated: Yogacaras assert that things are entities that are consciousness.

original: de la yang ci rnam pa rnams yang dag pa nyid yin nam /ğŸ”½'on te gzugs brnyan la sogs pa dang 'dra bar brtags na gcig tu nyams dga' ba yin zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: de la yang ci rnam pa rnams yang dag pa nyid yin nam /ğŸ”½'on te gzugs brnyan la sogs pa dang 'dra bar brtags na gcig tu nyams dga' ba yin zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: Is the aspect real or is it like a reflection and so on?ğŸ”½This is a conception.

original: gal te dang po ltar na de'i tshe yang dag pa'i rnam pa du ma dang de mi 'thad pas rnam pa'i ngo bo dang 'dra bar rnam par shes pa du ma nyid du thal bar 'gyur bas gcig pa nyid ga la yin /
analyzed: gal te dang po ltar na de'i tshe yang dag pa'i rnam pa du ma dang de mi 'thad pas rnam pa'i ngo bo dang 'dra bar rnam par shes pa du ma nyid du thal bar 'gyur bas gcig pa nyid ga la yin /
translated: If it is the first case, then since there are many aspects of the object, and since that is untenable, consciousness would be multiple, like the nature of the aspects. How could it be one?

original: 'on te cig car nyams su myong ba nyid kyis na rnam par shes pa gcig pa nyid du nges pa yin na /
analyzed: 'on te cig car nyams su myong ba nyid kyis na rnam par shes pa gcig pa nyid du nges pa yin na /
translated: But if it is ascertained that consciousness is one because it is experienced as simultaneous,

original: de'i tshe shes pa gcig dang tha mi dad pas rnam par shes pa'i rang gi ngo bo dang 'dra @229b bar rnam pa rnams gcig pa nyid du 'gyur ba ni bzlog par dka' ba'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe shes pa gcig dang tha mi dad pas rnam par shes pa'i rang gi ngo bo dang 'dra @229b bar rnam pa rnams gcig pa nyid du 'gyur ba ni bzlog par dka' ba'o //
translated: then since it is not different from a single consciousness, it is hard to reverse the consequence that the aspects are one, like the nature of consciousness.

original: de lta yin du zad mod ce na de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta yin du zad mod ce na de ni ma yin te /
translated: If that is so, then it is not so.

original: 'di ltar gal te rnam pa gcig g-yo ba la sogs pa'i khyad par du snang ba de'i tshe rnam pa lhag ma rnams kyang rnam pa snga ma dang tha mi dad pa'i lus can gyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir de dang 'dra ba kho nar 'gyur bas
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te rnam pa gcig g-yo ba la sogs pa'i khyad par du snang ba de'i tshe rnam pa lhag ma rnams kyang rnam pa snga ma dang tha mi dad pa'i lus can gyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir de dang 'dra ba kho nar 'gyur bas
translated: Thus, if one aspect appears as a particular such as movement, then the remaining aspects would be just like that aspect because they have the same nature as the former aspect.

original: rnam pa sna tshogs par nyams su myong ba dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam pa sna tshogs par nyams su myong ba dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: This would contradict the experience of the variety of aspects.

original: de bas na rnam pa rnams ni gcig tu nges par sna tshogs pa nyid yin pas na gcig dang du ma phan tshun 'gal ba'i chos gnas pa dang ldan pa'i phyir don dam pa kho nar rnam pa dang rnam par shes pa dag tha dad par gnas pas
analyzed: de bas na rnam pa rnams ni gcig tu nges par sna tshogs pa nyid yin pas na gcig dang du ma phan tshun 'gal ba'i chos gnas pa dang ldan pa'i phyir don dam pa kho nar rnam pa dang rnam par shes pa dag tha dad par gnas pas
translated: Therefore, since the aspects are definitely various, they are mutually exclusive phenomena that are one and many. Therefore, aspects and consciousness definitely exist separately in reality.

original: gnyis med pa'i tshul du dam bcas pa nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnyis med pa'i tshul du dam bcas pa nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the thesis that they are not two is undermined.

original: 'on te bde ba la sogs pa dang 'dra bar sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa rnams nyams su myong ba'i bdag nyid can yin ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'on te bde ba la sogs pa dang 'dra bar sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa rnams nyams su myong ba'i bdag nyid can yin ba'i phyir /
translated: Or, like pleasure and so on, the aspects of blue and so forth are experienced as having the nature of the self.

original: gcig la sna tshogs pa nyid du khas mi len pas ji skad du bshad pa'i nyes par thal bar mi 'gyur ro zhes de ltar shes nas rnam par shes pa ris mthun pa mang po rnams kyang ris mi mthun pa'i shes pa dang 'dra bar lhan cig skyesğŸ”½bar 'gyur ro zhes zer na /
analyzed: gcig la sna tshogs pa nyid du khas mi len pas ji skad du bshad pa'i nyes par thal bar mi 'gyur ro zhes de ltar shes nas rnam par shes pa ris mthun pa mang po rnams kyang ris mi mthun pa'i shes pa dang 'dra bar lhan cig skyes bar 'gyur ro zhes zer na /
translated: Having understood that, they say that many consciousnesses of the same type arise simultaneously, like consciousnesses of different types.

original: de'i tshe 'di nyes pa gzhan yin te 'di ltar dbus mar 'dod pa'i rnam par shes pa gang yin ba de rdul phra rab dang 'dra bar yongs su bskor bar 'dod na de rang bzhin gang gis gcig la mngon par phyogs par gyur ba de nyid kyis ci
analyzed: de'i tshe 'di nyes pa gzhan yin te 'di ltar dbus mar 'dod pa'i rnam par shes pa gang yin ba de rdul phra rab dang 'dra bar yongs su bskor bar 'dod na de rang bzhin gang gis gcig la mngon par phyogs par gyur ba de nyid kyis ci
translated: At that time, there is another fault. If the consciousness that is asserted to be in the middle is surrounded by the others, like subtle particles, then by what nature does it face one particle?

original: gzhan la yang yin nam 'on te gzhan gyis yin zhes brtag go //
analyzed: gzhan la yang yin nam 'on te gzhan gyis yin zhes brtag go //
translated: Does it face the others with that same nature or with another?

original: de nyid kyis zhes ba'i phyogs ltar na yongs su bskor nas gnas pa med pas phyogs gzhan na gnas pa lhag ma rnams don ji lta ba bzhin du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyis zhes ba'i phyogs ltar na yongs su bskor nas gnas pa med pas phyogs gzhan na gnas pa lhag ma rnams don ji lta ba bzhin du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it faces them with that same nature, since it does not remain surrounded, the remaining particles that face other directions would not be as they are in reality.

original: de bas na shar dang nub la sogs pa'i phyogs kyi char yod pa mi 'thad par sngon po la sogs pa'i dbyibs kyi bkod par snang bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na shar dang nub la sogs pa'i phyogs kyi char yod pa mi 'thad par sngon po la sogs pa'i dbyibs kyi bkod par snang bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, since it is untenable that it exists in the eastern or western parts, the shape of blue, etc. would not appear.

original: gzhan gyis zhes bya ba'i phyogs ltar na dngos po'i dbye ba ni rang bzhin gyi dbye ba'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir gcig pa nyid ga la yod ces rdul phra rab rnam par dpyad pa las gyur pa'i nyes pa dang 'dra bar ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyis zhes bya ba'i phyogs ltar na dngos po'i dbye ba ni rang bzhin gyi dbye ba'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir gcig pa nyid ga la yod ces rdul phra rab rnam par dpyad pa las gyur pa'i nyes pa dang 'dra bar ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is the other position, then, since the classification of things is characterized by the classification of their nature, how could they be one?

original: shes pa ni gzugs can ma yin pas phyogs kyis byas pa'i shar dang nub yod pa ma yin /
analyzed: shes pa ni gzugs can ma yin pas phyogs kyis byas pa'i shar dang nub yod pa ma yin /
translated: Consciousness is not physical, so it does not have an east or west that is created by direction.

original: rdul phra rab dang 'dra bar shes pa dbus na gnas par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: rdul phra rab dang 'dra bar shes pa dbus na gnas par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How could consciousness be like a subtle particle that exists in the middle?

original: de ni bden mod kyi 'di ni @230a * //
analyzed: de ni bden mod kyi 'di ni @230a * //
translated: This is true, but this is not the case.

original: de'i nyes pa gzhan yin te gang zhig phyogs rgyas par snang ba'i rnam pa rnams yod pa nyid du 'dod pa yul na gnas par gyur pa ma yin yang de dang 'dra bar yul rgyas par skye bar brtag par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i nyes pa gzhan yin te gang zhig phyogs rgyas par snang ba'i rnam pa rnams yod pa nyid du 'dod pa yul na gnas par gyur pa ma yin yang de dang 'dra bar yul rgyas par skye bar brtag par bya ba yin no //
translated: The fault of that is as follows: If one asserts that the aspects of the extensive side exist, then even though the object does not exist, it is like that, and the extensive object should be considered to arise.

original: de lta ma yin na rnam par shes pa du ma skye bar brtags kyang de ltar yul khyab par skya bar snang ba log pa nyid du 'gyur pas de'i tshe rnam par shes pa du ma skye bar rtog pa don med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na rnam par shes pa du ma skye bar brtags kyang de ltar yul khyab par skya bar snang ba log pa nyid du 'gyur pas de'i tshe rnam par shes pa du ma skye bar rtog pa don med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, even though many consciousnesses are imagined to arise, the appearance of the extensive object would be reversed, and at that time it would be pointless to imagine that many consciousnesses arise.

original: phyogs rgyas par gnas pa'i sngon po la sogs par snang ba las ma gtogs par gang zhig bden par gyur pa sngon po la sogs pa gzhan ni nyams su myong yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: phyogs rgyas par gnas pa'i sngon po la sogs par snang ba las ma gtogs par gang zhig bden par gyur pa sngon po la sogs pa gzhan ni nyams su myong yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Apart from the appearance of extensive blue and so on, there is no other blue and so on that is experienced as real.

original: de brdzun pa nyid yin na bden par 'gyur ba gzhan ci zhig yod de 'di ni gyi na'o //
analyzed: de brdzun pa nyid yin na bden par 'gyur ba gzhan ci zhig yod de 'di ni gyi na'o //
translated: If that is false, what else could be real? This is absurd.

original: de ltar yin na yang rdul phra rab ni gzugs can yin la rnam par shes pa ni gzugs can ma yin pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: de ltar yin na yang rdul phra rab ni gzugs can yin la rnam par shes pa ni gzugs can ma yin pa ma yin nam /
translated: But arenâ€™t atoms physical and consciousness not physical?

original: 'dir nyes pa de nyid yin no zhes bya ba de ji ltar yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'dir nyes pa de nyid yin no zhes bya ba de ji ltar yin zhe na /
translated: How can you say that the error just mentioned does not exist?

original: nyes pa 'di ni med de 'di ltar sngon po la sogs pa'ang med par snang ba de nyid la kha cig ni rdul phra rab kyi bdag nyid du khas len la /
analyzed: nyes pa 'di ni med de 'di ltar sngon po la sogs pa'ang med par snang ba de nyid la kha cig ni rdul phra rab kyi bdag nyid du khas len la /
translated: This error does not exist because some assert that blue and so on, which appear without existing, have the nature of atoms.

original: gzhan ni rigs pa'i ngo bo nyid yin no zhes zer ba ni ming tsam tha dad pa 'ba' zhig tu zad kyi yul 'dab chags par gnas pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi don la ni tha dad pa med do //
analyzed: gzhan ni rigs pa'i ngo bo nyid yin no zhes zer ba ni ming tsam tha dad pa 'ba' zhig tu zad kyi yul 'dab chags par gnas pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi don la ni tha dad pa med do //
translated: Others say that they are the nature of the essence of reasoning. They are only different in name; there is no difference in the object that has the characteristic of abiding in a cluster.

original: ming tsam 'jug pa'i sgor byas pa'i nyes pa mtshungs par sgrub pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: ming tsam 'jug pa'i sgor byas pa'i nyes pa mtshungs par sgrub pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: It is not that the error is established as being the same by making it the door for the engagement of mere names.

original: 'on kyang yul 'dab chags pas byas pa'i nyes pa mtshungs par byed la yang ming tsam tha dad pa yod kyang ji ltar nyes pa mtshungs par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: 'on kyang yul 'dab chags pas byas pa'i nyes pa mtshungs par byed la yang ming tsam tha dad pa yod kyang ji ltar nyes pa mtshungs par mi 'gyur /
translated: But even if there is a difference in name, how could the fault not be the same?

original: 'on te de ltar yin yang shes pa dan shes bya dag kyang tshul mi mthun pa rnams shes byar gtogs pa'i nyes pa shes pa la yod par khas mi len na de'i tshe yang brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: 'on te de ltar yin yang shes pa dan shes bya dag kyang tshul mi mthun pa rnams shes byar gtogs pa'i nyes pa shes pa la yod par khas mi len na de'i tshe yang brjod par bya ste /
translated: But even if that is so, if one does not accept that the faults belonging to the object of knowledge exist in the consciousness, even then one should say the following.

original: shes pa du ma cig car skye ba na bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa'i yul can gyi rnam par rtog par rim gyis skye bar gtogs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes pa du ma cig car skye ba na bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa'i yul can gyi rnam par rtog par rim gyis skye bar gtogs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: When many consciousnesses arise simultaneously, the conceptual consciousnesses that have as their objects a pot, a cloth, and so on would not arise in sequence.

original: de nyams su myong ba nges pa'i sgo nas rnam par rtog pa rnams skye ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyams su myong ba nges pa'i sgo nas rnam par rtog pa rnams skye ba'i phyir /
translated: Because they arise from the experience of certainty.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes pa nyid cig car skye'o zhes de skad du brjod par mi nus so //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes pa nyid cig car skye'o zhes de skad du brjod par mi nus so //
translated: One cannot say that a nonconceptual consciousness arises simultaneously.

original: de bas na rnam par rtog pa 'di dag skye ba na rang nyid rig pa ma yin pa yang ma yin pa'i phyir cig car nyams su myong bar nges par thal ba'i phyir na rnam @230b par rtog pa rim gyis 'byung bar nyams su myong bar mi 'gyur
analyzed: de bas na rnam par rtog pa 'di dag skye ba na rang nyid rig pa ma yin pa yang ma yin pa'i phyir cig car nyams su myong bar nges par thal ba'i phyir na rnam @230b par rtog pa rim gyis 'byung bar nyams su myong bar mi 'gyur
translated: Therefore, when these conceptual thoughts arise, it is certain that they are experienced simultaneously, because they are not themselves uncognized. Thus, it is experienced that conceptual thoughts arise in sequence.

original: bas mngon sum dang 'gal lo //
analyzed: bas mngon sum dang 'gal lo //
translated: Therefore, this contradicts direct perception.

original: 'on te nor bu gzir snang ba bzhin du shes pa gcig nyid kyis sna tshogs pa'i ngo bo blangs pa yin no zhes 'dod na de ni bden pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on te nor bu gzir snang ba bzhin du shes pa gcig nyid kyis sna tshogs pa'i ngo bo blangs pa yin no zhes 'dod na de ni bden pa ma yin te /
translated: If you assert that a single consciousness apprehends a variety of aspects, like a jewelâ€™s facets, that is not true.

original: 'di ltar gang zhig sna tshogs pa yin pa de ni gcig pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang zhig sna tshogs pa yin pa de ni gcig pa ma yin te /
translated: Because that which is a variety is not one.

original: dper na rgyud sna tshogs pa la yod pa'i shes pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na rgyud sna tshogs pa la yod pa'i shes pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like consciousness that exists in a variety of continua.

original: rnam par shes pa 'di yang sna tshogs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin 'gal ba dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa 'di yang sna tshogs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin 'gal ba dmigs pa yin no //
translated: And this consciousness is a variety. This is the observation of a contradiction in their nature.

original: sna tshogs pa nyid du dmigs pas na gtan tshigs ma grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sna tshogs pa nyid du dmigs pas na gtan tshigs ma grub pa ma yin no //
translated: Since a variety is observed, the reason is not unestablished.

original: mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa'i phyir 'gal ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa'i phyir 'gal ba yang ma yin no //
translated: Nor is it contradictory, because it exists in a compatible state.

original: yang sna tshogs pa nyid gang gis gcig pa nyid gsal bar gyur pa sna tshogs pa dang / gcig pa nyid 'gal ba ji ltar yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang sna tshogs pa nyid gang gis gcig pa nyid gsal bar gyur pa sna tshogs pa dang / gcig pa nyid 'gal ba ji ltar yin zhe na /
translated: Moreover, how can the one that is manifested by the diversity be contradictory to the diversity, since they are not mutually exclusive?

original: brjod par bya ste du ma'i rang bzhin las ma gtogs par sna tshogs pa'i sgras brjod par bya ba gzhan yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: brjod par bya ste du ma'i rang bzhin las ma gtogs par sna tshogs pa'i sgras brjod par bya ba gzhan yod pa ma yin no //
translated: We reply: Apart from the nature of the manifold, there is nothing else that can be expressed by the word â€œdiversity.â€

original: du ma dang gcig pa dag kyang rang gi ngo bo phan tshun rnam par bcad pa med na /
analyzed: du ma dang gcig pa dag kyang rang gi ngo bo phan tshun rnam par bcad pa med na /
translated: And the manifold and the one cannot be mutually exclusive, unless their respective natures are mutually exclusive.

original: med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir phan tshun spangs ta gnas pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'gal ba yin pa 'gal ba ma grub pa yin no //
analyzed: med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir phan tshun spangs ta gnas pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'gal ba yin pa 'gal ba ma grub pa yin no //
translated: If they are not mutually exclusive, then the contradiction is not established.

original: 'gal ba gnyis kyi ngo bo gcig tu gyur na ni 'gro ba mtha' dag rdzas gcig tu 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'gal ba gnyis kyi ngo bo gcig tu gyur na ni 'gro ba mtha' dag rdzas gcig tu 'gyur te /
translated: If the nature of the two mutually exclusive things were to become one, then the entire world would become a single substance.

original: de bas na lhan cig skyes pa dang 'jig pa la sogs par thal bar 'gyur ba de bzlog dka'o //
analyzed: de bas na lhan cig skyes pa dang 'jig pa la sogs par thal bar 'gyur ba de bzlog dka'o //
translated: Therefore, it would be difficult to avoid the absurd conclusion that they would be produced and destroyed simultaneously.

original: gzhan du na gcig ces bya ba ni ming tsam du zad de ming de la ni brtsad du med pas gtan tshigs ma nges pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du na gcig ces bya ba ni ming tsam du zad de ming de la ni brtsad du med pas gtan tshigs ma nges pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Otherwise, the term â€œoneâ€ is just a name, and since there is no debate about that name, the reason is not indeterminate.

original: dper na nor bu gzir snang ba ni re zhig grub pa nyid do zhes kyang brjod par mi bya ste /
analyzed: dper na nor bu gzir snang ba ni re zhig grub pa nyid do zhes kyang brjod par mi bya ste /
translated: For example, one should not say that the appearance of a jewel is established,

original: de yang rang bzhin gcig yin na du ma'i rang bzhin gyis ma khyab pas du ma'i rang bzhin nyid la sogs par snang bar mi 'thad de brgal zhing brtag pa mtshungs pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang rang bzhin gcig yin na du ma'i rang bzhin gyis ma khyab pas du ma'i rang bzhin nyid la sogs par snang bar mi 'thad de brgal zhing brtag pa mtshungs pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because if it has a single nature, it is not pervaded by a multiple nature, so it is not tenable that it appears as a multiple nature, and so on, because the same objection and examination apply.

original: 'on te sngon po la sogs par snang ba'i yul dang dus gzhan na gnas pa'i dngos po las tha dad pa yin par mngon sum gyi shes par 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on te sngon po la sogs par snang ba'i yul dang dus gzhan na gnas pa'i dngos po las tha dad pa yin par mngon sum gyi shes par 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: Or, if the appearance as blue and so on is not a thing that exists in a different place and time from the object, it does not become an object of direct perception,

original: gnyi ga snang ba ma yin pa'i phyir / de las 'di ni tha dad pa yin no zhes mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyi ga snang ba ma yin pa'i phyir / de las 'di ni tha dad pa yin no zhes mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not an appearance of both, because it is not apprehended as different from that.

original: yul dang dus mtshungs pa na gan par snang ba las kyang ma yin te 'di ni las tha dad pa yin no zhes rtog pa med pa'i mngon sum gyis mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul dang dus mtshungs pa na gan par snang ba las kyang ma yin te 'di ni las tha dad pa yin no zhes rtog pa med pa'i mngon sum gyis mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not the case that the object and time are the same, because this is not apprehended by non-conceptual perception, which does not conceive of them as different actions.

original: de'i phyir @231a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir @231a * //
translated: Therefore,

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dag dang gzung bar bya ba rnams phan tshun tha dad par mi 'dzin pas sna tshogs pa nyid gnyis su med pa gcig gi ngo bo nyid mngon sum la snang ngo zhes zer ba de yang 'di nyid kyis lan btab pa yin te
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dag dang gzung bar bya ba rnams phan tshun tha dad par mi 'dzin pas sna tshogs pa nyid gnyis su med pa gcig gi ngo bo nyid mngon sum la snang ngo zhes zer ba de yang 'di nyid kyis lan btab pa yin te
translated: since the apprehended object and apprehending subject and the objects of apprehension are not apprehended as mutually different, the diversity appears in direct perception as the entity of a non-dual singularity.ğŸ”½This is also answered by this,

original: / gcig pa dang sna tshogs pa nyid ni 'gal ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / gcig pa dang sna tshogs pa nyid ni 'gal ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because singularity and diversity are contradictory.

original: 'on te grub pa dang bde ba gcig pa nyid yin pa'i phyir sna tshogs pa yang gcig pa nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te grub pa dang bde ba gcig pa nyid yin pa'i phyir sna tshogs pa yang gcig pa nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: But if it is argued that because singularity and existence are the same, diversity is also singularity,

original: de ni mi rigs te phan tshun bzlog pa'i tshul nyid kyis 'di gcig pa nyid du 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni mi rigs te phan tshun bzlog pa'i tshul nyid kyis 'di gcig pa nyid du 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: that is illogical, because due to the mutual contradictory mode, this is contradictory as singularity.

original: 'di 'di dang grub pa dang bde ba nyid gcig pa nyid yin par mngon sum gyis shes par 'gyur ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di 'di dang grub pa dang bde ba nyid gcig pa nyid yin par mngon sum gyis shes par 'gyur ba yang ma yin no //
translated: It is not directly perceived that this is the same as that which is established and blissful.

original: cig car du snang ba grub pa dang bde ba tha mi dang pa nyid yin na ni rang gi ngo bo las gzhan nyid kyang snang ba yin pas /
analyzed: cig car du snang ba grub pa dang bde ba tha mi dang pa nyid yin na ni rang gi ngo bo las gzhan nyid kyang snang ba yin pas /
translated: If it is established that they appear simultaneously and are not different, then their individual natures are also different.

original: ji ltar tha dad par snang ba ma yin /
analyzed: ji ltar tha dad par snang ba ma yin /
translated: How could they not appear to be different?

original: gal te yang tha dad par snang ba yang mi 'dzin pas gnyis su med par brtags na 'di ni 'di las tha mi dad pa yin no zhes de lta bu'i tshul du tha dad med par mi 'dzin pas gnyis su ci'i phyir mi brtag /'on te tha dad
analyzed: gal te yang tha dad par snang ba yang mi 'dzin pas gnyis su med par brtags na 'di ni 'di las tha mi dad pa yin no zhes de lta bu'i tshul du tha dad med par mi 'dzin pas gnyis su ci'i phyir mi brtag /'on te tha dad
translated: If you do not apprehend them as different, but imagine that they are not two, then you do not apprehend them as undifferentiated in the manner of â€œThis is not different from that.â€ Why do you not imagine that they are two?

original: pa dang tha dad pa med pa las rnam par grol ba'i dngos po tsam 'dzin na de lta na ni sngon po la sogs pa sna tshogs pa nyid du ji ltar snang /
analyzed: pa dang tha dad pa med pa las rnam par grol ba'i dngos po tsam 'dzin na de lta na ni sngon po la sogs pa sna tshogs pa nyid du ji ltar snang /
translated: If you apprehend a mere thing that is free from being different or not different, then how could a variety of things such as blue appear?

original: gal te sna tshogs par snang bar 'dod na /
analyzed: gal te sna tshogs par snang bar 'dod na /
translated: If you assert that they appear as a variety,

original: de nyid ni 'jig rten na yang tha dad par snang ba zhes brjod pa yin pas ji ltar na tha dad pa la bsnyon /
analyzed: de nyid ni 'jig rten na yang tha dad par snang ba zhes brjod pa yin pas ji ltar na tha dad pa la bsnyon /
translated: This is what is meant by saying that they appear to be different in the world. So how can you deny that they are different?

original: 'on te gal te gsal ba'i rnam pa 'di dag 'dir bden pa'i rang bzhin kho na yin na de'i tshe 'di thams cad 'gal ba zhig na /
analyzed: 'on te gal te gsal ba'i rnam pa 'di dag 'dir bden pa'i rang bzhin kho na yin na de'i tshe 'di thams cad 'gal ba zhig na /
translated: If these features that are manifest were real in themselves, then everything would be contradictory.

original: 'on kyang rnam par shes pa de ni shel rdo dag pa lta bu gcig pu sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa'i khyad par du ma gyur pa yin la /
analyzed: 'on kyang rnam par shes pa de ni shel rdo dag pa lta bu gcig pu sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa'i khyad par du ma gyur pa yin la /
translated: However, consciousness is like a pure crystal sphere, and the many different features such as blue do not exist in it.

original: rnam pa de lta bu la yang thog ma med pa'i dus can gyi phyin ci log gi bag chags yongs su smin pa'i mthu las /
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu la yang thog ma med pa'i dus can gyi phyin ci log gi bag chags yongs su smin pa'i mthu las /
translated: The features appear due to the ripening of the habitual tendencies of error that have existed since beginningless time.

original: 'jim dum la sogs pa dag la glang po dang rta la sogs par sngags la sogs pas mig bslad pa'i skyes bu la snang bar 'gyur ba bzhin du rnam pa rnams snang ba yin te /
analyzed: 'jim dum la sogs pa dag la glang po dang rta la sogs par sngags la sogs pas mig bslad pa'i skyes bu la snang bar 'gyur ba bzhin du rnam pa rnams snang ba yin te /
translated: They appear like the images of elephants, horses, and so on that appear to a person whose eyes have been affected by a mantra and substances such as clay.

original: des na don dam par shes pa rang bzhin gcig kho na yin par khas len pa ni 'gal ba yod pa ma yin te brdzun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des na don dam par shes pa rang bzhin gcig kho na yin par khas len pa ni 'gal ba yod pa ma yin te brdzun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, it is not contradictory to accept that ultimately consciousness is a single nature, because it is false.ğŸ”½You may respond, â€œWhen you state this fault, you are proving that the aspects are not real, and we also accept that.â€

original: 'di ltar khyed kyis skyon brjod pas ni rnam pa rnams mi bden par bsgrub par bya ba yin na de ni kho bo cag gis kyang khas blangs pa @231b yin no zhes 'dod na de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar khyed kyis skyon brjod pas ni rnam pa rnams mi bden par bsgrub par bya ba yin na de ni kho bo cag gis kyang khas blangs pa @231b yin no zhes 'dod na de ni ma yin te /
translated: This is not so.

original: 'di ltar byis pa'i bar gyis shin tu gsal bar rtogs pa'i sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa'i rang bzhin nyams su myong ba gang yin pa de ni brdzun pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar byis pa'i bar gyis shin tu gsal bar rtogs pa'i sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa'i rang bzhin nyams su myong ba gang yin pa de ni brdzun pa yin la /
translated: The nature of the aspects of blue and so on, which is experienced by even a child in a very clear way, is false.

original: gsal bar snang ba'i rnam pa las tha dad pa gnyis su med pa'i shes pa nyams su myong bar ma gyur pa gang yin pa de ni bden pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di las 'dir legs par smras pa gzhan ci zhig yod /
analyzed: gsal bar snang ba'i rnam pa las tha dad pa gnyis su med pa'i shes pa nyams su myong bar ma gyur pa gang yin pa de ni bden pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di las 'dir legs par smras pa gzhan ci zhig yod /
translated: What else could be better said here than that the consciousness that is not different from the clear appearance of the aspects and is nondual is real?

original: shin tu gsal bar snang ba la mi 'thad pa ci zhig yod /
analyzed: shin tu gsal bar snang ba la mi 'thad pa ci zhig yod /
translated: What is unreasonable about the clear appearance?

original: de kho na nyid du med pas so zhe na /
analyzed: de kho na nyid du med pas so zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is because it does not exist in reality,

original: brjod pa gang zhig gang la med pa'i rang bzhin de ni de rig pa ma yin te /
analyzed: brjod pa gang zhig gang la med pa'i rang bzhin de ni de rig pa ma yin te /
translated: we reply: That which does not have the nature of something else is not aware of it,

original: dper na sdug bsngal la bde ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na sdug bsngal la bde ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin lta bu'o //
translated: like, for example, the nature of pleasure in pain.

original: sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa rnams kyang rnam par shes pa la yang dag par yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa rnams kyang rnam par shes pa la yang dag par yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The aspects such as blue do not really exist in consciousness.

original: khyad par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs ba'o //
analyzed: khyad par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs ba'o //
translated: This is a case of the perception of an inconsistency with a particular.

original: rnam pa rnams brdzun pa nyid du nges pa'i phyir ma grub pa ma yin la /
analyzed: rnam pa rnams brdzun pa nyid du nges pa'i phyir ma grub pa ma yin la /
translated: It is not the case that this reason is not established because the falsity of the aspects is certain.

original: mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa nyid kyi phyir 'gal ba ma yin no //
analyzed: mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa nyid kyi phyir 'gal ba ma yin no //
translated: Nor is it contradictory because it exists in the similar instances.

original: de la gal te spyir don dam par rig pa med par thal bar bsgrubs na de'i tshe /
analyzed: de la gal te spyir don dam par rig pa med par thal bar bsgrubs na de'i tshe /
translated: If you are proving in general that there is no awareness in reality,ğŸ”½then the reason is not established.

original: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos las bzlog pa la sgrub par byed pa'i chos gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma med pa'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs las gtan tshigs bzlog pa la the tsom za bar ji ltar mi 'gyur zhes kyang brjod par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos las bzlog pa la sgrub par byed pa'i chos gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma med pa'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs las gtan tshigs bzlog pa la the tsom za bar ji ltar mi 'gyur zhes kyang brjod par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: Also, it should not be said that â€œhow can there be doubt about the reversal of the reason from the discordant side?â€ because there is no valid cognition that refutes the property of the subject in the opposite of the predicate of the probandum.

original: gang gi phyir 'dir ni spyi kho nar bsgrub par bya ba yin la 'di la ma nges pa nyid kyang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'dir ni spyi kho nar bsgrub par bya ba yin la 'di la ma nges pa nyid kyang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Because here only the general is the probandum, and there is no uncertainty about this.

original: 'di ltar rig pa ni gnyis te gtso bo dang phal ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar rig pa ni gnyis te gtso bo dang phal ba'o //
translated: There are two kinds of awareness: primary and secondary.

original: de la gtso bo ni bems po ma yin pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: de la gtso bo ni bems po ma yin pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa ste /
translated: Among them, the primary is that which has a nature that is not matter.

original: de yang shes pa kho na'i thun mong ma yin pa'i rang gi bdag nyid du gyur pa'i chos yin pas med pa rnam pa yin par ci ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: de yang shes pa kho na'i thun mong ma yin pa'i rang gi bdag nyid du gyur pa'i chos yin pas med pa rnam pa yin par ci ltar 'gyur /
translated: And that is the property that is the uncommon nature of consciousness itself, so how could it be nonexistent?

original: 'di ltar gang zhig shes pa'i rang bzhin ma yin pa de la gtso bo'i rig pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang zhig shes pa'i rang bzhin ma yin pa de la gtso bo'i rig pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Thus, that which is not of the nature of consciousness does not have the awareness of the primary.

original: dper na nam mkha'i padma lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na nam mkha'i padma lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like a sky-lotus.

original: med par khas blangs pa'i sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa rnams kyang shes pa'i rang bzhin ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: med par khas blangs pa'i sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa rnams kyang shes pa'i rang bzhin ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa yin no //
translated: The aspects of blue, etc., which are accepted as non-existent, are also not of the nature of consciousness. This is the observation of the contradiction with the pervasion.

original: phal pa yang mi srid de 'di ltar rang gi rnam par snang ba'i shes pa skyes pa nyid phal pa'i rig par brjod pa yin na /ğŸ”½de yang nus pa thams cad kyis stong pa'i rta'i rva dang @232a * //
analyzed: phal pa yang mi srid de 'di ltar rang gi rnam par snang ba'i shes pa skyes pa nyid phal pa'i rig par brjod pa yin na / de yang nus pa thams cad kyis stong pa'i rta'i rva dang @232a * //
translated: The ordinary is also impossible. In this way, the arising of consciousness appearing as itself is called the awareness of the ordinary.

original: 'dra bar med pa la ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dra bar med pa la ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: That is also not reasonable in the absence of the horn of a rabbit, which is empty of all abilities.

original: med pa'i mtshan nyid ni nus pa thams cad kyis dben pa'i mtshan nyid can yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: med pa'i mtshan nyid ni nus pa thams cad kyis dben pa'i mtshan nyid can yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The characteristic of non-existence is the characteristic of being devoid of all abilities.

original: 'di ltar gang zhig nus pa med pa de ni phal ba'i rig pa ma yin te dper na rta'i rva lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar gang zhig nus pa med pa de ni phal ba'i rig pa ma yin te dper na rta'i rva lta bu'o //
translated: Thus, that which lacks ability is not the awareness of the ordinary, like the horn of a rabbit.

original: med par 'dod pa'i sngon po la sogs ba'i rnam pa rnams kyang nus pa med pa yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa yin no /
analyzed: med par 'dod pa'i sngon po la sogs ba'i rnam pa rnams kyang nus pa med pa yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa yin no /
translated: The aspect of blue, etc., which you accept as nonexistent, is also powerless. This is the observation of a contradiction with the pervasion.

original: rnam ba rnams brdzun pa nyid kyi phyir gtan tshigs ma grub pa ma yin la /
analyzed: rnam ba rnams brdzun pa nyid kyi phyir gtan tshigs ma grub pa ma yin la /
translated: It is not the case that the reason is not established because the aspects are false.

original: mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa'i phyir 'gal ba ma yin no //
analyzed: mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa'i phyir 'gal ba ma yin no //
translated: And it is not contradictory because it exists in the homologous case.

original: des na de ltar dngos dang nye bar brtags pa phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid dag gis rig pa la khyab pa nyid yin pa'i phyir khyab par byed pa de ldog pas /
analyzed: des na de ltar dngos dang nye bar brtags pa phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid dag gis rig pa la khyab pa nyid yin pa'i phyir khyab par byed pa de ldog pas /
translated: Thus, in this way, the pervasion is by the property of the reciprocal exclusion of the real and the imagined. Therefore, when the pervader is eliminated,

original: des khyab pa'i rig pa yang ldog pa kho na yin bas med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'di rig pa la 'jug pa'i go skabs med pas ma nges pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: des khyab pa'i rig pa yang ldog pa kho na yin bas med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'di rig pa la 'jug pa'i go skabs med pas ma nges pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: the pervaded cognition is also eliminated. Therefore, the reason, â€œbecause it does not exist,â€ is not indeterminate because it is impossible for it to occur in a cognition.

original: smig rgyu la sogs pa la chu la sogs pa'i rnam pa med kyang rig ba'i phyir ma nges pa nyid ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: smig rgyu la sogs pa la chu la sogs pa'i rnam pa med kyang rig ba'i phyir ma nges pa nyid ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But since one is aware of the aspect of water, etc. in a mirage, etc., is it not uncertain?

original: ma yin te gal te de la yang chu la sogs pa'i rnam pa nang na med la phyi rol na yang med na de'i tshe /
analyzed: ma yin te gal te de la yang chu la sogs pa'i rnam pa nang na med la phyi rol na yang med na de'i tshe /
translated: No, it is not. If the aspect of water, etc. does not exist internally, and also does not exist externally,

original: shin tu med pa de ji ltar rig par 'gyur zhes brgal zhing brtag pa mtshungs so //
analyzed: shin tu med pa de ji ltar rig par 'gyur zhes brgal zhing brtag pa mtshungs so //
translated: then how can one be aware of something that is utterly nonexistent? The objection and analysis are the same.

original: 'brel pa'i stobs kyis nyams su myong ba yin no zhes kyang brjod par mi bya ste /
analyzed: 'brel pa'i stobs kyis nyams su myong ba yin no zhes kyang brjod par mi bya ste /
translated: One should not say that it is experienced by the power of a connection.

original: 'di ltar shes pa'i ngo bo nyid ni rnam pa rnams kyi ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar shes pa'i ngo bo nyid ni rnam pa rnams kyi ma yin te /
translated: Thus, the nature of consciousness is not that of the aspects,

original: shes pa dang 'dra bar yod par thal par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa dang 'dra bar yod par thal par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow that it exists as it is known.

original: 'on te rnam pa'i ngo bo nyid ni shes pa'i yin no snyam du sems na de'i tshe rnam pa dang 'dra bar shes pa med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on te rnam pa'i ngo bo nyid ni shes pa'i yin no snyam du sems na de'i tshe rnam pa dang 'dra bar shes pa med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: But if you think that the nature of the aspects is that of consciousness, then it follows that consciousness does not exist as it is known.

original: shes pa las rnam pa skye ba yang ma yin te rang bzhin med pa la bskyed par bya ba nyid mi srid pa'i phyir /
analyzed: shes pa las rnam pa skye ba yang ma yin te rang bzhin med pa la bskyed par bya ba nyid mi srid pa'i phyir /
translated: Nor do the aspects arise from consciousness, because it is impossible for something that is essenceless to be produced.

original: rnam pa rnams las shes ba skye ba yang ma yin te rnam pa rnams brdzun pa nyid yin pas don byed ba'i nus pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa rnams las shes ba skye ba yang ma yin te rnam pa rnams brdzun pa nyid yin pas don byed ba'i nus pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Nor does consciousness arise from the aspects, because the aspects are false and thus lack the ability to perform a function.

original: de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba dag las ma gtogs pa'i 'brel pa yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba dag las ma gtogs pa'i 'brel pa yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Apart from being identical with it or arising from it, there is no other relation.

original: de bas na gang zhig gang dang lhan cig 'brel ba med pa de ni rig kyang nges par rig par 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de bas na gang zhig gang dang lhan cig 'brel ba med pa de ni rig kyang nges par rig par 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, if something is not related to something else, then even if it is cognized, it does not necessarily cognize the other.

original: dper na shes pa'i bdag nyid rig pa ni mo gsham gyi bu lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na shes pa'i bdag nyid rig pa ni mo gsham gyi bu lta bu'o //
translated: For example, consciousness, which is by nature cognition, does not cognize the son of a barren woman.

original: med par 'dod pa'i rnam pa rnams kyang @232b shes pa dang lhan cig de'i bdag nyid de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa gnyi ga yang med do zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: med par 'dod pa'i rnam pa rnams kyang @232b shes pa dang lhan cig de'i bdag nyid de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa gnyi ga yang med do zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa yin no //
translated: The aspects that you assert to be nonexistent also have no relationship with consciousness, because they are not of the nature of consciousness and do not arise from consciousness. This is a case of nonobservation of a more extensive property.

original: 'brel pa med par bsgrubs zin pa'i phyir ma grub pa ma yin la /
analyzed: 'brel pa med par bsgrubs zin pa'i phyir ma grub pa ma yin la /
translated: Since the absence of a relationship has already been established, this is not an unestablished reason.

original: mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa'i phyir na 'gal ba nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa'i phyir na 'gal ba nyid ma yin no //
translated: Since it is present in similar instances, it is not contradictory.

original: / thams cad rig par thal ba'i phyir gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: / thams cad rig par thal ba'i phyir gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid kyang ma yin no //
translated: Since it does not follow that everything would be known, this is not an uncertain reason.

original: de bas na khyed kyis shes pa dang dus mnyam par 'byung ba nyid du yongs su brtags pa'i rnam pa gang yin pa de la rgyu med pa nyid yin na ltos pa med ba'i phyir res 'ga' ba nyid ji ltar yin zhes 'dir rgyu brjod dgos so //
analyzed: de bas na khyed kyis shes pa dang dus mnyam par 'byung ba nyid du yongs su brtags pa'i rnam pa gang yin pa de la rgyu med pa nyid yin na ltos pa med ba'i phyir res 'ga' ba nyid ji ltar yin zhes 'dir rgyu brjod dgos so //
translated: Therefore, you must state the cause of the aspects that you imagine to arise simultaneously with consciousness, if they are causeless, how can they be intermittent, because they would be independent?

original: ji ltar khyed kyi ltar na brdzun ba nyid kyis kun rdzob tu shes pa dang shes bya ba dag snang bar 'dod pa de bzhin du nged kyi ltar na yang rnam pa med pa'i de kho na nyid du gyur pa'i shes pa la de dang ma 'brel ba
analyzed: ji ltar khyed kyi ltar na brdzun ba nyid kyis kun rdzob tu shes pa dang shes bya ba dag snang bar 'dod pa de bzhin du nged kyi ltar na yang rnam pa med pa'i de kho na nyid du gyur pa'i shes pa la de dang ma 'brel ba
translated: Just as you assert that the object of knowledge and the consciousness appear as the conventional due to falsity, in the same way, we also assert that the consciousness that is the reality devoid of aspects appears as other, that is, as the object, due to ignorance.

original: kho nar ma rig pas mi bden pa yang kun rdzob tu gzhan nyid du snang ba yin no snyam du sems pa gang dag yin pa de dag kyang 'di nyid kyis bsal ba yin no //
analyzed: kho nar ma rig pas mi bden pa yang kun rdzob tu gzhan nyid du snang ba yin no snyam du sems pa gang dag yin pa de dag kyang 'di nyid kyis bsal ba yin no //
translated: Those who think this are also refuted by this verse.

original: kho bo cag gi ltar na ni kun rdzob tu shes pa nyid shes bya'i rang bzhin no zhes 'brel pa khas blangs pas de dag snang ba la 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: kho bo cag gi ltar na ni kun rdzob tu shes pa nyid shes bya'i rang bzhin no zhes 'brel pa khas blangs pas de dag snang ba la 'gal ba med do //
translated: According to us, the nature of the object of knowledge is consciousness itself in the conventional sense. Since we accept this connection, there is no contradiction in their appearance.ğŸ”½If you think, â€œLet us not commit this error,â€ and you assert that the object of knowledge and consciousness exist in mutual dependence,

original: ji ste nyes pa 'dir ma gyur cig snyam pas rgyu dang ldan par yin na de'i tshe /
analyzed: ji ste nyes pa 'dir ma gyur cig snyam pas rgyu dang ldan par yin na de'i tshe /
translated: then the following consequence would ensue.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa dag rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir brtags pa nyid ma yin pas gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid du thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa dag rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir brtags pa nyid ma yin pas gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid du thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: Since the aspects of the apprehended and the apprehender are dependently arisen, they are not imaginary, so it follows they are the dependent nature.

original: 'di ltar gzhan gyi dbang ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba las gzhan ma yin pas so //ğŸ”½gal te de lta yin mod /
analyzed: 'di ltar gzhan gyi dbang ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba las gzhan ma yin pas so // gal te de lta yin mod /
translated: Because the dependent is not other than dependent origination.ğŸ”½Even if that is so, how could they exist ultimately?

original: de lta na yang don dam par yod par ga la 'gyur snyam na brjod pa 'di ltar rnam par shes pa'i yod pa zhes bya ba yang rkyen las byung ba'i ngo bo las gzhan ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta na yang don dam par yod par ga la 'gyur snyam na brjod pa 'di ltar rnam par shes pa'i yod pa zhes bya ba yang rkyen las byung ba'i ngo bo las gzhan ma yin no //
translated: We reply: The so-called existence of consciousness is not other than the nature of arising from conditions.

original: de bas na rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang med na mi 'byung ba'i don dam par yod pa ni bzlog par dka' zhing /
analyzed: de bas na rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang med na mi 'byung ba'i don dam par yod pa ni bzlog par dka' zhing /
translated: Therefore, it is difficult to refute that dependent origination and the ultimate existence of the meaning of nonarising are the same.

original: de las kyang snga ma dang phyi mar yod pa yin pa'i phyir cig car rig pa med par thal zhing rnam par brdzun par khas blangs pa nyams par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las kyang snga ma dang phyi mar yod pa yin pa'i phyir cig car rig pa med par thal zhing rnam par brdzun par khas blangs pa nyams par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, since they exist in the past and future, it follows they are not momentary, and the assertion that they are false is undermined.

original: 'on te ji skad du brjod pa'i rnam pa yang khas mi len na de'i tshe dmigs ba'i rig byar gyur pa nyid kyis /ğŸ”½rnam pa med pa'i shes pa nyid srog chags thams cad @233a * //
analyzed: 'on te ji skad du brjod pa'i rnam pa yang khas mi len na de'i tshe dmigs ba'i rig byar gyur pa nyid kyis / rnam pa med pa'i shes pa nyid srog chags thams cad @233a * //
translated: But if you do not accept the aspect as it is described, then at that time,ğŸ”½because it is the object of observation, the consciousness without an aspect

original: kyis rtag tu rig go zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kyis rtag tu rig go zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: is always known by all living beings.

original: 'di snyam du rig pa kho na yin mod kyi 'on kyang nyams su myong ba ni na pa'i rnam pas bskyed pa'i 'khrul pa'i stobs kyis tshu rol mthong ba'i dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa ma yin pa'i phyir te de las nyams su myong bar nges pa'i
analyzed: 'di snyam du rig pa kho na yin mod kyi 'on kyang nyams su myong ba ni na pa'i rnam pas bskyed pa'i 'khrul pa'i stobs kyis tshu rol mthong ba'i dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa ma yin pa'i phyir te de las nyams su myong bar nges pa'i
translated: You may think, â€œIt is indeed known, but because the experience is produced by the power of the error that is generated by the aspect of the object, it is not the characteristic of the object of observation that is seen by the person.

original: dmigs pa tshang ba'i phyir de la dmigs pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dmigs pa tshang ba'i phyir de la dmigs pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Because the experience is definitely from that, the object of observation is not complete in that experience.ğŸ”½Therefore it is not the object of observation, just as the momentary is not.â€

original: skad cig ma nyid bzhin no zhes bya bar sems na de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: skad cig ma nyid bzhin no zhes bya bar sems na de ni ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: 'di ltar gal te nang ngam phyi rol du rnam pa nyams su myong bas bskyed pa'i 'khrul pa'i stobs kyis rig bzhin pa'i rnam par shes pa yang mi nges pa zhes bya bar 'gyur ba zhig na gang gi tshe dag nang na med cing phyi rol na med
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te nang ngam phyi rol du rnam pa nyams su myong bas bskyed pa'i 'khrul pa'i stobs kyis rig bzhin pa'i rnam par shes pa yang mi nges pa zhes bya bar 'gyur ba zhig na gang gi tshe dag nang na med cing phyi rol na med
translated: Thus, if consciousness were uncertain due to the power of delusion that arises from the experience of aspects, whether internal or external, then when it does not exist internally and does not exist externally,

original: pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: pa de'i tshe /
translated: at that time

original: gang gis gnyis med pa nyams su myong yang ma nges pa zhes bya bar 'gyur ba gang zhig nyams su myong bas bslus par 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gis gnyis med pa nyams su myong yang ma nges pa zhes bya bar 'gyur ba gang zhig nyams su myong bas bslus par 'gyur /
translated: what is experienced that is uncertain due to the nonexistence of duality? What is deceived by experience?

original: 'on te brdzun pa'i rnam pa kun tu ston par byed pa gang yin pa de lta bu de ni 'khrul pa'i ngo bo nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'on te brdzun pa'i rnam pa kun tu ston par byed pa gang yin pa de lta bu de ni 'khrul pa'i ngo bo nyid yin te /
translated: Or, if you assert that that which displays false aspects is the nature of delusion,

original: des na rnam pa med pa yang 'khrul pa'i dbang gis rig par 'gyur ba yin no zhes 'dod na /
analyzed: des na rnam pa med pa yang 'khrul pa'i dbang gis rig par 'gyur ba yin no zhes 'dod na /
translated: then, due to delusion, consciousness would be aware of aspects that do not exist.

original: de yang yang dag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang yang dag pa ma yin te /
translated: But that is not correct.

original: 'di ltar 'khrul pa'i sgras 'khrul pa bskyed pa'i bag chags rgyur gyur pa'i shes pa'i gnas skabs sam yang na rnam pa de lta bu'i bag chags las byung ba'i 'khrul pa can gyi shes pa 'bras bu'i rang bzhin nyid brjod par 'gyur grang /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'khrul pa'i sgras 'khrul pa bskyed pa'i bag chags rgyur gyur pa'i shes pa'i gnas skabs sam yang na rnam pa de lta bu'i bag chags las byung ba'i 'khrul pa can gyi shes pa 'bras bu'i rang bzhin nyid brjod par 'gyur grang /
translated: Thus, it would be the state of consciousness that is the cause of the latent potentialities that generate error through the power of unreal imagination, or else it would be the consciousness that is erroneous and arises from the latent potentialities that have that aspect.

original: de la phyogs dang po la ni rgyu dang rnam pa rnams ma 'brel ba'i phyir de'i stobs kyis de rnams myong ba ni rigs pa ma yin te ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la phyogs dang po la ni rgyu dang rnam pa rnams ma 'brel ba'i phyir de'i stobs kyis de rnams myong ba ni rigs pa ma yin te ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In the first case, since the cause and the aspects are not related, it is illogical that they are experienced through the power of the cause, because that would lead to the absurd conclusion that anything could arise from anything.

original: de las byung ba'i mtshan gyi 'brel pa yod pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de las byung ba'i mtshan gyi 'brel pa yod pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is also illogical to say that the cause and the result are related in the sense that the result arises from the cause.

original: snga ma bzhin du gzhan gyi dbang nyid yin par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du gzhan gyi dbang nyid yin par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because, as before, it would follow that the result would be dependent on another.

original: 'on te yang phyogs gnyis pa yin na de la yang rnam pa rnams 'brel pa zhig yin na de'i bdag nyid kyi mtshan nyid du 'gyur gyi de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on te yang phyogs gnyis pa yin na de la yang rnam pa rnams 'brel pa zhig yin na de'i bdag nyid kyi mtshan nyid du 'gyur gyi de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid ni ma yin te /
translated: But if the second position is maintained, then if the aspects are related, they would be of the same nature, not of the nature of arising from it.

original: de dang dus mnyam du nyams su myong ba nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / dus mnyam pa dag kyang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid du mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang dus mnyam du nyams su myong ba nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / dus mnyam pa dag kyang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid du mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because they are experienced simultaneously, and because it is not possible for simultaneous things to be cause and effect.

original: de'i phyir 'khrul pa'i rang bzhin du de dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir gzhan gyi dbang nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba bzlog par @233b bka' bas 'di ni gyi na'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'khrul pa'i rang bzhin du de dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir gzhan gyi dbang nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba bzlog par @233b bka' bas 'di ni gyi na'o //
translated: Therefore, because it is not different from that, it would follow that the dependent nature would also be of the nature of error.ğŸ”½But this is unacceptable.

original: 'di snyam gzung 'dzin gyi rnam par 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: 'di snyam gzung 'dzin gyi rnam par 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir na /
translated: Therefore, because there is no error of subject and object,

original: gnyid kyis log pa la sogs pa'i gnas skabs su rang rig pa'i rang bzhin gcig bden par 'gyur ro zhes sems can /
analyzed: gnyid kyis log pa la sogs pa'i gnas skabs su rang rig pa'i rang bzhin gcig bden par 'gyur ro zhes sems can /
translated: it is the true, single nature of reflexive awareness.

original: de ni ma yin te yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni chos kyi khams la dmigs pa nyid min yang sems las byung ba 'ba' zhig mi 'dzin pa'i phyir tshogs pa yongs su gcod pas sna tshogs pa'i rang bzhin can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni ma yin te yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni chos kyi khams la dmigs pa nyid min yang sems las byung ba 'ba' zhig mi 'dzin pa'i phyir tshogs pa yongs su gcod pas sna tshogs pa'i rang bzhin can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is not so, because even though the mental consciousness does not have the dharma realm as its object, it is not the case that it does not apprehend only mental factors, because it is a collection that is determined by the various natures of its components.

original: 'on te gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos po dang bral ba mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa'i rnam par shes pa'i phung po'i rang bzhin nyid nges pa yin na /
analyzed: 'on te gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos po dang bral ba mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa'i rnam par shes pa'i phung po'i rang bzhin nyid nges pa yin na /
translated: If it is determined that the nature of the aggregate of consciousness is that it is associated with the absence of the entity of subject and object,

original: de lta na yang sna tshogs pa nyid du mngon par rgyug go //
analyzed: de lta na yang sna tshogs pa nyid du mngon par rgyug go //
translated: then even in that case, it is still manifestly engaged in the various natures of its components.

original: 'di ltar de la 'khrul pa'i bag chags yod do zhes khyed khas len tam 'on te ma yin zhes rtog pa gnyis so //
analyzed: 'di ltar de la 'khrul pa'i bag chags yod do zhes khyed khas len tam 'on te ma yin zhes rtog pa gnyis so //
translated: In this regard, there are two possibilities: do you accept that there are habitual propensities for error in that consciousness or do you not?

original: gal te dang po yin na de'i tshe ni phyin ci log gi rnam par mngon par zhen pa'i bag chags nyid ni rig pa kho na yin la /
analyzed: gal te dang po yin na de'i tshe ni phyin ci log gi rnam par mngon par zhen pa'i bag chags nyid ni rig pa kho na yin la /
translated: If it is the first, then it is simply the habitual propensities for the misapprehension of the erroneous aspects.

original: bag chags de yang nus pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: bag chags de yang nus pa zhes brjod do //
translated: And those habitual propensities are called potentialities.

original: nus pa yang rgyu'i shes pa'i bdag nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nus pa yang rgyu'i shes pa'i bdag nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: And the potency would be of the nature of the causal consciousness.

original: des na rgyur gyur pa'i ma rig bdag nyid kyi shes pa snga ma las phyin ci log tu mngon par zhen pa'i 'bras bu phyi ma phyi ma skye ba las ma rig pa'i dbang gis de ltar snang ba 'thad par 'gyur ba'i phyir na sna tshogs nyid nan
analyzed: des na rgyur gyur pa'i ma rig bdag nyid kyi shes pa snga ma las phyin ci log tu mngon par zhen pa'i 'bras bu phyi ma phyi ma skye ba las ma rig pa'i dbang gis de ltar snang ba 'thad par 'gyur ba'i phyir na sna tshogs nyid nan
translated: Therefore, since it is tenable that the subsequent effects of the erroneous adherence to the object of the former consciousness that is the cause of ignorance appear in that way due to the power of ignorance, the diversity of appearances

original: gyis 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: gyis 'byung ba yin no //
translated: definitely arises from the potency.

original: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen las nges pa ma yin no zhes kyang brjod par mi bya ste /
analyzed: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen las nges pa ma yin no zhes kyang brjod par mi bya ste /
translated: Nor should it be said that it is not definite from the similar immediately preceding condition,

original: gang gi phyir ji skad du bshad pa'i shes pa nyid mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen yin pas 'di ni gyi na'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir ji skad du bshad pa'i shes pa nyid mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen yin pas 'di ni gyi na'o //
translated: because the consciousness itself, as it has been explained, is the similar immediately preceding condition.

original: 'on te der bag chags kyi bdag nyid can gyi nus pa dag ni tha dad pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te der bag chags kyi bdag nyid can gyi nus pa dag ni tha dad pa yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you say that the potencies that are of the nature of predispositions are different,ğŸ”½then it follows that the potencies would be the cause of the consciousness.

original: ma yin te yang dag par na nus pa du ma tha mi dad pas nus pa'i ngo bo dang 'dra bar cig car rnam par shes pa du ma nyid du thal bar 'gyur zhing de la yang nyes pa brjod zin to //
analyzed: ma yin te yang dag par na nus pa du ma tha mi dad pas nus pa'i ngo bo dang 'dra bar cig car rnam par shes pa du ma nyid du thal bar 'gyur zhing de la yang nyes pa brjod zin to //
translated: But that is not so, because in reality, since the many potencies are not different, it follows that many consciousnesses would arise simultaneously, like the nature of the potencies. And the faults of that have already been explained.

original: yang na de bzhin du shes pa gcig dang tha mi dad pas nus pa rnam par shes pa'i rang gi ngo bo dang 'dra bar gcig pa nyid du 'gyur ba ni bzlog par dka' bas de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyi dbye bar ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: yang na de bzhin du shes pa gcig dang tha mi dad pas nus pa rnam par shes pa'i rang gi ngo bo dang 'dra bar gcig pa nyid du 'gyur ba ni bzlog par dka' bas de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyi dbye bar ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: Or, in the same way, since they are not different from a single consciousness, the potencies would be the same as the nature of consciousness. It is difficult to reverse that. So how could there be a division of the immediately preceding condition?

original: 'on te de ma yin no zhes phyogs gnyis pa ltar 'dod na de'i tshe 'bad pa med par lus can thams cad grol ba la sogs par thal ba bzlog du med do //
analyzed: 'on te de ma yin no zhes phyogs gnyis pa ltar 'dod na de'i tshe 'bad pa med par lus can thams cad grol ba la sogs par thal ba bzlog du med do //
translated: But if you assert the second position, that it is not so, then it follows, without a doubt, that all embodied beings would be liberated without effort.

original: 'on te so so'i skye bo'i shes @234a * //
analyzed: 'on te so so'i skye bo'i shes @234a * //
translated: But the consciousness of ordinary beingsğŸ”½does not engage in the transformation of the object.

original: thams cad ni sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pas nye bar bsgyur ba dang mi ldan par 'jug go //
analyzed: thams cad ni sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pas nye bar bsgyur ba dang mi ldan par 'jug go //
translated: All consciousnesses engage in the transformation of the object, such as blue, without possessing it.

original: de la ni gcig nyid nyams bar thal bar 'gyur ba yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de la ni gcig nyid nyams bar thal bar 'gyur ba yod pa ma yin te /
translated: But in that case, it is not the case that the fault of the loss of singularity occurs,

original: sna tshogs kyi rang bzhin can ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sna tshogs kyi rang bzhin can ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not have the nature of a variety.

original: de'i sngon po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin rig pa nyid du rnam par gzhag pa gang yin pa de ni de myong bar byed pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i sngon po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin rig pa nyid du rnam par gzhag pa gang yin pa de ni de myong bar byed pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir /
translated: That which is posited as the cognition of the nature of blue and so on is the nature that experiences that,

original: sngon po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pas ni ma yin no //
translated: but it is not the nature of blue and so on.

original: 'di ltar rnam pa ni dmigs pa 'dzin pa'i bye brag kho na yin gyi de'i rang bzhin can ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam pa ni dmigs pa 'dzin pa'i bye brag kho na yin gyi de'i rang bzhin can ni ma yin no //
translated: In this way, the aspect is only the difference in the apprehension of the object; it is not the nature of that.

original: gzhan yang sngon po la sogs par phyi rol lta bur snang ba mtshon pa de ni shes pa'i rnam pa de nyid kyis ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang sngon po la sogs par phyi rol lta bur snang ba mtshon pa de ni shes pa'i rnam pa de nyid kyis ni ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, that which is the appearance as external objects such as blue and so on is not the aspect of consciousness itself.

original: 'on kyang sngon po la sogs pa rig pa'i shes pa nyams su myong ba'i rtogs pa po rmongs pa las sngon po la sogs pa de ltar phyi rol gyi rang bzhin can ni ma yin no snyam na de yang log pa yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang sngon po la sogs pa rig pa'i shes pa nyams su myong ba'i rtogs pa po rmongs pa las sngon po la sogs pa de ltar phyi rol gyi rang bzhin can ni ma yin no snyam na de yang log pa yin te /
translated: But if you think that the experiencer of the consciousness that perceives blue and so on is deluded and that blue and so on are not external by nature, that is also incorrect.

original: 'di ltar gal te sngon po la sogs pa dang 'brel ba gang yang med na de'i tshe sngon po la sogs pa rig par byed par ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te sngon po la sogs pa dang 'brel ba gang yang med na de'i tshe sngon po la sogs pa rig par byed par ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: In that case, if it is not related to blue and so on, how could it be the perceiver of blue and so on?

original: gang gis de'i rang bzhin las tha dad par rnam par 'jog par 'gyur ba g-yo ba med pa'i shes pa la ni dmigs pa 'dzin pa'i bye brag gzhan ni yod pa ma yin te ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gis de'i rang bzhin las tha dad par rnam par 'jog par 'gyur ba g-yo ba med pa'i shes pa la ni dmigs pa 'dzin pa'i bye brag gzhan ni yod pa ma yin te ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Since it is not different from its nature, it is not established as different. A motionless consciousness does not have another aspect that apprehends an object because that would be absurd.

original: 'on kyang shes pa de'i rang bzhin can du skyes pa nyid byed pa dang bcas pa lta bur rtogs pas de'i dmigs pa 'dzin par byed pa'i bye brag ni de yin par brjod cing de la yang nyes ba brjod zin to //
analyzed: 'on kyang shes pa de'i rang bzhin can du skyes pa nyid byed pa dang bcas pa lta bur rtogs pas de'i dmigs pa 'dzin par byed pa'i bye brag ni de yin par brjod cing de la yang nyes ba brjod zin to //
translated: But since it is produced in the nature of that consciousness, it is understood to be as if it had an action. Therefore, it is said that the distinction of the object of that consciousness is its object. And the fault of that has already been stated.

original: gal te sngon po la sogs pa ni rnam pa thams cad du med pa nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te sngon po la sogs pa ni rnam pa thams cad du med pa nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: If blue, etc., do not exist at all,

original: de lta ma yin te 'di ltar gal te snod po la sogs pa phyi 'am nang na yang med na /
analyzed: de lta ma yin te 'di ltar gal te snod po la sogs pa phyi 'am nang na yang med na /
translated: then it is not so, because if the pot, etc., do not exist either externally or internally,

original: ji ltar rtog pa med pa'i sems la shin tu gsal bar nyams su myong ba 'di brjod dogs so //
analyzed: ji ltar rtog pa med pa'i sems la shin tu gsal bar nyams su myong ba 'di brjod dogs so //
translated: how can this very clear experience of the non-conceptual mind be explained?

original: mi snang ba kho na'o zhes de skad du smra bar nus pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: mi snang ba kho na'o zhes de skad du smra bar nus pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not possible to say that it is only non-apparent,

original: snang ba de ni thams cad kyi nyams su myong bar grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snang ba de ni thams cad kyi nyams su myong bar grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that appearance is established as experienced by all.

original: gang gis rmongs pa'i bdag nyid can gyis de ltar nges par byed pa yin no zhes brjod par 'gyur ba gsal bar snang ba ni rnam par rtog pa'i yul du 'thad pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gis rmongs pa'i bdag nyid can gyis de ltar nges par byed pa yin no zhes brjod par 'gyur ba gsal bar snang ba ni rnam par rtog pa'i yul du 'thad pa yang ma yin no //
translated: But it is not tenable that the object of conceptual consciousness is a clearly appearing object, since it is said that the deluded person determines it in that way.

original: 'on te de lta yin yang rnam par rtog pas nges pa yin no zhes bya bar sems na /
analyzed: 'on te de lta yin yang rnam par rtog pas nges pa yin no zhes bya bar sems na /
translated: But if you think that even if that is so, it is determined by conceptual consciousness,

original: de ni mi legs te gang @234b gi phyir shes pa thams cad rnam pa med pa kho nar nyams su myong ba yin na /
analyzed: de ni mi legs te gang @234b gi phyir shes pa thams cad rnam pa med pa kho nar nyams su myong ba yin na /
translated: that is not good, because all consciousnesses are experienced as only devoid of aspects.

original: de'i tshe de'i rjes las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pas kyang sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa so sor nges pas lhag par zhen par yang rigs pa nyid yin te 'brel pa med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe de'i rjes las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pas kyang sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa so sor nges pas lhag par zhen par yang rigs pa nyid yin te 'brel pa med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Then, at that time, it would be reasonable for the conceptual consciousness that arises later to also conceive the aspects of blue and so on individually, because there would be no connection between them.

original: 'di lta bu 'di ni 'khrul pa'i rang bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'di lta bu 'di ni 'khrul pa'i rang bzhin no zhe na /
translated: This is the nature of error.

original: 'di la ni gzhan dbang nyid du thal bar 'gyur bas ji ltar 'khrul pa dang 'di 'brel pa yin zhes bshad zin to //
analyzed: 'di la ni gzhan dbang nyid du thal bar 'gyur bas ji ltar 'khrul pa dang 'di 'brel pa yin zhes bshad zin to //
translated: But since it would follow that it is dependent, how is it related to error? This has already been explained.

original: de bas na 'brel pa med pas sngon po la sogs pa med pa ni rnam par rtog pa'i yul nyid du yang nyams su myong bar mi 'thad pa'i phyir 'di ni rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na 'brel pa med pas sngon po la sogs pa med pa ni rnam par rtog pa'i yul nyid du yang nyams su myong bar mi 'thad pa'i phyir 'di ni rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, since there is no relation, it is not tenable that the nonexistence of blue and so on is experienced as the object of thought. This is illogical.

original: gal te de lta ma yin /
analyzed: gal te de lta ma yin /
translated: If you say that is not so,

original: 'o na yongs su ma dag pa'i skabs na yod pa'i sna tshogs su snang ba'i shes pa ni brdzun pa kho na yin gyi /
analyzed: 'o na yongs su ma dag pa'i skabs na yod pa'i sna tshogs su snang ba'i shes pa ni brdzun pa kho na yin gyi /
translated: then the consciousness that appears as a variety in the impure state is false.

original: yongs su dag pa'i skabs na ni 'khrul pa dang bral bas gnyis su med pa'i rang bzhin gcig kho nar 'gyur ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: yongs su dag pa'i skabs na ni 'khrul pa dang bral bas gnyis su med pa'i rang bzhin gcig kho nar 'gyur ba yin no zhe na /
translated: In the pure state, it becomes only the single nature of nonduality, free from delusion.

original: brjod pa gal te /
analyzed: brjod pa gal te /
translated: We reply: If,

original: ma dag pa'i skabs na ni 'khrul pa dang bral bas gnyis su med pa'i rang bzhin gcig kho nar 'gyur ba yin na ni /
analyzed: ma dag pa'i skabs na ni 'khrul pa dang bral bas gnyis su med pa'i rang bzhin gcig kho nar 'gyur ba yin na ni /
translated: in the impure state, it becomes only the single nature of nonduality, free from delusion,

original: de'i tshe dag pa'i gnas skabs kyi bden ba'i rang bzhin gyi ngo bo gang las skye bar brjod par bya ba brdzun pa las bden pa'i ngo bo skye bar yang mi dmigs te de la nus pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe dag pa'i gnas skabs kyi bden ba'i rang bzhin gyi ngo bo gang las skye bar brjod par bya ba brdzun pa las bden pa'i ngo bo skye bar yang mi dmigs te de la nus pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: At that time, the nature of reality in the pure state is not observed to arise from a false nature, because it is not possible.

original: nus pa yod na yang de brdzun par ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: nus pa yod na yang de brdzun par ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: If it were possible, then how could it be false?

original: rnam pa de lta bu yang brdzun pa nyid yin na ni gzhan dag kyang bden pa nyid du ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu yang brdzun pa nyid yin na ni gzhan dag kyang bden pa nyid du ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: If that kind of aspect is false, then how could the others be real?

original: de bas na 'di ni rgyu med pa kho nar 'gyur na de yang mi rigs te rtag tu yod pa la sogs par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bas na 'di ni rgyu med pa kho nar 'gyur na de yang mi rigs te rtag tu yod pa la sogs par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, this would be causeless, but that is not reasonable, because the consequence would be that it would always exist and so on.

original: 'khrul pa dang bral bas zhes kyang brjod par mi bya ste /
analyzed: 'khrul pa dang bral bas zhes kyang brjod par mi bya ste /
translated: It should not be said that it is free from error.
