original: gal te dag pa'i gnas skabs na rnam pa thams cad ldog pa srid par gyur na ni de'i tshe 'di yang srid pa zhig na gang gi phyir 'khrul ba ldog kyang rnam pa rnams bzlog pa ni mi srid de /
analyzed: gal te dag pa'i gnas skabs na rnam pa thams cad ldog pa srid par gyur na ni de'i tshe 'di yang srid pa zhig na gang gi phyir 'khrul ba ldog kyang rnam pa rnams bzlog pa ni mi srid de /
translated: If it were possible that all aspects cease in the pure state, then at that time this would be possible. However, even when error ceases, it is not possible to stop the aspects.

original: der de rnams ci skad du bshad pa'i tshul gyis 'brel ba med pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: der de rnams ci skad du bshad pa'i tshul gyis 'brel ba med pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: Because they are not related in the way that has been explained.

original: / pa lang dang rta bzhin du ma 'brel pa gcig log pas gzhan nges par ldog pa ma yin te ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / pa lang dang rta bzhin du ma 'brel pa gcig log pas gzhan nges par ldog pa ma yin te ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: And just as a cow and a horse are not related, the cessation of one does not entail the cessation of the other, because that would be absurd.

original: 'on te yang 'ga' zhig gi shes pa gnyis med cing spros pa dang bral ba dang / rang bzhin gyis grub pa nyid ni gcig tu 'gyur ro snyam na de yang mi rigs @235a * //
analyzed: 'on te yang 'ga' zhig gi shes pa gnyis med cing spros pa dang bral ba dang / rang bzhin gyis grub pa nyid ni gcig tu 'gyur ro snyam na de yang mi rigs @235a * //
translated: But if you think that the nondual, unelaborated consciousness of someone who is naturally established is one, that is illogical.

original: te rang bzhin gyis grub pa nyid yin na ni so sor nges pa'i rten yongs su 'dzin pas rag las pa ma yin pa'i phyir rnam pa de lta bu'i yod pa ni 'ga' yang mi ldog par 'gyur te /
analyzed: te rang bzhin gyis grub pa nyid yin na ni so sor nges pa'i rten yongs su 'dzin pas rag las pa ma yin pa'i phyir rnam pa de lta bu'i yod pa ni 'ga' yang mi ldog par 'gyur te /
translated: If it were naturally established, it would not be dependent on the support of a specific determination, and thus such an existence would not be refuted at all.

original: de'i phyir grags pa la sogs pa dang 'gal bar gyur to //
analyzed: de'i phyir grags pa la sogs pa dang 'gal bar gyur to //
translated: Therefore, it would contradict what is well known.

original: 'di snyam du gang gis gnyen po'i skad cig snga ma snga ma'i stobs las skyes pa'i phyir so sor nges pa'i rgyu las 'ga' zhig de'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ba zhes bya ba de 'dab de ni rgyu'i chos yin no zhes bya bar sems na de ni shin
analyzed: 'di snyam du gang gis gnyen po'i skad cig snga ma snga ma'i stobs las skyes pa'i phyir so sor nges pa'i rgyu las 'ga' zhig de'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ba zhes bya ba de 'dab de ni rgyu'i chos yin no zhes bya bar sems na de ni shin
translated: If you think, â€œBecause it arises from the power of the prior moments of the antidote, some of its nature is the nature of the cause,â€ then that is the property of the subject that is the reason.

original: tu mdzes pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: tu mdzes pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: That is not very beautiful.

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i sgrub pas thams cad dngos po med par bsgrubs pas don dam rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo mi 'thad pa'i phyir 'di ni gyi na'o //
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i sgrub pas thams cad dngos po med par bsgrubs pas don dam rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo mi 'thad pa'i phyir 'di ni gyi na'o //
translated: Because the proof that all things are established as nonexistent through the previously explained argument is established, the nature of cause and effect is untenable in the ultimate.

original: de bas na gang gi tshe dngos po rnams la rnam par dpyad pa na gcig dang brel ba nyid kyi rang bzhin 'ga' la yang ngo bo nyid grub pa med pa de'i tshe ji ltar du mar 'gyur te du ma ni gcig bsags pa'i bdag nyid can yinğŸ”½pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bas na gang gi tshe dngos po rnams la rnam par dpyad pa na gcig dang brel ba nyid kyi rang bzhin 'ga' la yang ngo bo nyid grub pa med pa de'i tshe ji ltar du mar 'gyur te du ma ni gcig bsags pa'i bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, when things are analyzed, since nothing has a nature that is either one or many, how could they be many? Because many is the nature of the collection of ones.

original: de bas na gtan tshigs ma grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na gtan tshigs ma grub pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the reason is not unestablished.

original: gal te snang ba thams cad gcig dang du ma'i ngo bo dang bral ba nyid kyi dngos po med pa nyid yin na ni mngon sum du snang ba yin te de'i yul ni dngos bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gal te snang ba thams cad gcig dang du ma'i ngo bo dang bral ba nyid kyi dngos po med pa nyid yin na ni mngon sum du snang ba yin te de'i yul ni dngos bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If all appearances are non-things, devoid of the nature of one or many, then they are directly perceived, because their object is a thing.

original: rjes su dpag bas 'dzin na thug pa med pa'i phyir rtogs pa med par 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: rjes su dpag bas 'dzin na thug pa med pa'i phyir rtogs pa med par 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
translated: But if they are apprehended by inference, then there is an infinite regress, and so there would be no understanding of anything.

original: ji ltar gtan tshigs grub pa yin zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar gtan tshigs grub pa yin zhe na ma yin te /
translated: How could the reason be established?

original: ji skad du brjod pa'i rjes su dpag pa'i bsgrub pa rnams kyi ngo bo nyid la ni gcig dang du ma dag gis khyab pa yin no zhes bsgrubs zin to //
analyzed: ji skad du brjod pa'i rjes su dpag pa'i bsgrub pa rnams kyi ngo bo nyid la ni gcig dang du ma dag gis khyab pa yin no zhes bsgrubs zin to //
translated: It is not so, because it has already been established that the nature of the things to be proven by the inferences that have been stated are pervaded by one and many.

original: de rnams kyi nang nas rjes su dpag pa kha cig gi khyab pa ni mngon sum gyi khyab pa bzung ba can gyi rjes su dpag pas 'dzin pas na /
analyzed: de rnams kyi nang nas rjes su dpag pa kha cig gi khyab pa ni mngon sum gyi khyab pa bzung ba can gyi rjes su dpag pas 'dzin pas na /
translated: Among those, the pervasion of some inferences is apprehended by an inference that has the pervasion apprehended by direct perception.

original: rang gi tshad ma ci lta bas na nges pa dang phyogs kyi chos 'dzin pas thug pa med pa ga la yin /
analyzed: rang gi tshad ma ci lta bas na nges pa dang phyogs kyi chos 'dzin pas thug pa med pa ga la yin /
translated: Since it is like that, how could there be an infinite regress due to the apprehension of the property of the subject and the ascertainment by oneâ€™s valid knowledge?

original: mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa'i phyir 'gal ba nyid kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa'i phyir 'gal ba nyid kyang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it contradictory because it exists in a concordant side.

original: 'di ltar gal te ji skad du bshad pa'i gtan tshigs bsgrub par bya ba phyin ci log tu sgrub /
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te ji skad du bshad pa'i gtan tshigs bsgrub par bya ba phyin ci log tu sgrub /
translated: Thus, if the reason as explained proves the opposite of the probandum,

original: yang dag pa'i dngos po la 'jug na de'i tshe /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i dngos po la 'jug na de'i tshe /
translated: then at that time,

original: de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba dag gis der 'bral ba rnam par brtag cing dpyad pa mi bzod pa nyid kyis na /
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba dag gis der 'bral ba rnam par brtag cing dpyad pa mi bzod pa nyid kyis na /
translated: because of being unable to bear analysis and investigation of the nature of that and what arises from that,

original: yang dag par yod pa'i ngo bo dang bral ba sgyu ma la sogs pa'i ngo bo gzhan la ji ltar de 'jug par nus te /
analyzed: yang dag par yod pa'i ngo bo dang bral ba sgyu ma la sogs pa'i ngo bo gzhan la ji ltar de 'jug par nus te /
translated: how could it engage in a nature that is different from the nature of an illusion, and so on, which is free from the nature of real existence?

original: @235b dngos po'i chos nyid las nyams par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: @235b dngos po'i chos nyid las nyams par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would follow that it would degenerate from the nature of things.

original: des na rab tu grags pa'i dpe la yod pa'i gtan tshigs ma nges /
analyzed: des na rab tu grags pa'i dpe la yod pa'i gtan tshigs ma nges /
translated: Therefore, the reason that exists in the example that is well known to others is not ascertained.

original: ji ltar 'gal ba nyid yin /
analyzed: ji ltar 'gal ba nyid yin /
translated: How could it be contradictory?

original: 'on te kho bo cag la chos gnyi ga dang rjes su 'brel ba'i dpe nyid mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: 'on te kho bo cag la chos gnyi ga dang rjes su 'brel ba'i dpe nyid mi 'grub ste /
translated: Or, we do not establish the example that is related to both properties,

original: sgyu ma la sogs pa rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin nyid du dngos por yod pa nyid du khas len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgyu ma la sogs pa rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin nyid du dngos por yod pa nyid du khas len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because you accept that illusions and so on exist as entities that are by nature consciousness.

original: de bas na gtan tshigs ma des pa yin par 'gyur ro zhes 'dod na de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de bas na gtan tshigs ma des pa yin par 'gyur ro zhes 'dod na de ni ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, if you maintain that the reason is not established, that is not so.

original: 'di ltar dngos bo'i ngo bo nyid du mngon par 'dod pa'i rnam par shes pa thams cad ni ji skad du bshad pa'i rjes su dpag pa'i sgrub pa rnams kyis dngos po med par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar dngos bo'i ngo bo nyid du mngon par 'dod pa'i rnam par shes pa thams cad ni ji skad du bshad pa'i rjes su dpag pa'i sgrub pa rnams kyis dngos po med par bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, all consciousnesses that are accepted as entities are shown to be unreal by the proofs that have been explained.

original: des na gang gis sgyu ma la sogs pa tshad mas gnod pa yang rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin du grub pa'i phyir dpe ma grub par 'gyur ba /
analyzed: des na gang gis sgyu ma la sogs pa tshad mas gnod pa yang rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin du grub pa'i phyir dpe ma grub par 'gyur ba /
translated: Therefore, since illusions and so on are established as being by nature consciousness, it is not the case that the example is not established.

original: dngos po rnams rang gi 'dod pa'i stobs kyis de lta bu'i ngo bor 'gyur bar mtshon pa ni med de des na 'di ni gyi na'o //
analyzed: dngos po rnams rang gi 'dod pa'i stobs kyis de lta bu'i ngo bor 'gyur bar mtshon pa ni med de des na 'di ni gyi na'o //
translated: It is not the case that things become such entities by the power of your wish. Therefore this is mere prattle.

original: 'di snyam du phyogs dang mthun pa dag la yod par grub kyang gang gis ldog pa la the tshom za ba'i nyes pa can du mi 'gyur ba gtan tshigs mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog par ji ltar nges zhes bya bar sems na /
analyzed: 'di snyam du phyogs dang mthun pa dag la yod par grub kyang gang gis ldog pa la the tshom za ba'i nyes pa can du mi 'gyur ba gtan tshigs mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog par ji ltar nges zhes bya bar sems na /
translated: If you think, â€œAlthough it is established that the reason exists in things similar to the subject, how can it be ascertained that it is absent from things dissimilar to the subject, since there is the fault that there is doubt about its absence?â€

original: brjod pa gang zhig yongs su gcod pa gang gi rang bzhin rnam par gcod pa med na med pa de ni phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid can yin te /
analyzed: brjod pa gang zhig yongs su gcod pa gang gi rang bzhin rnam par gcod pa med na med pa de ni phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid can yin te /
translated: We reply: That which is ascertained as the nature of something else is necessarily absent when that other thing is absent.

original: dper na dngos po yongs su gcod pas ni dngos po med par rnam par gcad pa med na med pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na dngos po yongs su gcod pas ni dngos po med par rnam par gcad pa med na med pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the ascertainment of a thing is necessarily absent when the absence of a thing is absent.

original: gcig ba nyid dang du ma nyid du yongs su gcod pa yang phan tshun gyi rang bzhin rnam par gcod pa med na med pa kho na yin pa de bas na phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: gcig ba nyid dang du ma nyid du yongs su gcod pa yang phan tshun gyi rang bzhin rnam par gcod pa med na med pa kho na yin pa de bas na phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: The ascertainment of singularity and plurality are necessarily absent when the nature of the other is ascertained. Therefore, they have the characteristic of being mutually exclusive.

original: gang dag phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa de dag ni gcig bsgrub pa gzhan dgag pa med na med pa nyid kyi phyir phung po gzhan med go bar byed pa yin te /
analyzed: gang dag phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa de dag ni gcig bsgrub pa gzhan dgag pa med na med pa nyid kyi phyir phung po gzhan med go bar byed pa yin te /
translated: Because those that are characterized by mutually exclusive presence are necessarily absent when one is established and the other is not negated, they are understood to be mutually exclusive.

original: dper na dngos po dang dngos po med pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na dngos po dang dngos po med pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like an entity and a nonentity.

original: gcig dang du ma dag kyang phan tshun spangs par gnas pa'i mtshan nyid can yin te /ğŸ”½des na phung po gsum pa med pa'i phyir na ngo bo nyid ni gcig dang du ma dag gis bsdus pa yin pa des na bsgrub par bya ba las bzlog pa la gtan tshigs kyi ldog pa grub pas ji skad du bshad pa'i nyes pa'i go @236a *
analyzed: gcig dang du ma dag kyang phan tshun spangs par gnas pa'i mtshan nyid can yin te / des na phung po gsum pa med pa'i phyir na ngo bo nyid ni gcig dang du ma dag gis bsdus pa yin pa des na bsgrub par bya ba las bzlog pa la gtan tshigs kyi ldog pa grub pas ji skad du bshad pa'i nyes pa'i go @236a *
translated: One and many are also characterized by mutually exclusive presence.

original: // skabs ga la yod /
analyzed: // skabs ga la yod /
translated: Therefore, since a third possibility does not exist, essence is included in one and many. Therefore, since the pervasion of the reason by the predicate of the probandum is established, how could there be an opportunity for the faults that have been explained?

original: gal te 'dir dam bcas pa'i don gyi phyogs gcig nyid yin pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ma grub pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te 'dir dam bcas pa'i don gyi phyogs gcig nyid yin pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ma grub pa ma yin nam /
translated: If you say that since the predicate of the probandum is only one part of the meaning of the thesis, the reason is not established,

original: gang gi phyir gcig dang du ma dag ni ngo bo nyid kyi bye brag gi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir de las bzlog pa bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa gnyis kyang tha mi dad pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gcig dang du ma dag ni ngo bo nyid kyi bye brag gi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir de las bzlog pa bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa gnyis kyang tha mi dad pa kho na yin no //
translated: Because singularity and multiplicity are the nature of the specific essence, the two, the probandum and the proof, are not different.

original: de bas na gal te bsgrub par bya ba ma grub na de dang tha mi dad pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir gtan tshigs kyang ma grub pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de bas na gal te bsgrub par bya ba ma grub na de dang tha mi dad pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir gtan tshigs kyang ma grub pa nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, if the probandum is not established, then because of being the nature of that which is not different, the reason is not established.

original: 'on te gtan tshigs grub na ni de'i tshe dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyang grub pa yin te /
analyzed: 'on te gtan tshigs grub na ni de'i tshe dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyang grub pa yin te /
translated: But if the reason is established, then at that time the essencelessness of things is established.

original: gcig dang du ma nyid dang bral ba ri bong gi rva la sogs pa la ni dngos po'i ngo bo nyid du su yang khas mi len pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: gcig dang du ma nyid dang bral ba ri bong gi rva la sogs pa la ni dngos po'i ngo bo nyid du su yang khas mi len pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because no one asserts that a rabbitâ€™s horns and so on, which are devoid of singularity and multiplicity, have the nature of things.

original: de ni bden pa ma yin te 'di ltar re zhig gtan tshigs ji ltar grub pa de ltar ni rgya cher bstan zin to //
analyzed: de ni bden pa ma yin te 'di ltar re zhig gtan tshigs ji ltar grub pa de ltar ni rgya cher bstan zin to //
translated: That is not correct, because it has already been extensively taught how the reason is established.

original: de grub kyang gal te ngo bo nyid med pa grub pa'i tshul gyis bsgrub par bya ba yin du chug pa de lta na yang dngos po la mngon par zhen pa spang bar dka' ba nyid kyis de kho na nyid du dngos po ma lus pa la khyab
analyzed: de grub kyang gal te ngo bo nyid med pa grub pa'i tshul gyis bsgrub par bya ba yin du chug pa de lta na yang dngos po la mngon par zhen pa spang bar dka' ba nyid kyis de kho na nyid du dngos po ma lus pa la khyab
translated: Even if that were established, if it were the case that the nonexistence of intrinsic reality were established by the mode of proof, then it would be difficult to abandon attachment to things, and so it would be impossible to generate certainty in the nonexistence of intrinsic reality, which pervades all things in reality.

original: pa'i ngo bo nyid med pa la nges pa la sogs pa ma skyes bas rmongs ba rnams la dngos po thams cad la ngo bo nyid med pa'i tha snyad du rung pa nyid rab tu bsgrub pa'i phyir dam bcas pa'i don gyi phyogs gcig gtan tshigs ma yin
analyzed: pa'i ngo bo nyid med pa la nges pa la sogs pa ma skyes bas rmongs ba rnams la dngos po thams cad la ngo bo nyid med pa'i tha snyad du rung pa nyid rab tu bsgrub pa'i phyir dam bcas pa'i don gyi phyogs gcig gtan tshigs ma yin
translated: Therefore, for the sake of establishing the suitability of the convention of the nonexistence of intrinsic reality in all things for the confused, one part of the meaning of the thesis is not the reason,

original: te / dper na dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa ma dmigs pa la med do zhes bya ba lta bu yin bas brtsad par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: te / dper na dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa ma dmigs pa la med do zhes bya ba lta bu yin bas brtsad par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: just as, for example, the nonapprehension of something that has the character of being apprehensible is not a reason for the nonexistence of that thing.

original: ji ste rmongs pa la ni tha snyad kyi don du rang bzhin med pa nyid re zhig bsgrub par bya ba nyid yin no zhes mngon par zhen par byed na /
analyzed: ji ste rmongs pa la ni tha snyad kyi don du rang bzhin med pa nyid re zhig bsgrub par bya ba nyid yin no zhes mngon par zhen par byed na /
translated: But if you are confused and insist that the meaning of the expression â€œlack of intrinsic existenceâ€ is something to be proven,ğŸ”½then we reply: When the intrinsic reality of the object of expression is refuted by the exclusion of one and many, which are the pervaders of intrinsic reality, then the object of expression is refuted, just like a tree is refuted by the exclusion of a Å›imÅ›apÄ.

original: de la yang brjod pa gang gi tshe ngo bo nyid la khyab par byed pa'i gcig dang du ma nyid dag ldog pas shing log pas sha pa ldog pa dang 'dra bar de kho na nyid kyi ngo bo ldog bas bsgrub par bya ba de'i tshe gtan tshigs
analyzed: de la yang brjod pa gang gi tshe ngo bo nyid la khyab par byed pa'i gcig dang du ma nyid dag ldog pas shing log pas sha pa ldog pa dang 'dra bar de kho na nyid kyi ngo bo ldog bas bsgrub par bya ba de'i tshe gtan tshigs
translated: At that time, the reason

original: dam bcas pa'i don gyi phyogs gcig la yin /
analyzed: dam bcas pa'i don gyi phyogs gcig la yin /
translated: is a part of the meaning of the thesis.

original: khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa ldog pa'i tshig rnam par gcod pa tha dad pa'i rang bzhin can gnyis ni rnam grangs nyid ma yin la /
analyzed: khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa ldog pa'i tshig rnam par gcod pa tha dad pa'i rang bzhin can gnyis ni rnam grangs nyid ma yin la /
translated: The words that exclude the pervaded and the pervader are of a different nature, and they are not synonyms.

original: rnam grangs kyi ngo bo nyid ma yin na yang dam bcas pa'i don gyi phyogs gcig ma yin pas 'di ni gyi na'o //
analyzed: rnam grangs kyi ngo bo nyid ma yin na yang dam bcas pa'i don gyi phyogs gcig ma yin pas 'di ni gyi na'o //
translated: And if they are not synonyms, then they are not a part of the meaning of the thesis.

original: don dam par zhes bya ba'i khyad par don med pa @236b ma yin nam /
analyzed: don dam par zhes bya ba'i khyad par don med pa @236b ma yin nam /
translated: â€œBut isnâ€™t the distinction â€˜ultimatelyâ€™ meaningless?â€

original: 'di ltar mi slu bar byed pa'i rigs pa ni don dam pa yin no zhes tshul gsum pa'i rtags las skyes pa'i blo dam pa'i sgrar brjod pa de'i tshe ni de yang kun rdzob kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ci ltar don dam pa nyid yin /
analyzed: 'di ltar mi slu bar byed pa'i rigs pa ni don dam pa yin no zhes tshul gsum pa'i rtags las skyes pa'i blo dam pa'i sgrar brjod pa de'i tshe ni de yang kun rdzob kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ci ltar don dam pa nyid yin /
translated: When the cognition that arises from a sign having the three modes is called the word â€œultimate,â€ since it is a type of reasoning that is nondeceptive, at that time, since it is the nature of the conventional, how could it be the ultimate?

original: gal te de'i dbang gis dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid med par rnam par 'jog na de yang gang gis gzhag par bya /
analyzed: gal te de'i dbang gis dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid med par rnam par 'jog na de yang gang gis gzhag par bya /
translated: If, by the power of that, things are posited as essenceless, by what is that posited?

original: de nyid kyis 'jog par yang rigs pa ma yin te bdag nyid la byed pa 'gal ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyis 'jog par yang rigs pa ma yin te bdag nyid la byed pa 'gal ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not tenable that it is posited by that itself, because it is contradictory for something to act on itself.

original: tshad ma gzhan gyis kyang ma yin te thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad ma gzhan gyis kyang ma yin te thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not by another valid cognition, because that would lead to an infinite regress.

original: 'on te blo de gcig pu ma gtogs par byas nas rnam par 'jog na /
analyzed: 'on te blo de gcig pu ma gtogs par byas nas rnam par 'jog na /
translated: But if it is posited except for that cognition alone,

original: de lta ni yul thams cad bdag med par bsgrub par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de lta ni yul thams cad bdag med par bsgrub par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: then it would not be the case that all objects are established as essenceless.

original: de ni legs mod kyi 'on kyang spros pa ma lus pa dang bral ba'i don dam pa dang rjes su mthun pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ji skad du bshad pa'i blos ni don dam pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de ni legs mod kyi 'on kyang spros pa ma lus pa dang bral ba'i don dam pa dang rjes su mthun pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ji skad du bshad pa'i blos ni don dam pa nyid yin no //
translated: That is good, but still, because it is in accordance with the ultimate, free from all conceptual elaborations, the ultimate is just as it is explained by that cognition.

original: ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyang de nyid las yin zhing bdag nyid la byed pa 'gal ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyang de nyid las yin zhing bdag nyid la byed pa 'gal ba yang ma yin te /
translated: And also, the absence of intrinsic reality is just that, and it is not contradictory for it to act on itself.

original: spyi'i tshul gyi chos thams cad dngos po med par 'jog pa'i phyir dang / blo de'i rang gi ngo bo yang spyi'i mtshan nyid de nyid kyi khongs su gtogs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: spyi'i tshul gyi chos thams cad dngos po med par 'jog pa'i phyir dang / blo de'i rang gi ngo bo yang spyi'i mtshan nyid de nyid kyi khongs su gtogs pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because all phenomena are posited as unreal in the manner of a generality, and because the essence of that cognition is included in that generality itself.

original: dper na yod pa la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs dag las chos thams cad la mi rtag pa nyid kyi shes pa 'byung ba na bdag nyid ma gtogs pa ma yin pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: dper na yod pa la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs dag las chos thams cad la mi rtag pa nyid kyi shes pa 'byung ba na bdag nyid ma gtogs pa ma yin pa lta bu ste /
translated: For example, when the cognition of impermanence arises in all phenomena from reasons such as existence, it is not excluded from itself.

original: de ltar na brtsad du med do //
analyzed: de ltar na brtsad du med do //
translated: Thus, there is no dispute.

original: yang dag pa'i skye ba la sogs pa sgro btags pa dang bral ba nyid kyis ma brtags na gcig tu nyams dga' ba'i dngos po'i ngo bo nyid kho na med pa'i sgrar brjod pa ma yin nam dngos po'i ngo bo de ni mngon sum nyid yin pa'i phyir
analyzed: yang dag pa'i skye ba la sogs pa sgro btags pa dang bral ba nyid kyis ma brtags na gcig tu nyams dga' ba'i dngos po'i ngo bo nyid kho na med pa'i sgrar brjod pa ma yin nam dngos po'i ngo bo de ni mngon sum nyid yin pa'i phyir
translated: When not examined, the nature of things is just what is delightful, and is not expressed by the word â€œnonexistent.â€

original: de'i ngo bo nyid du gyur pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyang mngon sum du gyur pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: de'i ngo bo nyid du gyur pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyang mngon sum du gyur pa kho na yin te /
translated: The nature of things is directly perceptible.

original: dper na bum pas dben par gyur pa'i sa phyogs dmigs pa na de'i bdag nyid du gyur ba bum pas dben pa rtogs pa lta bu'o //ğŸ”½gzhan du na grub pa dang bde ba tha mi dad pa nyid las nyams par 'gyur zhing de las kyang dngos po ni ngo bo nyid med par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: dper na bum pas dben par gyur pa'i sa phyogs dmigs pa na de'i bdag nyid du gyur ba bum pas dben pa rtogs pa lta bu'o // gzhan du na grub pa dang bde ba tha mi dad pa nyid las nyams par 'gyur zhing de las kyang dngos po ni ngo bo nyid med par mi 'gyur te /
translated: For example, when one observes a place devoid of a pot, one understands the absence of a pot, which is of the same nature as the place.ğŸ”½Otherwise, the established and the agreeable would be different, and that would undermine your position.

original: ngo bo nyid med pa nyid dang 'brel ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med pa nyid dang 'brel ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, things would not be natureless, because they would not be related to naturelessness.

original: de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel ba yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is there a relation of origination, because

original: de ni dngos po med pa nyid kyi 'bras bur mi rung ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni dngos po med pa nyid kyi 'bras bur mi rung ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not suitable to be the effect of the absence of an entity.

original: de bas na @237a * //
analyzed: de bas na @237a * //
translated: Therefore,

original: de byis pa rnams kyis mngon sum du rtogs pa ma yin pas mngon sum gyis gnod do //
analyzed: de byis pa rnams kyis mngon sum du rtogs pa ma yin pas mngon sum gyis gnod do //
translated: since it is not directly realized by the childish, it is undermined by direct perception.

original: de bzhin du dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa mi dmigs pas na bum pa bzhin du ngo bo nyid med pa ni med pa'i tha snyad du rung ba'i phyir med pa kho na ste des na rjes su dpag bas gnod do //
analyzed: de bzhin du dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa mi dmigs pas na bum pa bzhin du ngo bo nyid med pa ni med pa'i tha snyad du rung ba'i phyir med pa kho na ste des na rjes su dpag bas gnod do //
translated: In the same way, since the non-observation that is the characteristic of observation does not exist, like a pot, it is suitable to be designated as nonexistent because it lacks entityness, and therefore it is undermined by inference.

original: ri bong can la zla ba nyid ma yin pa dang 'dra bar skye bo gnag rdzi mo yan chad la ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du rtogs pa med pas grags pas gnod pa yang bzlog par dka'o zhe na /
analyzed: ri bong can la zla ba nyid ma yin pa dang 'dra bar skye bo gnag rdzi mo yan chad la ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du rtogs pa med pas grags pas gnod pa yang bzlog par dka'o zhe na /
translated: Just as the rabbit does not exist on the moon, since the absence of entityness is not realized by anyone from cowherds on up, it is difficult to reverse the undermining of what is renowned.

original: de ni bden pa ma yin te 'di ltar dngos po rnams kyi sgro btags pa'i rnam pas dben pa ni ngo bo nyid med par brjod la de yang dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo nyid 'dzin pas bzung ba yin na yang /
analyzed: de ni bden pa ma yin te 'di ltar dngos po rnams kyi sgro btags pa'i rnam pas dben pa ni ngo bo nyid med par brjod la de yang dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo nyid 'dzin pas bzung ba yin na yang /
translated: That is not so, because the absence of the superimposed aspect of things is said to be their lack of entityness, and that is apprehended by the apprehension of the entityness of things.

original: skad cig ma dang 'dra bar 'khrul bas de kho na nyid kyi skye ba'i rnam par sgro btags pas bsgribs pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir byis pa rnams kyis nges par bya bar mi nus la nges pa ma skyes pa des na mngon sum nyid med pa'i
analyzed: skad cig ma dang 'dra bar 'khrul bas de kho na nyid kyi skye ba'i rnam par sgro btags pas bsgribs pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir byis pa rnams kyis nges par bya bar mi nus la nges pa ma skyes pa des na mngon sum nyid med pa'i
translated: However, like a moment, it is an entityness that is obscured by the superimposition of the aspect of arising of reality because it cannot be ascertained by fools. Since that ascertainment has not arisen, it is not direct perception.

original: phyir mngon sum gyis gnod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: phyir mngon sum gyis gnod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore it is not undermined by direct perception.

original: de bzhin du bzung ba nyid yin na yang tha snyad bya bar mi rung ba'i phyir ma bzung ba'i dang 'dra ba nyid yin pas 'di ni dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du bzung ba nyid yin na yang tha snyad bya bar mi rung ba'i phyir ma bzung ba'i dang 'dra ba nyid yin pas 'di ni dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa ma yin te /
translated: Similarly, even if it were apprehended, it would be like not being apprehended because it is not suitable to be designated. Therefore this is not the definition of perception.
